loans.name: Siony

texts.en:
Siony is 45 years old and married with eight children. She earns a living by raising pigs in the Philippines. Siony is borrowing PHP 13,000 through NWTF to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock.

Siony has been in this business for 20 years and also earns additional income from a general store. She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream: to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her livestock

loans.name: Bebiana

texts.en: Bebiana is 40 years old, married and the mother of three children who works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 12,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell such as canned goods, personal care products, bread, soft-drinks, coffee, noodles, and sugar. Bebiana has borrowed and repaid five prior loans from NWTF and has been running her general store for seven years. She earns additional income by selling food. She hopes to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell.

loans.name: Exequila

texts.en:
Exequila is 54 years old, married and has eight children.

Exequila is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. Exequila requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Exequila has been raising pigs for seven years now, and has borrowed seven times in the past from NWTF to sustain them.

In the future, Exequila would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Nurgul

texts.ru: Нургул  успешно погасила кредит, использовав его по назначению.  Она благодарна Фонду Кива и всем, кто помог ей в финансировании. На сегодняшний день у Нургул в хозяйстве есть 3 коровы, 28 овец и лошадь. Среднемесячный доход Нургул составляет до 15,000 сом (KGS). Она вновь обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 65,000 сом (KGS) на покупку овец и дойной коровы. Доходы от кредита позволят Нургул улучшить ее благосостояние, развить бизнес и построить дом.
texts.en: Nurgul successfully paid back her previous loan, using it for it's intended purpose. She is thankful to Kiva and to all those who helped her finance her loan. Nurgul currently has 3 cows, 28 sheep and 1 horse on her farm. Nurgul's average monthly income is up to 15,000 som (KGS). She is again turning to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 65,000 som (KGS) to buy sheep and one milk cow. The earnings from the loan will allow Nurgrul to improve her well-being, develop her business and build a house.

loans.use: to buy sheep and one milk cow to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Tolkunbubu

texts.ru: Толкунбубу 55 лет, замужем, воспитала 3 детей. В 2012 году, в поисках источника дохода для своей семьи, Толкунбубу начала свой бизнес в животноводстве и полеводстве. Благодаря настойчивости и упорному труду, Толкунбубу сумела развить свой бизнес с ежемесячным доходом в 22,000 сом (KGS). В хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 14 овец. На 2,0 Га она выращивает люцерну. В целях увеличения поголовья скота, Толкунбубу обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 120,000 сом (KGS). Доходы от кредита Толкунбубу планирует вложить в дальнейшем - в развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Tolkunbubu is 55 years old, married and is raising three children. In 2012, in search of a source of income for her family, Tolkunbubu started her own business of livestock breeding and crop farming. Thanks to Tolkunbubu's persistence and hard work, she was able to develop her business to generate a monthly income of 22,000 som (KGS). She has 4 cows and 14 sheep on her farm. On a 2.0 hectare plot of land she grows alfalfa. Tolkunbubu turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum" for a 120,000 som (KGS) loan to increase the size of her herd. Tolkunbubu plans to invest the earnings from the loan in the further development of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional livestock to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Beishekan

texts.ru: Бейшекан, 53 года, замужем, мать 6 детей. У Бейшекан среднее образование. Она в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи занимается сельским хозяйством. У Бейшекан в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы, 2 нетели, 35 овец. На земельном участке мерою 2,80 ГА она выращивает картофель и клевер. Всю продукцию реализует оптовым покупателям. Бейшекан известна, как принципиальный, честный, порядочный и надежный человек. На сегодняшний день ее деятельность приносит ежемесячную прибыль в сумме 9,000 сом (KGS). Для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Бейшекан обратилась в Банк «Бай – Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 52,000 сом (KGS) на покупку скота. Доходы от кредита Бейшекан планирует использовать для дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства.
texts.en:
Beishekan is 53 and married with six children. She has a high school education and works in farming as an additional source of income for her family. She has four cows, two heifers and 35 sheep on her farm as well as 2.8 hectares of land where she grows potatoes and clover, which she sells to wholesale buyers. She is known as a principled, honest, straightforward and kind person. Her business currently brings in 9,000 KGS per month.

In order to further develop her farm, Beishekan has turned to Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 52,000 KGS to purchase livestock. She plans to use profits from the loan to further develop her business.

loans.use: to buy some livestock in order to increase her herd

loans.name: Telma Del Socorro

texts.es:
Telma del Socorro, tiene más de 12 años de apoyarse de los ingresos de su pulpería, para ayudar a su esposo con la manutención de su hogar, y gracias a los créditos ofrecidos por la microfinanciera Mi Crédito, ha podido invertir en su negocio logrando que sus ventas aumenten, así como ampliando su clientela e infraestructura. 
Por ello, solicita un crédito para la compra de granos básicos como arroz, frijoles, aceite, azúcar, golosinas, gaseosas, artículos de limpieza e higiene personal etc. El cual le será de ayuda porque podrá satisfacer la creciente demanda, y a la vez podrá ayudar con los ingresos, a su hijo menor, que estudia la secundaria.
texts.en:
Telma del Socorro has been supporting herself for more than 12 years with the income from her store. She has been able to help her husband support the household. Thanks to the loans offered by Mi Crédito micro-financing, she has been able to invest in her business, increasing sales and expanding her customer base and infrastructure.
 
That is why she is asking for a loan to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, snacks, sodas, cleaning and personal hygiene items, etc. This will help her because she will be able to meet the growing demand and also help her youngest son with the income, He is in secondary school.

loans.use: to buy basic grains such as rice, beans, oil, sugar, snacks, cleaning and personal hygiene items, etc.

loans.name: Lola

texts.ru: Лола 55 лет. Она жительница района Спитамен. Лола замужем и мать одного сына. Ее сын женат и имеет детей. Лола вместе семьей живет в районе Спитамен. У мужа и сына есть грузовик марки «ЗИЛ», и они занимается перевозом больших грузов. У Лолы есть 2.00 Га земельный участок. Они на 1.00 Га земли выращивают кукурузу, а, но остальное части земли выращивает рис. Лола параллельно  занимается шитьем национальной женской одежды у себя дома. Сейчас Лола обратилась за кредитом, чтобы купить крупнорогатого скота и начать новый бизнес. Она планирует купить скота, и откармливать их несколько месяцев, потом перепродавать их на скотном рынке, по этой причине она обратилась за кредитом. Ваша поддержка поможет ей достичь своих целей.
texts.en: Lola is 55 years old. She lives in the Spitamen District. Lola is married and is a mother to one son. Her son is married and has children. Lola and her family live in the Spitamen District. Her husband and son has a "ZIL"-brand freight truck which they use to transport large cargo. Lola has a 2.0 hectare plot of land - she grows corn on 1.0 hectares of it, and rice on the remaining portion. Lola simultaneously sews ethnic Tajik women's clothing out of her home. Now Lola is requesting a loan to buy cattle and start a new business. She plans to buy cattle, fatten them up for several months, then re-sell them at the cattle market. This is why she is taking out a loan. Your support will allow her to achieve her goals

loans.use: to buy cattle.

loans.name: Fredeswinda

texts.en: Fredeswinda is 63 years old, married and the mother of four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by buying and selling charcoal in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 15 years and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan from NWTF to buy additional boxes of charcoal to sell. In the future, Fredeswinda would like to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to buy additional boxes of charcoal to sell.

loans.name: Emelkan

texts.ru: Эмелкан, 63 года, вдова, 5 детей. У нее среднее образование, на пенсии, на протяжении 25 лет занимается животноводством. На сегодняшний день Эмелкан имеет хороший бизнес, у нее в хозяйстве есть 4 коровы и 6 овец. Ежемесячная совокупная прибыль составляет около 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств катастрофически не хватает на достойную жизнь. В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Эмелкан обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коровы с теленком для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита она планирует направлять в дальнейшее развитие ее бизнеса и улучшение благосостояния семьи.
texts.en: Emelkan is 63 years old, a widow, and has 5 children. She has a secondary education and is currently a pensioner. For the past 25 years, she has been practicing livestock breeding. Emelkan currently has a good business, as she has 4 cows and 6 sheep on her farm. Her average cumulative monthly income is 10,000 som (KGS). However, this amount is catastrophically not enough for a decent life. For the further development of her farm, Emelkan turned to Microfinance Bank "Bai Tushum." She is requesting a loan for 100,000 som (KGS) to buy a cow and a calf to increase the size of her herd. She plans to use the earnings from the loan for the further development of her business and to improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy one cow and a calf in order to increase the size of her herd.

loans.name: Juan Angel Maria

texts.es:
Ángel, de 78 años de edad, está casado y su esposa solo se dedica a los oficios domésticos, tienen 8 hijos, todos ya son independientes, en su casa viven 2 de sus nietos, porque sus padres emigraron al extranjero en búsqueda de un mejor futuro para sus hijos y para sus padres.

Ángel, es agricultor  desde que era niño, ya que su padre le enseño muy bien el oficio, a los 6 años de edad comenzó a trabajar en el campo junto a su padre, quien ya falleció pero le dejo un legado de trabajo y lucha, que al día de hoy no se le olvida.- Ángel, siempre recuerda con cariño a su padre.

Ángel, necesita el crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas para sembrar, porque ya se acerca la época de preparar la tierra para cultivarla.

Ángel, desea seguir trabajando para ayudar a sus nietos para que estudien y sean profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Angel is 78 years old and is married. His wife works only on domestic chores. They have 8 children who are all independent. He lives with 2 of their grandchildren because their parents emigrated abroad in search of better future for their children and their parents.

Angel has been a farmer since childhood. Since his father taught him the occupation well, he began working in the field with him at the age of 6. His father has since passed away but he left a legacy of work and struggle that he has not forgotten until this day. Angel always fondly remembers his father.

Angel requests a loan to buy fertilizers for planting, because the time to prepare the land for cultivation is approaching.

Angel wants to continue working to help their grandchildren to study and become successful professionals.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for plating.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en: Gemma is 50 years old, married and the mother of twelve children, five of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who earns a living by buying and selling crabs in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 8,000 loan from NWTF to buy more crab to sell in her food stall. She has successfully repaid a previous loan and has requested a new one to further build up her businesses. Gemma has been in her current line of work for several years, and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy more crab to sell.

loans.name: Carlota

texts.es:
Carlota, ha sabido invertir y administrar los créditos que se le otorgan, su negocio cada vez es más rentable, junto a su familia están teniendo una mejor alimentación, vestuario y salud.
En vista que sus demandas han crecido se ha decidido por solicitar un nuevo crédito para comprar arcilla, nacazcol, leña y barro, tendrá materia prima para elaborar las piezas de loza que sus clientes están solicitando.
texts.en:
Carlota has shown that she knows how to invest and manage the loans that have been previously granted to her. Her business is more profitable with each loan. Carlota and her family are enjoying better nutrition, better clothing, and better health.

In light of the fact that demands have increased, she has decided to request another loan to buy clay, nacazcol (organic black dye), firewood and mud. With this, she will have the raw materials to make pieces of pottery that her customers are requesting from her.

loans.use: to buy clay, organic black dye, firewood, and mud so that she will have the raw materials to make pieces of pottery that her customers are requesting from her.

loans.name: Generosa

texts.en: Generosa is 41 years old, married and the mother of two children, both of whom are in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur who runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15,000 loan from NWTF to buy items to sell, including candies, snacks, home care products and other groceries. Generosa has been in this business for five years and would like to save enough money to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell in her store.

loans.name: Diana Rosy

texts.es:
Diana, se ha caracterizado por ser una joven trabajadora y soñadora,  y a pesar de las dificultades ha sabido salir adelante. Tanto así que, en la actualidad está finalizando su carrera de Licenciatura en enfermería, con el sueño de pronto adquirir experiencia y desarrollarse en su profesión.  

La principal razón de Diana, para escoger esta carrera fue su enorme sentimiento de ayuda al prójimo. Por ello, solicita un crédito para la compra de una computadora que le servirá para mejorar su aprendizaje y pronto concluir su carrera. Además, planea continuar estudiando para poder complementar su carrera.
texts.en:
Diana has been characterized for being young, hardworking and a dreamer. Despite difficulties, she has managed to succeed. She is currently completing the curriculum to be certified in nursing. She dreams of gaining experience and that it develops into her profession soon.

The main reason for Diana to choose this career was her strong feeling to help others. Therefore, she requests a loan to purchase a computer that will serve to enhance her learning and to conclude her studies soon. She also plans to continue studying to complement her career.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Mayra Lisseth

texts.es:
Mayra, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta quinto grado, está acompañada y su pareja es agricultor y también trabaja como ayudante de albañil, tienen 2 hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad.

Mayra, trabaja en una tortillería desde hace más de un año, tomo la decisión de apoyar a su pareja con los gastos del hogar, esta actividad la realiza desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 2 de la tarde, después se dedica a cuidar a sus hijos, su mamá le ayuda a cuidarlos mientras ella trabaja.
 
Mayra, necesita el crédito para mejorar su vivienda, porque está en malas condiciones actualmente y con el esfuerzo de su trabajo, su pareja y un hermano, han logrado comprar parte del material que necesitan para la remodelación de su casa, pero aún no es suficiente, es por eso que decidieron solicitar el crédito. 

Mayra, desea ver su vivienda mejorada, ya que reducirán los riesgos que ocasiona el invierno y darles la educación necesaria para que sean profesionales de éxito.
texts.en:
Mayra is 26 years old, and she studied in school through the fifth grade. She is in a relationship, and her partner is a farmer and also works as a bricklayer's assistant. They have 2 children, ages 3 and 6.

Mayra has worked in a tortilla shop for over a year. She decided to help her partner with the household expenses. She works in this occupation from 8 in the morning until 2 in the afternoon. After work, she takes care of her children. Mayra's mother helps take care of her children while she works.
 
Mayra needs a loan to improve her home because it's in bad shape currently. From the combined effort of her work, her partner, and a brother, they have managed to buy some of the materials they need for the renovation of her house, but it's still not enough. For this reason, they decided to request a loan.

Mayra would like to see her house improved, since this will reduce the associated risks of winter, as well as give the necessary education to her children so that they will be successful professionals.

loans.use: to improve her house because it's in bad shape.

loans.name: Masacourou's Group

texts.fr: Masacourou,assit  au centre sur la photo, porte un vêtement noir, elle tiens le drapeau myAgro , est membre d'un groupe de 4 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Kamale, au sud-ouest de Bamako, au Mali. Masacourou, qui est âgé de 62 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 26 personnes dont 16 enfants . La pratique agricole est pour elle l'une des activités le plus rentable au monde  et  l'agriculture lui permet de nourrir  sa famille. Elle a decidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour avoir un meilleur rendement et savoir beaucoup sur les nouvelles techniques et pratiques agricole. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Masacourou a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champs de 0.0625 hectare. A travers cet achat, Masacourou espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements, faire du commerce après l'hivernage et acheter des vetements pour sa fille qui doit se marrier afin de pouvoir à l'abri de la faim.
texts.en:
Masacourou, the one seated in the middle of the photo wearing a black outfit and holding a myAgro banner, belongs to a group uniting four farmers who work and live in the village of Kamale, to the southeast of Bamako in Mali. Masacourou, 62 years old, lives in a family composed of 26 people, 16 of them children. For her, farming is the type of work that pays off and allows her to feed her family. She has decided to join myAgro in order to have a better yield and learn more about modern agricultural techniques and practices. 

For her first year with myAgro, Masacourou has bought a pack of OPV  [Open Pollinated Variety] seeds and fertilizers in order to grow peanuts on her field of 0.0625 ha [0.15 acres]. Thanks to this purchase, Masacourou hopes to increase her harvest, sell her crops after the dry season, buy clothing for her daughter who is about to get married, and keep her family safe from hunger.

loans.use: to buy seeds and fertilizers to grow peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to improve his mother’s house because it is in poor condition and needs repairs.

loans.name: Senindje's Group

texts.fr: Senindje qui se trouve sur la photo au troisième rang à droite, et qui porte le foulard blanc et montrant la pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 30 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Mena au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Senindje, âgée de 55 ans, est la mère de 12 enfants âgés de 15 à 30 ans, aucun d’entre eux n’est actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Senindje à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Senindje cultive l'arachide, le sorgho, le fonio sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et d'herbicides. Senindje entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison du système de paiement  et de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. Cette année Senindje effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 40ans que Senindje cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur commerciale, car l’arachide est un aliment qu’elle vend sur le marché. Senindje planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire du commerce d'arachide et du riz et d'acheter des bœufs. Enfin Senindje espère aussi pouvoir acheter une machine pour transformer le karité.
texts.en:
Senindje is to the right of the third row, wearing a white scarf and showing the myAgro pouch. She is a member of a group of 30 farmers enrolled in myAgro, living and working in the village of Mena, south-east of Bamako, Mali.

Senindje is a 55-year-old mother of 12 children aged 15 to 30 years, none of whom are currently enrolled in school.

The family tradition is anchored in farming, which provides the main source of income and nutritional self-sufficiency for the home. This is what prompted Senindje to pursue this farming activity over the past 40 years, to ensure her own family's self-sufficiency.

Senindje cultivates groundnuts, sorghum and fonio on her plot, but as a farmer must face difficulties such as the lack of agricultural machinery and herbicides. She is in her first year with myAgro, and enrolled because of the payment system and the prospect of increasing crop yields through services offered by myAgro.

This year Senindje is making payments to buy a pack of myAgro OPV seeds and fertilizer to cultivate groundnuts and increase the yield on her 0.125 hectare plot (0.31 acres). Senindje has been cultivating groundnuts for the past 40 years for its commercial value, since groundnuts are what she sells at the market.

With her increased yields and revenue Senindje is planning to trade groundnuts and rice, and purchase oxen. Finally Senindje also hopes to buy a machine to process shea nuts.

loans.use: buy a packet of OPV seeds and fertilizer to grow groundnuts

loans.name: Seriba's Group

texts.fr: Seriba qui se trouve sur la photo au dernier rang à droite, et qui lève son doigt, est membre d’un groupe de 12 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Sakoro au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Seriba, âgé de 40 ans, est le père de 8 enfants âgés de 4 à 21ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosufficance pour sa famille, ont incité Seriba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 25ans. Seriba cultive le maïs, le mil, le sorgho, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agriculteur à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles et de pluie. Seriba entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrit en raison de l'image positive de myAgro dans les villages avoisinants et du système de paiement. Cette année Seriba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.25 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 15ans que Seriba cultive le maïs pour sa valeur vivrière. Seriba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  de faire de l'arboriculture et de faire de l'élevage. Enfin , Seriba espère aussi pouvoir construire une maison pour la famille.
texts.en: Seriba is on the right, in the last row, and has his finger raised. He is a member of a group of 12 farmers who collaborate with myAgro and who live and work in Sakoro, in the south-west of Bamako in Mali. Seriba is 40 years old and has eight children between the ages of four and 21 of whom four attend school at present. Farming is firmly established in family tradition. It is the principal source of income and the means to alimentary autonomy for the family. These are the reasons why Seriba has been working in this profession for the last 25 years. Seriba grows corn, millet, sorghum, and rice on his plot of land, but as a farmer, he is confronted with difficulties such as the lack of agricultural equipment and the rarity of rainfall. This is Seriba's first year of collaboration with myAgro. He registered with them due to the positive image of myAgro that he perceived in neighbouring villages and because of their payment system. This year Seriba makes the payments to buy a packet of myAgro seeds and fertiliser for the culture of corn in order to improve productivity on his plot of 0.25 hectares. Seriba has been cultivating corn for 15 years now for its food-producing qualities. With the increase in his yield and of his income, Seriba plans to start tree growing and livestock farming. Finally, Seriba also hopes to be able to build a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy a packet of seeds and fertiliser for the culture of corn.

loans.name: Fatou's Group

texts.fr: Fatou qui se trouve  au centre sur la photo, elle est assit et tiens le drapeau de MyAgro, est membre d’un groupe d'agriculteurs de 20 personnes inscrits à myAgro, vivent et travaillent dans le village de Balandougou au sud-ouest de Bamako au Mali. Fatou, âgée de 56 ans, est la mère de 15 enfants. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Fatou à exercer cette activité. Fatou cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles. Fatou entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Fatou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle. Fatou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Fatou planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu pour mettre fin au commerce de bois qu'elle pratique actuellement et consacre le reste de sa vie aux activités agricoles. Enfin Fatou espère aussi pouvoir élargir son champ d'arachide.
texts.en:
Fatou, who is found seated in the center of the photo holding a MyAgro flag, is a member of a group of 20 farmers who have joined MyAgro. They live and work in the village of Balandougou in the south west of Bamako in Mali. Fatou is 56 years old and is the mother of 15 children.  

Fatou started farming because it is a family tradition, a good source of income and provides for her family's food needs. She grows groundnuts on her piece of land but does so with difficulty because she lacks farming supplies. She has began her first year with MyAgro and joined because the conviction of the MyAgro agents and the benefits of using the MyAgro method. This year Fatou wants to make payments to buy a pack of myAgro OPV seeds and fertilizer to farm groundnuts and increase her yield. 

Fatou grows groundnuts because of their nutritional value and because you can eat them directly or use them as a sauce base in cooking. She plans, with an increase in yields and earnings, to stop working with timber and focus solely on farming. 

Finally, she wishes to also expand her groundnut field.

loans.use: to buy a pack of OPV seeds and fertilizer to grow groundnuts

loans.name: Modibo's Group

texts.fr: Modibo, assit sur la photo et porte un t-shirt bleu marin, il tiens le calendrier de MyAgro, est membre d'un groupe de 10 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Kakele, au sud-ouest de Bamako, au Mali. Modibo, qui est âgé de 58 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 14 personnes dont 8 enfants . L’agriculture lui permet de vivre dans la quiétude et de gérer certain de ses problèmes. Il a decidé de s'inscrire à myAgro pour nouvelles méthodes et techniques agricoles. Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Modibo a acheté un paquet de semences hybrides  et d'engrais pour la culture de maïs pour son champs de 1 hectare. A travers cet achat, Modibo espère pouvoir augmenter ses rendements et acheter du nouveau matériel agricole afin de pouvoir améliorer sa santé et l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Modibo is sitting in the photo and wearing a navy blue T-shirt. He is holding the MyAgro calendar and is a member of a group of 10 farmers who work and live in the village of Kakele, to the south-west of Bamako, Mali.

Modibo, who is 58 years old, lives in a family of 14 people, including 8 children. Agriculture allows him to live in peace and manage some of his problems.

He decided to enroll in myAgro to try out new agricultural methods and techniques. In his first year with myAgro Modibo bought a package of hybrid seeds and fertilizer to grow maize on his one hectare field (2.47 acres).

Through this purchase Modibo hopes to increase his crop yield and buy new farm equipment, to improve his children's health and education.

loans.use: buy a package of hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the corn crop

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.fr: Mariam, qui se trouve debout  sur la photo au dernier rang à droite, et qui porte un foulard rose, tenant la pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 27 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Dogo au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Mariam, âgée de 29 ans, est la mère de 4 enfants âgés de 3 à 12 ans, tous sont actuellement scolarisés sauf le dernier. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer, mais aussi l'agriculture lui permet d'assurer l'autosuffisance pour sa famille, ont incité Mariam à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant plus de 10 ans. Mariam cultive l'arachide sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le retard dans les semis. Mariam entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite  en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro et de l'accès au marché. Cette année Mariam effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans au moins que Mariam cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière. Mariam planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu, d’avoir de bœufs de labour et des matériels agricoles ( charrue).
texts.en: Mariam is standing on the right in the last row, and is wearing a pink headscarf and holding a myAgro envelope. She is a member of a group of 27 farmers who collaborate with myAgro and who live and work in Dogo, in the south-west of Bamako in Mali. Mariam is 29 years old and has four children between the ages of three and 12, of whom all but the youngest attend school at present. Farming is firmly established in family tradition. It is the principal source of income and the means to alimentary autonomy for the family, it also permits her to ensure self-sufficiency for her family. These are the reasons why Mariam has been working in this profession for the last 10 years. Mariam grows peanuts on her plot of land, but as a farmer, she is confronted with difficulties such as delayed planting. This is Mariam's first year of collaboration with myAgro. She registered with them due to the perspective of being capable of increasing her yield through the services proposed by myAgro and access to the market. This year Mariam makes the payments to buy a packet of myAgro OPV (open-pollinated variety) seeds and fertiliser for the culture of peanuts in order to improve productivity on her plot of 0.0625 hectares. Mariam has been cultivating peanuts for at least 10 years for its food-producing qualities. With the increase in her yield and of her income, Mariam plans to acquire bullocks for labouring and farming equipment (plough).

loans.use: to buy a packet of OPV (open-pollinated variety) seeds and fertiliser for the culture of peanuts.

loans.name: Marama's Group

texts.fr: Marama qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à gauche, et qui porte un foulard noir et blanc, elle tiens le drapeau myAgro , est membre d’un groupe de 6 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Niagadina au sud de Bamako au Mali. Marama, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère de 12 enfants âgés de 12 à 35 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Marama à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 50 ans. Marama cultive l'arachide et le sorgho sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque d'engrais de qualité et de matériels agricoles. Marama entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. De plus, Marama souligne l'impact positif qu'ont eu dans le passé le système de paiement, la qualité des engrais, et les semences myAgro dans son quotidien d'agricultrice. Cette année Marama effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant plusieurs années que Marama cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce.
texts.en:
Marama, who is on the left in the photo wearing a black and white scarf and holding a myAgro flag, is a member of a group of six farmers who have joined myAgro. The group members live and work in the village of Niagadina in the south of Bamako in Mali. Marama is 50 years old and a mother of 12 children, aged from 12 to 35 years old. Three of the children have been to school. 

Marama has been farming for 50 years, because it is a family tradition, a main source of income, and provides for her household's food needs. She grows groundnuts and sorghum on her piece of land but has trouble because she lacks quality fertilizer and farming supplies. 

Marama has been with myAgro for two years and she has rejoined because of the possibility to increase her yield from the services myAgro can provide. In addition, Marama highlights the positive benefits from the previous payment system, the quality of the fertilizer, and the myAgro seeds in her daily farming. This year, Marama would like to make payments to buy a pack of myAgro fertilizer so that she can grow groundnuts and increase her yield on her piece of .125 hectare land. 

It has now been many years that Marama started growing groundnuts because of their nutritional value, which are directly consumable by the family and is used as a sauce.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to grow groundnuts

loans.name: Mariam's Group

texts.fr: Mariam, qui se trouve sur la photo au deuxième rang à gauche, et qui porte un tshirt multicolore, est membre d’un groupe de 9 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivant et travaillant dans le village de Tabacoro-Tian au sud-est de Bamako au Mali. Mariam, âgée de 35 ans, est la mère de 8 enfants âgés de 7 à 22 ans, dont 4 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Mariam à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 10 ans. Mariam cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et d'engrais de qualité. Mariam entame sa première année avec myAgro, et s'est inscrite en raison de la conviction des agents myAgro sur les bénéfices apportés par la méthode myAgro. Cette année Mariam effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.0625 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 10 ans que Mariam cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Mariam planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d’assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire de la famille ainsi que  améliorer les conditions de vie au village.
texts.en:
Mariam, appearing in the second row at the left in the photo and wearing a multi-colored T-shirt, is a member of nine farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Tabacoro-Tian, southeast of Bamako, in Mali. She is 35 years old and the mother of eight children, aged 7 to 22, of whom four are currently in school. 

Mariam is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food security at home. So she was encouraged to do this work for 10 years now. She grows peanuts and rice on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of rain and of quality fertilizers. 

Mariam is starting her first year with myAgro and signed up because of the conviction of the myAgro representatives regarding the benefits that myAgro methods bring. This year, she is making payments to purchase a myAgro packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her parcel of 0.0625 hectare. She has been growing peanuts for 10 years for its value as a staple food. She explains that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and are used as a base for cooking sauces.

With an increase in yields and in her income, Mariam is planning on ensuring her family’s self-sufficiency in food, as well as improving living conditions in the village.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of OPV seeds and some fertilizer for growing peanuts

loans.name: Koumba's Group

texts.fr: Koumba qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, et qui portent le foulard noir et montrant la pochette myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 7agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Molobala au sud de Bamako au Mali. Koumba, âgée de 36 ans, est la mère de 3 enfants âgés de 22 à 25 ans, dont 3 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Koumba à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 26 ans. Koumba cultive l'arachide, le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles. Koumba entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. De plus, Koumba souligne l'impact positif qu'ont eu dans le passé le système de paiement, la qualité des engrais, et les semences myAgro dans son quotidien d'agricultrice. Cette année Koumba effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 26 ans que Koumba cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Koumba planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu de pouvoir acheter des bœufs et une charrue pour bien préparer l'avenir de ses enfants et d'aider aussi son mari dans le cadre des dépenses familiales.
texts.en:
Koumba, appearing in the first row at the far right in the photo, wearing a black scarf and showing a myAgro wallet, is a member of seven farmers signed up with myAgro. They live and work in the village of Molobala, south of Bamako, in Mali. She is 36 years old and the mother of three children, aged 22 to 25, of whom three are currently in school. 

Koumba is rooted in the family tradition of farming, the main source of income and of food security at home. So she was encouraged to do this work for 26 years now. She grows peanuts and rice on her parcel of land. But, as a farmer, she must cope with difficulties, such as the lack of farm supplies. 

Koumba has started her second year with myAgro and signed up because of her aim of increasing her yields through the services offered by myAgro. In addition, she emphasizes the positive impact that the payment system, quality of fertilizers, and myAgro seeds have all had in her life in farming. 

This year, she is making payments to purchase a packet of myAgro fertilizer for growing peanuts, so as to increase her yields on her parcel of 0.125 hectare. She has been growing peanuts for 26 years for its value as a staple food. She explains that peanuts are directly consumable by the family and is used as a base for cooking sauces.

With an increase in yields and in her income, Koumba is planning on purchasing some cattle and a cart to make for a better future for her children and also to help out her husband with regard to family expenses.

loans.use: to purchase a packet of fertilizer for growng peanuts

loans.name: Tenibadie's Group

texts.fr: Tenibadie,  au deuxième rang à droite sur la photo et soulevant le drapeau de myAgro, est membre d'un groupe de 10 producteurs agricoles qui travaillent et vivent dans le village de Siembougou, au sud-est de Bamako, au Mali. Tenibadie, qui est âgée de 60 ans, vit dans une famille composée de 8 enfants. L’agriculture lui permet d’assurer l'autosuffisance alimentaire pour toute sa famille.  Pour sa première année avec myAgro, Tenibadie a acheté un paquet de semences OPV et d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide pour son champ de 0.125 hectare. Elle dit qu’elle a de l’espoir dans l’avenir de myAgro. A travers cet achat, Tenibadie espère pouvoir élargir mon champ d'arachide l'année prochaine afin de pouvoir être un exemple pour le village et que les autres femmes puissent s'en inspirer.
texts.en:
Tenibadie, second in from the right of the photo and holding the myAgro flag, is a member of a group of 10 agricultural producers who work and live in the village of Siembougou, in the south-east of Bamako, Mali.  She is 60 years old and lives in a family with 8 children.  Agriculture gives her assurance that she can provide food for herself and the whole family. 

In her first year with myAgro, Tenibadie bought a packet of OPV seeds and fertilizer to grow peanut plants in her 0.125 hectare field.  She says that she has a hope for the future of myAgro.  With this loan, Tenibadie hopes to be able to enlarge her peanut field next year to create an example for the village and to inspire the other women.

loans.use: to buy a packet of Open Pollinated Variety (OPV) and fertilizer to grow peanut plants

loans.name: Norodjin's Group

texts.fr: Norodjin qui se trouve sur la photo au centre, et qui tiens le drapeau myAgro, est membre d’un groupe de 7agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro qui vivent et travaillent dans le village de Manambougou au sud de Bamako au Mali. Norodjin, âgée de 50 ans, est la mère d'un enfant âgé de 30 ans, il est actuellement scolarisé. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Norodjin à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Norodjin cultive l'arachide,le mil, les haricots, le gombo sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de pluie et de matériels agricoles. Norodjin entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison 0. De plus, Norodjin souligne l'impact positif qu'ont eu dans le passé le système de paiement, la qualité des engrais, et les semences myAgro dans son quotidien d'agricultrice. Cette année Norodjin effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 40 ans que Norodjin cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable par la famille et est utilisée comme sauce de base dans l’alimentation. Norodjin planifie avec l’augmentation de ses rendements et de son revenu  d'acheter des bœufs et une charrue. Enfin Norodjin espère aussi pouvoir subvenir aux besoins de la famille
texts.en:
Norodjin, the one in the middle of the photo holding a myAgro banner, belongs  to a group of seven farmers, all affiliated with myAgro, who live and work in the Manambougou village to the south of Bamako in Mali. Norodjin is 50 years old. Her 30-year old son studies.  Norodjin's family has been traditionally engaged in farm work. Norodjin too has been doing farming for some 40 years. This work is the main source of income allowing to provide food for her household. Norodjin grows peanuts, millet, beans and gumbo [ocra] on her field. Her challenges are insufficient rainfall and the lack of farming supplies. Norodjin is in her second year with myAgro; she has renewed her membership because of a positive experience in the past with the payment system and the quality of fertilizers and seeds obtained through myAgro. 

This year Norodjin is making payments to buy a pack of myAgro fertilizers in order to increase the yield of peanuts on her field of 0.125 ha [0.3 acres]. It's been 40 years now that Norodjin grows peanuts for their nutritional properties. She explains that peanuts can be directly consumed by her family and also used in a basic sauce for cooking.  Thanks to a bigger harvest and higher revenues, Norodjin plans to buy some cattle and a plough. Finally, she hopes to be able to provide for her family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for growing peanuts.

loans.name: Diatou's Group

texts.fr: Diatou qui se trouve sur la photo au premier rang à droite, et qui porte le drapeau myAgro autour de son cou, est membre d’un groupe de 7 agriculteurs inscrits à myAgro, vivent et travaillent dans le village de Molobala au sud de Bamako au Mali. Diatou, âgée de 60 ans, est la mère de 9 enfants âgés de 13 à 40 ans, dont 9 d’entre eux sont actuellement scolarisés. L’ancrage de la tradition familiale dans la pratique agricole, source principale de revenu et de l’autosuffisance alimentaire du foyer a incité Diatou à exercer cette activité depuis maintenant 40 ans. Diatou cultive l'arachide et le riz sur sa parcelle mais doit faire face en tant qu’agricultrice à des difficultés telles que le manque de matériels agricoles. Diatou entame sa deuxième année avec myAgro, et s'est reinscrite en raison de la perspective de pouvoir augmenter son rendement à travers les services proposés par myAgro. De plus, Diatou souligne l'impact positif qu'ont eu dans le passé le système de paiement, la qualité des engrais, et les semences myAgro dans son quotidien d'agricultrice. Cette année Diatou effectue des paiements pour acheter un paquet myAgro d'engrais pour la culture d'arachide afin d’augmenter ses rendements sur sa parcelle de 0.125 hectare. Cela fait maintenant 40 ans que Diatou cultive l'arachide pour sa valeur vivrière, expliquant que l’arachide est directement consommable.
texts.en:
Diatou is shown in the photo in the first row to the right and is wearing the myAgro flag around her neck. She is a member of a group of seven farmers registered with myAgro and they live and work in the village of Molobala, south of Bamako in Mali. Diatou is 60 years old and is a mother of nine children, ages 13 to 40 years old, nine of which are currently in school. 

The deep roots of the family tradition of agriculture, the main source of revenue and self-sufficiency for their home, incited Diatou to work in this business for the last 40 years. Diatou grows peanuts and rice on her plot of land, but must cope with difficulties such as the lack of farming materials. 

Diatou is starting on her second year with myAgro and reregistered because of the possibility to increase her yield through the services offered by myAgro. 
Additionally, Diatou emphasizes the positive impact that the payment system, the quality of fertilizer and the myAgro seeds have had in the past in her daily farming. 

This year, Diatou is making payments to buy a myAgro package of fertilizer for growing peanuts in order to increase her yields on her plot of .125 hectares. Diatou has been growing peanuts for 40 years for their consumption value, explaining that peanuts are directly edible.

loans.use: to buy a package of fertilizer for growing peanuts.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy materials to repair the sanitary service in his home and ensure that the bathroom is hygienic.

loans.name: Alexi Alejandrina

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Andrés De Vera De Miraflores.
En este lugar vive la señora Alexi, tiene 38 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 9 años que estudia en escuela. El marido trabaja en el Municipio local.
Doña Alexi es una mujer que le gusta a base de trabajo salir adelante, ella tiene una pequeña tienda de víveres en su casa, allí vende productos de primera necesidad, gaseosas, helados entre otros productos  trabaja todos los días desde las 6h00 hasta las 20h00, a pesar de que su negocio no es muy grande este le ayuda mucho y ha podido ir mejorándolo gracias a los créditos que ha recibido del grupo, está muy agradecida por que le dan la oportunidad para ganarse la vida, lleva más de 5 años con este negocio el cual le permite salir adelante.
Este crédito lo va a emplear en surtir más su tienda con toda clase de víveres. Lleva 4 ciclos en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por los servicios que ofrece la institución. Sus sueños son mejorar su tienda y tener mayor variedad de productos.
texts.en:
The members of the “Andrés de Vera de Miraflores” Credit Group meet every fifteen days in Andrés de Vera Parish in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as “The City of the Royal Tamarind trees”. Alexi lives here. She is 38 years old and she maintains a common-law-marriage, from which she has a 9-year-old daughter who is studying in school. Her husband works in the local municipality.  

Alexi is a woman who likes working to get ahead. She has a small grocery store in her house, where she sells staple goods, soft drinks, and ice cream, among other products. She works every day from 6:00 A.M. until 8:00 P.M.  Although her business is not very big, it helps her very much, and she has been able to go on improving it, thanks to the loans that she has received from the group.  She is very grateful because they give her the opportunity to earn a living.  She has had this business for more than five years, and it allows her to get ahead. 

She is going to use this loan to further stock her store with all kinds of supplies. She has been in the credit group for four cycles, and she likes it for the services that the institution offers.  

Her dreams are to improve her store and have a greater variety of products.

loans.use: to purchase supplies.

loans.name: Jose Horacio

texts.es:
José, con el préstamo anterior pudo tener los recursos necesarios para ampliar su negocio y generar ingresos extras los cuales ha invertido en mejorar las circunstancias familiares y en mantener un buen record crediticio, hasta la fecha no ha tenido problemas para seguir trabajando y se encuentra muy saludable.
Requiere de un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que dará el trato adecuado a sus cultivos de granos básicos, así seguirá trabajando,
texts.en:
With his previous loan, José was able to increase the size of his business and generate extra income that he invested in improving his family's living conditions and maintaining his good credit record. Up to now, he has not had any problems continuing with his work and is in good health.

He needs a new loan to buy agricultural inputs that he will use for adequate care of his crop of basic grains, so that he can continue his work.

loans.use: to buy agricultural inputs that he will use for his crop of basic grains.

loans.name: Karina Zelmira

texts.es:
Karina Zelmira tiene 44 años de edad, vive en casa de familiares junto a su mamá y cuatro hijos de 4 y 21 años de edad, en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada en la Provincia de Chiclayo que pertenece a la Región Lambayeque, costa norte del Perú.

Ella se dedica a la venta de productos de belleza y ropa al contado y al crédito, tiene clientes de las zonas aledañas. Ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de variedad de cosméticos para ofrecer a sus clientes y de esta manera generar mayores ingresos para su familia lo que le permitirá mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Karina Zelmira is 44 years old, and lives in the home of relatives with her mother and 4 children, ages 4 to 21. She lives in the district of Cayaltí, a community devoted to agriculture, commerce, and livestock-raising, located in the province of Chiclayo, which belongs to the Lambayeque Region of Peru’s northern coast.

She sells beauty products and clothing for cash and on credit, and she has customers in the neighboring zones.  She has requested a loan for the purchase of a variety of cosmetics to offer to her customers, and in this way, generate more income for her family, which will allow her to improve their quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics to offer to her customers.

loans.name: Phorn

texts.en:
Phorn is a 36-year-old married homemaker with three children. She resides in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Two of her children attend school and one child is a factory worker. Her husband is 45 years old, and he is also a construction foreman. Together, they can earn around $20 per day. 

Now, Phorn would like to apply for a loan to build a bathroom with a toilet. With this loan she will be able to have enough finances to build a bathroom for using, and to live in hygienic conditions. In the future, she wants to save money to build a proper house, and support her children to finish high school.

loans.use: to build a bathroom with a toilet.

loans.name: Sherlina

texts.en:
Sherlina is a married woman, who is 52 years old and has six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Sherlina has a pig fattening business in the Philippines. She requested a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her business. Sherlina has been in this business for eight years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her business.

loans.name: Juan Pablo

texts.es:
Juan, convive con su esposa y dos hijos de 3 y 6 años de edad, como persona responsable de cubrir todas las necesidades familiares se dedica a atender su negocio de cultivo de granos básicos y crianza de gado, al desarrollar dicha actividad puede generar ingresos para subsistir con su familia, toda su vida se ha dedicado a realizar dicha actividad, sus hermanos le apoyan en los diferentes trabajos agrícolas y la desarrolla durante todo el año, ya que cuenta con un sistema de riego.
Necesita recursos económicos para comprar abono, insecticidas, semilla, herbicidas y otros materiales con los que podrá darle un buen trato a sus cultivos, espera ampliar el área de cultivo y obtener una cosecha abundante para generar más ingresos y resarcir su deuda. Los riesgos del negocio son las plagas y las enfermedades que pueden afectar el ganado.
Las aspiraciones que tiene Juan son continuar trabajando para poder cubrir los gastos de los estudios a sus hijos y remodelar su vivienda.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and two children – three and six years old. As the person responsible for covering all of the family’s needs, he makes a living through his business harvesting basic grains and raising cattle. As this activity develops, he can earn an income in order to get by with his family.   

He has spent his whole life dedicated to this business. His brothers support him in various farming activities, and he works on it throughout the year – as it already has an irrigation system. 

Juan needs financial resources to buy fertilizer, insecticides, seeds, herbicides and other materials – with which he will treat his crops. He hopes to expand his growing area for crops and obtain a more abundant harvest to earn more profits and pay his debt. The risks of the business are pests and other diseases that can affect his livestock. 

Juan’s aspirations are to continue working in order to be able to cover the cost of his children’s studies and to remodel his home.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, seeds, herbicides and other materials to treat his crops.

loans.name: Idalia Del Socorro

texts.es:
El inglés se ha convertido en el idioma universal por excelencia, gracias a este lenguaje las personas tienen más oportunidades de crecimiento personal y profesional. Estas fueron algunas de las razones por las que Idalia decidió estudiar como carrera universitaria Licenciatura en Inglés.  
Ella es una joven trabajadora y luchadora, pues divide su tiempo para rendir en la universidad y en su trabajo de asistente administrativo. Sin embargo, aún no cuenta con una computadora, por esto solicita un crédito para comprar la computadora, ya que le servirá como principal herramienta para su aprendizaje.
texts.en:
English is turning into the universal language for excellence. Thanks to this language, people have more opportunities for personal and professional growth. These were some of the reasons why Idalia decided to study for a degree in English as a university major.

She is a young and determined hard worker. She divides her time to take exams at the university and to work as an administrative assistant. However, she does not have a computer, and for this reason she is requesting a loan to buy a computer which will serve as a principle tool in her learning.

loans.use: to buy a computer.

loans.name: Aparicio

texts.es:
El sr. Aparicio tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y tiene 4 hijos (37-35-32-28)años. Dentro de los sueños y esperanzas de Don Aparicio están el mejoramiento de su casa e instalar un reservorio en su parcela; el préstamo esta dirigido para compra de abono orgánico de tara el sr. Aparicio tiene 38 años en el negocio del manejo forestal de tara y cuenta con certificado orgánico.
le gusta porqué presenta dos cosechas durante el año y las plantas antiguas que ya no cargan son utilizadas como leña en la preparación de sus alimentos.
texts.en:
Señor Aparicio is 60 years old, and he is married with 4 children, ages 37, 35, 32, and 28. Among the dreams and hopes of Don Aparicio is the improvement of his home by installing a reservoir on his parcel of land. 

This loan will be used to buy organic fertilizer to grow tara (a Peruvian plant). Aparicio has 38 years of experience in the business of tara forestry management, and he is certified as organic. He likes it because there are two harvests during the year, and the old plants that don't bear fruit anymore are used as firewood to prepare food.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer to grow tara (a Peruvian plant).

loans.name: Leak

texts.en:
Leak is a 22-year-old single waiter at a hotel who resides in the Siem Reap Province Cambodia. He has been working as a waiter since 2014, earning approximately $5 per day. 

Leak is also pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in tourism at a university in the province. Due to the fact that he lacks the finances to pay his second year university fees, he would like to request a loan. With this loan, he will be able to go through the second year at the university successfully. For his dreams, he wants to save money to run his own business, so he will be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his second year university fees.

loans.name: Cristina

texts.en:
Cristina is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Cristina is 37 years old and three of her children are currently in school.

Cristina has a meat vending business in the Philippines. She requested a 18,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy additional meat to sell in her food stall. She has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional meat to sell in her food stall.

loans.name: Catarina

texts.es:
Catarina es una mujer de 50 años de edad, está casada tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre catorce y veintitrés años,  ellos viven en una comunidad de Sololá.
Catarina con el propósito de generar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la venta de Maxan y hojas de pacaya, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde hace 25 años.
Catarina es una madre de familia muy responsable, que prioriza las necesidades de su familia, y ahora se ha dado cuenta que una de las más necesarias es la construcción de dos  dormitorios donde sus hijos puedan acomodarse mejor, aunque ella tiene una dificultad: que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente, por tal razón solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, cal, arena, hierro y block para construir los dos cuartos.
El gran sueño de Catarina es que sus hijos tengan sus propios cuartos donde puedan hacer mejor sus tareas y que sean grandes profesionales, pero también que su producto lo pueda comercializar en la cuidad capital de su país.
texts.en: Catarina is a 50 year old woman. She is married and has a beautiful family of four children whose ages are between fourteen and twenty three years. They live in the community of Sololá. In order to generate income and support her husband with household expenses, Catarina works selling maxan (leaves for wrapping tamales) and pacaya leaves. She has been working in this for 25 years. Catarina is a very responsible family mother who prioritizes the needs of her family. Now she has noticed that one of the most important needs is to build two rooms where her children can feel more comfortable. She has an obstacle, though: she does not have enough money. For this reason she is requesting a loan that she will use to buy cement, lime, sand, iron and blocks to build two rooms. Catarina's greatest dream is for her children to have their own room so they can do their homework better, and for them to become professionals; and also that she is able to sell her product in the capital city of her country.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, sand, iron and blocks to build to rooms.

loans.name: Srikandi 1 Group

texts.en:
The Srikandi 1 group is making their repayments. The meeting was attended only by the treasurer and Ni Nyoman who is a member. The other members had a religious ceremony at the temple. During the meeting, Ni Nyoman shared her experiences. She can manage the pigs well because she gives them nutritious feed and vitamins. The finance officer is controlling the pigs every month. The group also voluntary contributes to their savings and gives it to the finance officer to keep it at MUK.

To increase the population of pigs, the Srikandi 1 group decided to take another loan from MUK. This loan will be used to buy superior or local piglets, feed, and will be used to also renovate the cage. 

Ni Nyoman has had satisfactory results. Her pigs grew to be healthy and big, and she sold them all to a big buyer. Now she has enough money to renovate her kitchen. She said many thanks to MUK, Kiva and lenders for supporting her business. She plans to take another loan to increase her business.

Ni Nyoman will use her loan to purchase superior piglets for fattening. She will keep the pigs for six months until they reach the maximum weight. Now, the price for 1 kg of pig is between 21.000 IDR to 22.000 IDR, and it depends on the quality of the meat. Ni Nyoman hopes that during this period she will earn enough profit. This time she will save all the profit.

loans.use: to purchase superior piglets.

loans.name: Carlos Humberto

texts.es:
Carlos es un es un hombre de 24 años de edad, se encuentra unido con su esposa con la que tiene un hijo de cinco años que se encuentra bajo el cuidado de la madre. Esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Carlos con afán de que a su familia no le haga falta nada, trabaja como seguridad  privado en una finca cercana de su comunidad, él tiene un año de realizar esta labor, él cuenta que para mejorar sus ingresos también produce banano y café en su parcela.
Carlos ahora tiene la necesidad de construir un dormitorio porque  la casa que tiene ya no se da abasto por lo que  deberá construir, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para poder comprar sus materiales,  por tal motivo solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, cal, arena, block, y hierro.
Carlos tiene las esperanzas de conseguir este crédito para poder construir su dormitorio, y seguir mejorando su casa.
texts.en:
Carlos is a 24-year-old man and is together with his wife, with whom he has a 5-year-old child that is taken care of by its mother. This humble family lives in the community of Solola.

With the eagerness that his family is never lacking, Carlos works as a private security guard on an estate close to his community. He has had this job for one year. In order to improve his income he also produces bananas and coffee on his plot of land. 

Carlos now has the need to build a room because the house he has no longer manages. For this reason he must build, but one of the difficulties he has is that he does not have sufficient savings to be able to buy the materials. For this reason he is requesting a loan that he will use to buy cement, lime, sand blocks and iron. Carlos has hopes of receiving the loan to be able to build the room and continue improving his home.

loans.use: to buy cement, lime, sand, blocks and iron to build a room.

loans.name: Adriana Maribel

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Andrés De Vera De Miraflores.
En este lugar vive la señora Adriana, tiene 21 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene una hija de 4 años de edad, la misma que está en jardín de infantes. El marido  trabaja en una fábrica en Manta. Ella está estudiando belleza en una academia de la localidad y ya está por graduarse.
Doña Adriana es una mujer muy trabajadora que le gusta ganarse lo suyo para ayudarle a su marido con los gastos del hogar, ella realiza trabajos de belleza como tinturados,  pintado de uñas entre  otras cosas. Trabaja en su casa y también realiza trabajos a domicilio, lleva más de 1 año realizando esta actividad con la cual se gana lo suyo, ella espera de a poco ir adecuando un lugar para instalar un salón de belleza y así brindar un servicio más adecuado a su clientes y mejorar sus ingresos a través de su trabajo.
Este crédito lo va a emplear para comprar herramientas, tintes, esmaltes y cosméticos que utiliza en sus trabajos. Lleva 3 ciclos  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta por la ayuda y beneficios que recibe del banco. Sus sueños son tener un salón de belleza.
texts.en:
The Andrés de Vera de Miraflores Credit Group meets every fifteen days in Andrés de Vera Parish in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as “The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees”.

Adriana lives here. She is 21 years old, and maintains a common-law-marriage, from which she has a four-year-old daughter who is in nursery school. Her husband works in a factory in Manta. She is studying beauty in an academy in town, and is about to graduate.

Adriana is a very hardworking woman who likes to earn her own income in order to help her husband with the household expenses.  She works in her house, performing beauty services such as hair coloring and manicures, among other things, and she also does housekeeping work. She has been doing this work for more than a year, and she earns her own income with this. She hopes to gradually adapt a place in order to install her beauty salon, and in this way, provide her customers with better service and improve her income through her work.

She is going to use the loan to purchase tools, hair coloring, nail polish, and cosmetics that she uses in her work. She has been in the credit group for three loan cycles, and she likes it because of the help and benefits that she receives from the bank.  Her dream is to have a beauty salon.

loans.use: to purchase tools, hair coloring, nail polish, and cosmetics.

loans.name: Maylin

texts.en:
Maylin works hard to support her family. Maylin is married and has a bakery business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for five years now.

Maylin requested a 15,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy sacks of flour, sugar and ingredients for her business. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy sacks of flour, sugar and ingredients for her business

loans.name: Mercedes Elizabeth

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Andrés De Vera De Miraflores.
En este lugar vive la señora Mercedes, tiene 23 años de edad y mantiene una relación de unión libre de la cual tiene un hijo de 3 años y actualmente está embarazada de su segundo hijo. El marido  es comerciante.
Doña Mercedes es una mujer muy trabajadora que junto  a su marido  se dedican a la venta de comida, ellos tienen un pequeño puesto cerca de su casa en la cual todas las tardes venden salchichas, bolones de verde con chicharon o queso, empanadas, jugos, gaseosas y varios productos más que ella mismo prepara y que son del agrado de sus clientes que a diario pasan por el lugar. De esta forma ellos logran salir adelante y esperan cada día mejora su negocio y darle a su familia estabilidad económica.
Este crédito lo va utilizar en comprar arroz, carne, pescado y otros víveres para la preparación de los alimentos. Lleva 5 años en el Grupo de Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ellos salen adelante. Sus sueños son tener su bebé y darles lo mejor a su familia.
texts.en:
The Andrés de Vera de Miraflores Credit Group meets every fifteen days in Andrés de Vera Parish in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, known for many years as “The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees”.

Mercedes lives here. She is 23 years old, and has a common-law marriage, from which she has a three-year-old son, and is currently pregnant with her second child. Her husband is a businessman.

Mercedes is a hardworking woman who sells food along with her husband.  They have a small stand near their house, from which they sell sausages, fried green plantain dumplings with pork rinds or cheese, empanadas, juice, soft drinks, and various other products that she makes herself, and that are pleasing to their customers who stop there every day. In this way, they manage to make progress, and they hope to improve their business each day, and give their family financial stability.

She is going to use this loan to purchase rice, meat, seafood, and other supplies for the preparation of the food. She has been in the credit group for 5 years, and she likes it because the loans help her to make progress. Her dreams are to have her baby and give the best to her family.

loans.use: to purchase rice, meat, seafood, and other supplies.

loans.name: Jose Eric

texts.es:
José, vive con su esposa e hijos, día con día se dedica a trabajar en la granja de pollos de la cual es propietario, al realizar este trabajo puede obtener ingresos económicos importantes para disminuir las necesidades de su familia, su negocio lo estableció hace tres años y ya cuenta con mucha experiencia.
Está solicitando un financiamiento para comprar pollos, concentrado, vitaminas y vacunas, aumentara sus animales y los alimentara de manera adecuada, esto le permitirá seguir atendiendo mejor a sus clientes,  ganar popularidad en su localidad, aumentar sus ventas y ganancias.
Sus sueños son trabajar para darle a su familia una mejor vida y cancelar el crédito.
texts.en:
José, who lives with his wife and children, owns a chicken farm. This work provides important income for his family's needs. He started his business three years ago and now has a lot of experience.

Jose is asking for a loan to buy chickens, concentrated feed, vitamins and vaccines. This will increase the number of animals that he ha and allow him to feed them properly. By continuing his work he can better attend to his customers, gain popularity in his town, and increase his sales and profits. Her dreams are to work to give his family a better life and pay of his loans.

loans.use: to buy chickens, feed, vitamins and vaccines.

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie is a 38-year-old married woman with three children (two children are still in school). She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rosemarie has a broom making business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for 30 years. 

Rosemarie requested a 14,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to buy raw materials, such as bamboo, string and other materials, for her business. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy raw materials, such as bamboo, string and other materials, for her broom making business

loans.name: Rumilda Del Carmen

texts.es:
Rumilda, de 42 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está casada y su esposo es albañil, tiene tres hijos, dos de ellos todavía estudian y aún viven con ellos. 

Rumilda, comercializa ropa desde hace más de dos años, comenzó trabajando en una tienda de ropa y luego se independizo y puso su propio negocio de ropa, con las ganancias de su tienda y los aportes de su esposo, ha logrado sacar adelante a su familia.

Rumilda, necesita el crédito para mejorar la infraestructura de su casa, necesita afinar las paredes y reparar el techo antes que comience el invierno, al lograr este objetivo mejorara su seguridad y la de su familia.

Rumilda, anhela hacer crecer su negocio y así asegurar la educación de sus hijos  y mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Rumilda, 42 years old, studied until sixth grade. She is married and her husband is a bricklayer. She has three children, two of which are still in school and still live with them.

Rumilda has been selling clothes for more than two years. She began working in a clothing store and then set out on her own to set up her own clothing business. She has been able to provide for her family with what she earns along with her husband’s contributions.

Rumilda needs the loan to improve the infrastructure of her house. She needs to refine the walls and repair the roof before winter comes. Taking care of this would improve her and her family’s security.

Rumilda longs to start her own business and thereby assure that her children get an education and that their quality of life improves.

loans.use: to improve the infrastructure of her house. She needs to refine the walls and repair the roof before winter comes.

loans.name: Rudy

texts.es:
Rudy, es agricultor, vive con sus esposa y sus hijos, aprendió de sus padres a realizar cultivos de granos básicos, cuenta con 9 años de estar trabajando en su negocio propio, la ventaja es que las propiedades en las trabaja le pertenecen a su familia, tiene un horario de siete de la mañana a cinco de la tarde, Rudy no cuenta con otro tipo de ingreso para cubrir los gastos familiares.
Invertirá en abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla mejorada de maíz, además pagara obreros que le ayuden a limpiar el terreno de la maleza, contara con los materiales necesarios para seguir trabajando, espera que los resultados sean favorables y pueda mejorar su situación financiera para cancelar la deuda adquirida.
Sus sueños son comprar un pick up para realizar los traslados de la cosecha con mayor rapidez y también para salir de paseo y tener momentos amenos con su familia.
texts.en:
Rudy, a farmer, lives with his wife and children. He learned from his parents how to cultivate basic grains, and has been doing the work himself for 9 years. He has the advantage of being able to farm on his family-owned land. He works from 7am to 5pm, and this work is his only source of income for his family.

He will buy compost, insecticides, herbicides and improved corn seeds; he will also pay laborers to help clear weeds from the fields. With this he will have the materials he needs to keep working. He hopes that he will have good results so that he can improve his family's financial situation and pay off his debts.

His dream is to buy a pick-up truck for transporting the harvest more quickly, and also to be able to go out and have nice moments with his family.

loans.use: to buy compost, insecticide, herbicide and improved corn seeds, as well as to pay for labor to help weed the fields.

loans.name: Rialyn

texts.en:
Rialyn is a 35-year-old married woman with two children, both still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Rialyn has a motorcycle transportation business in the Philippines. She has been in this business for three years. 

Rialyn requested a 20,000 Philippine peso loan through Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation to purchase gasoline, spare parts and pay for maintenance for her motorcycle. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase gasoline, spare parts and pay for maintenance for her motorcycle

loans.name: Santalat

texts.ru: Санталат, 50 лет, вдова, мать 3 детей. Санталат в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи, занимается сельским хозяйством. Стартовав в 1995 году, на сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Санталат есть 4 коровы. На участке мерою 2,0 Га Санталат выращивает рис и кукурузу для реализации. Ежемесячная прибыль- около 20,000 сомов (KGS).
