В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 100,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита Санталат планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Santalat is 50 years old, widowed, and the mother of 3.  Santalat's work in agriculture, which began in 1995, serves as her family's primary source of income.  She has 4 cows and a 2.0 hectare plot of land on which she raises rice and corn for resale.  Her monthly income is about 20,000 KGS.  With the goal of further developing her business, she turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 100,000 KGS to purchase cows to increase the size of her herd.  With the income from the loan, Santalat plans to continue investing in her business.

loans.use: to buy some cows in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Roza

texts.ru: Роза, 48 лет, замужем. У нее среднее образование, она с 1992 года занимается сельским хозяйством, обеспечивая свою семью доходом. Благодаря упорному труду Розы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы, 15 овец. На 0,80 Га земли она выращивает картофель и кукурузу. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнес деятельности Розы составляет около 12,000 сом (KGS). Роза обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и реализации. Она является лидером группы "Элиза", в которой состоят еще 2 человека, всего их трое. Доходы от кредита позволят Розе развить ее бизнес, улучшить благосостояние семьи и построить сараи для скота.
texts.en:
Roza is 48 years old and married. She has received secondary education. Since 1992 she has been supporting her family through farm work. Thanks to Roza's hard work, at present she has three cows and 15 sheep on her farm. She grows potatoes and corn on a field of 0.8 ha [2 acres]. Roza's monthly revenue is approximately 12,000 KGS. 

Roza has applied to the Bai Tushum microfinance association for a loan in the amount of 50,000 KGS to buy calves for fattening and resale. She is the leader of the Elise borrowers' group, which includes two other members, for the total of three. The revenue from this loan will allow Roza to develop her business, improve her family's well-being and build sheds for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy some calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Burul

texts.ru: Бурул, 51 год, вдова, 5 детей. У Бурул среднее образование, на протяжении 20 лет активно занимается животноводством и полеводством. На сегодняшний день в хозяйстве Бурул есть 2 коровы. На 0,56 Га собственной и 0,54 Га арендованной земли она выращивает арбузы, кукурузу и перец. Она очень трудолюбивая, ответственная и целеустремленная. Ежемесячный доход около 10,000 сом (KGS), этих средств не хватает на достойную жизнь семьи Бурул, поэтому в целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства она обратилась в Банк «Бай-Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья скота. Доходы от кредита Бурул планирует вкладывать в дальнейшее развитие бизнеса.
texts.en: Burul is 51 years old, widowed, and has 5 children.  Burul has a secondary education, and has been actively working in animal husbandry and farming for 20 years.  She now has 2 cows and 0.56 hectares of her own land, as well as 0.54 hectares of rented land, on which she raises watermelons, corn, and peppers.  She is very hard-working, responsible, and goal-oriented.  Her monthly income is about 10,000 KGS, which is not enough to support the needs of her family.  For this reason, with the goal of further expanding her business, she turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 50,000 KGS to purchase cows to increase the size of her herd.  With the income from the loan, Burul plans to continue to invest in the development of her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cows in order to increase her income

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан, 52 года, в разводе, есть дочь. У Бурулкан высшее образование и большой трудовой стаж. Около 19 лет назад Бурулкан стала заниматься животноводством и полеводством, накопив на старт сумму в 35,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан на сегодняшний день у нее есть 8 коров и 4 лошади. Ежемесячная прибыль от продажи скота и молока составляет всего около 25,000 сом (KGS) в месяц. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 60,000 сом (KGS) на покупку коров для увеличения поголовья. Бурулкан планирует расширить ее бизнес.
texts.en: Burulkan is 52 years old, divorced, and has a daughter.  Burulkan has a higher education and has a great deal of work experience.  Around 19 years ago , starting with 35,000 KGS, Burulkan started working in animal husbandry and farming,  Thanks to her hard work Burulkan now has 8 cows and 4 horses.  She earns about 25,000 KGS each moth selling cattle and milk.  With the goal of further develop her business, Burulkan turned to the bank "Bai-Tushum" for a loan of 60,000 KGS to purchase cows to increase her herd.  Burulkan plans to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy cows in order to increase the size of her herd

loans.name: Chanthyny's Group

texts.en:
Chanthyny, 39 years old, is a married woman with three dependent children (two of them are in school). She is a resident of a rural area in Bovel district of Battambang province. The main source of her family income has been potato farming for twelve years. To be better and earn more income, she also works for other farms as well. She earns around 76,000 riels per day to meet her family’s needs. 

Chanthyny’s group consists of two members. This is the fifth loan for her while for the other one it is a second loan. Her previous loans have helped her to earn more money so she was able to send her children to school. Now she is leading this group to apply for a loan to pay for labor and rent a tractor to plow her farmland. She hopes that her income will  increase and her family will have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to pay for labor and rent a tractor to plow her farmland

loans.name: Seno

texts.en:
Seno is 48 years old and married. She does not have any children. She lives with her husband in a rural community on the island of Guadalcanal in the Solomon Islands.

Seno makes traditional shell money and sells it at the market. Shell money is a form of local currency and is still used in some parts of the Solomon Islands today, in particular during celebration ceremonies and as dowry. Shell money is carefully crafted from seashells. 

Seno has requested this loan to buy a new hand drill and materials for her shell money making business. She hopes to use the profits from her business to help pay for her family's weekly expenses and to expand her business in the future. 

This is Seno's first loan with South Pacific Business Development Microfinance (Solomon Islands).

loans.use: to buy materials such as seashells, coil string, and nylon string as well as a hand drill for her traditional shell money business.

loans.name: Nellys

texts.es: Nellys de 39 años de edad, es la propietaria de una peluquería, donde ofrece servicios de tratamientos de cabello, peinados, maquillaje, manicure y pedicure; ella además vende productos de belleza, previa asesoría  que hace a sus clientes.  Su dedicación a la estética y belleza, la tiene desde hace 5 años, atendiendo a que desde muy niña  le gustó  e hizo cursos, para aprender y empezó a practicarlos con sus familiares, con los que inicialmente y  poco a poco construyó su propia clientela, que hoy se encuentra  fidelizada y se acera a sus instalaciones para obtener  el mejoramiento de su imagen personal, mediante el tinturado de cabello, corte, desrizado etc.  Sus ventas las realiza de contado y a crédito, trabajando todos los días desde muy temprano y los sábados lo hace desde las 8 de la mañana hasta las 10 de la noche. En la actualidad Nellys está aplicando a un credikiva, primer financiamiento que hace a la Fundación Mario Santo Domingo, mediante el cual comprará un espejo, sillas de peluquería y productos de belleza e insumos, para trabajar en su negocio. Con esta inversión tendrá más comodidades, para ofrecer a  su clientela y un mayor número de artículos en su haber para vender. Su meta es lograr un mayor crecimiento de su negocio y finalmente lograr que sus hijos se conviertan en profesionales de calidad, pues con su cónyuge constituye una familia con 3 hijos en las edades de 10 a 15 años, quienes son el motor que dinamiza sus vidas.
texts.en:
Nellys, 39 years old, is the owner of a barbershop where she offers services in hair treatment, styling, makeup, manicures and pedicures. She also sells beauty products and gives product samples to her customers.

She has worked in aesthetics and beauty for 5 years, taking into account that she liked it since she was a child and took classes to learn. She started by initially practicing on her family members. Little by little she built her own clientele who are now loyal and come to her establishment to get an improvement of their personal image with hair dye, haircuts, straightening, etc. 

She makes her sales on credit and with cash. She starts work early everyday and on Saturdays works from 8 in the morning until 10 at night. Nellys is currently applying for a credikiva, her first loan with the Mario Santo Domingo foundation. With it, she will purchase a mirror, barbershop chairs, beauty products and supplies for her business. 

With this investment she will have more amenities to offer her customers and a greater number of items to sell. Her goal is to achieve more business growth and in the end, for her children to become quality professionals. With her spouse they are a family with 3 children between the ages of 10 and 15 years who are the motor that energizes their lives.

loans.use: to buy a mirror, barbershop chairs, beauty products and supplies.

loans.name: Maria Rosa

texts.es:
María, vive únicamente con su esposo, con el objetivo de ser un apoyo económico en su hogar se dedica a vender comida, ella ha tenido la iniciativa de tener un negocio propio y lo estableció hace más de 35 años en el mercado municipal, tiene un horario de cinco de la mañana a tres de la tarde, algunas veces es variable según sea la demanda, ya tiene clientela establecida por el buen servicio que brinda.
Comprará un freezer y remodelara el local de su negocio, con ello conservara la materia prima para elaborar la comida en mejores condiciones, espera dar una mejor imagen del negocio a sus clientes y atenderlos de la mejor manera.
Sueña con mantener su negocio con vida, seguir cubriendo las necesidades familiares y cancelar con puntualidad sus cuotas.
texts.en:
María lives with her husband and sells food as a way to support her family. She took the initiative to start her own business and has now been selling food for 35 years in the town market. She works from 5am to 3pm, but her schedule sometimes varies with demand. She now has an established clientele due to the good service that she offers.

She will buy a freezer so that she can better preserve her ingredients; she will also remodel so that she can present a better image to her customers and better attend them. She dreams of having a lively business that continues to meet the needs of her family and allows her to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to buy a freezer and remodel her restaurant.

loans.name: Van's Group

texts.en:
Van, 61 years old, lives with family members in a rural village of Cheung Prey district of Kampong Cham province. She is the mother of four children, and they are all dependents. To make a living, she grows rice as her main source of income and raises pigs to supplement her income. 

This is the second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) for Van's group, which consists of two members. She has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She will spend her loan portion to buy food for feeding her pigs. She hopes that she can make more income than last year.

loans.use: to buy food for feeding pigs

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Graciela Genoveva

texts.es:
Graciela, se decidió por un nuevo préstamo para poder realizar la compra de granos básicos, bebidas, boquitas, pan, etc., para surtir la tienda, el resto lo invertirá en materiales de construcción para reparar el techo en del local.
El préstamo anterior le ha servido para que su negocio este surtido y sea una fuente de ingresos permanente, su familia tiene mejores condiciones de vida en su hogar.
texts.en:
Graciela decided she needs a new loan to buy basic grains, drinks, snacks, bread, etc to stock her store. She will also buy construction materials to repair the roof of her store.

Her previous loan helped her to stock her store and created a source of permanent income. Her family now has better living conditions.

loans.use: to buy basic grains, drinks, snacks, bread, etc to stock the store; and to buy materials to fix the roof.

loans.name: Maria Abelina

texts.es:
María, es una señora de 41 años de edad que vive con su esposo e hijos los cuales están estudiando, siendo joven aprendió con su familia a cultivar granos básicos, a practicar la crianza de ganado, cerdos y pollos, desde hace más de 20 desarrolla  dichas actividades como una fuente de ingresos para que su familia tenga lo necesario para subsistir.
Comprará dos vaquillas para aumentar su inventario y en un futuro tener producción de leche y así elaborar algunos lácteos, espera que la inversión le genere nuevos ingresos con los que fácilmente cancelara su deuda y disminuirá las necesidades familiares.
El sueño que María desea ver realizado es  la construcción de una vivienda más confortable y digna para su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is a 41 year old woman who lives with her husband and children, who are in school. From childhood she learned how to cultivate basic grains with her family, to raise cattle, pigs and chickens. She has developed said work for more than 20 years as a source of income so that her family has enough to live on.

She will buy two heifers to increase her inventory and for future milk production to make some dairy products. She hopes the investment generates new revenues with which she can easily pay her debt and reduce the family’s needs. 

The dream Maria wishes to see come true is the construction of a decent and more comfortable home for her family.

loans.use: to buy two heifers to increase her inventory and for future milk production to make some dairy products.

loans.name: Dixi Iveth

texts.es:
Dixi, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta cuarto grado, está acompañada y su pareja se dedica a la  agricultura y eventualmente trabaja en un taller de enderezado y pintura de su pueblo, tienen 2  hijos y ambos estudian tercer y quinto grado.

Dixi, es una mujer muy trabajadora, actualmente labora en la escuela de su comunidad, cocinando los alimentos para  los niños que asisten a la escuela, esta labor le permite estar pendiente de su  hogar, porque la escuela está a solo 500 metros de donde vive, también cría aves de corral (gallinas).

Dixi, necesita el crédito para poder comprar el material para refinar las paredes internas de su casa, con esto mejorara su calidad de vida y la de su familia.

Dixi, desea poder seguir mejorando su casa para seguridad de sus hijos y en un futuro ampliarla más.
texts.en:
Dixi, 28 years old, studied until the fourth grade. She is married and her partner works in agriculture and sometimes at an auto body shop in his village. They have 2 children in school, in third and fifth grade.

Dixi is a hard working woman who currently works at the school in her community, cooking the food for the children attending classes. This work allows her to keep an eye on her home since the school is only 500 meters from where she lives. She also raises poultry (chickens).

Dixi needs a loan in order to buy the materials to touch up the walls inside her home. With this she will improve her quality of life and that of her family.

Dixi wishes to continue improving her home for the security of her children and in the future, to enlarge it further.

loans.use: to buy the materials to touch up the walls inside her home.

loans.name: Mrs. Ly ’S Group Leader

texts.en:
Ly was selected to be group leader for a loan requested from Maxima. There are two members in the group and they are in a village in Muk Kompul district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Ly (pictured) is 63 years old. She lives in Muk Kompul district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 1980 and has three sons and four daughters. Four are married and the other three work as private staff for a company. Ly has been a farmer for ten years, while her husband has been selling tobacco for ten years. Ly is applying for a loan of $350 to buy more tobacco to sell.

2- Sreylek (also pictured) is 43 years old. She lives in Muk Kompul district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 1991 and has two sons and two daughters: one is a carpenter, two work as private staff for a company and the last one is still young. Sreylek has been a garment factory worker for two years, while her husband has been a carpenter for five years. Sreylek is applying for a loan of $350 to repair her home.

Photo: Ly is on Sreylek's left.

loans.use: To repair the home and helps another to buy tobacco to sell

loans.name: Aisas ’S Group Leader

texts.en:
Aisas was selected to be group leader for a loan requested from Maxima. The group has two members and they are in a village in Muk Kompul district in Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

Aisas (pictured) is 46 years old. She lives in Muk Kompul district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 1980 and has three sons and two daughters: two work abroad, one is married, and the last two are attending school.

Aisas has been selling and buying scraps for fifteen years, while her husband has been a Tuk Tuk driver for two years. Aisas is applying for a loan of $300 to buy scraps to stock and sell.

Sreifas (also pictured) is 33 years old. She, too, lives in Muk Kompul district, Kandal province, Cambodia. She has been married since 1990 and has one son and one daughter who are still young.

Sreifas has been selling rice for three years. Her husband sells incense and has done so for five years. Sreifas is also applying for a loan $300 to buy incense to sell.

Photo: Aisas is on Sreifa's left

loans.use: To buy scraps and incense to sell

loans.name: Maricyl

texts.en:
Maricyl is 36 years old and married with two children, both of whom are in school.

Maricyl works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 22,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more stocks of groceries like rice, soft drinks, canned goods and other personal care items to sell.

Maricyl has borrowed and repaid ten loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 15 years and also earns an income from fattening pigs.

Maricyl aspires to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to purchase more stocks of groceries like rice, soft drinks, canned goods and other personal care items to sell.

loans.name: Nga's Group

texts.en:
Nga, 54 years old, is a married woman who lives with her family in a rural area located in the Ponhea Krek district of Kampong Cham province. She has seven children, four of whom are dependent and one is in school.

Potato farming has been the main source of her family's income for thirty three years. To earn more income to support her family’s needs, she also does rice farming, sells groceries, and works for other farms as well. She could earn around 40,000 KHR per day.

Nga has been an existing client with VisionFund for two cycles already and has completely paid back the previous loan, which helped her to create better living conditions. Now she is leading this group of three to apply for a loan with a portion to buy fertilizer.

She hopes that she will be able to earn more income and expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Luda

texts.en:
Luda is 36 years old and is married with one child. She lives with her family in an urban community in Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands. 

Luda runs a little general store where she sells a variety of food and drinks, including noddles, canned goods, biscuits and soft drinks. She has been running this business for two years. 

Luda has applied for this loan to help re-stock her store. She hopes to use the profits from her business to provide a her family with a better living and to expand her small business in the future. She will use some of the proceeds from her store to meet the family's daily expenses.

Luda became a member of SPBD this year and this is her first loan.

loans.use: to buy stocks, including biscuits, noodles, canned foods and soft drinks for her general store.

loans.name: Steacy

texts.en:
Steacy is 22 years old and married. She does not have any children yet. Steacy lives in an urban community in Honiara, the capital of the Solomon Islands. 

She runs a little general store in her neighborhood and has been doing this for about two years. She sells a variety of food items and other goods in her store.

Steacy has applied for this loan to buy goods to re-stock her store. She plans to use the profits from her business to improve her business and build a better home for her family in the future. She will also use some of the proceeds from her business to help pay for daily expenses. 

Steacy became a member of SPBD this year and this will be her first loan.

loans.use: A loan of $3500 will help Steacy buy goods such as canned foods, soap, soy sauce, sugar, and rice for her general store.

loans.name: Orque

texts.en:
Orque is 55 years old, married and has three children.

Orque is in the agricultural business in the Philippines. Orque requested a PHP 35,000 loan through NWTF to buy feeds and vitamins for her business.

Orque has been in the business for 6 years now, and has borrowed 6 times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feeds and vitamins for her business

loans.name: Ma. Melinda

texts.en:
Ma. Melinda is 51 years old and married.

Ma. Melinda is in the agricultural business, farming rice and sugarcane in the Philippines. Ma. Melinda requested a PHP 31,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

She has been farming rice and sugarcane for three years.

In the future, Ma. Melinda would like to build and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Oubritenga Group

texts.fr:
Mme   PASCALINE  est responsable du groupe OUBRITENGA. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 19 ans et le moins âgé a 03 ans. 02 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge.
Madame fait du maraichage  depuis 12 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent  octroyé, elle compte acheter 02 kg de semence et 01 sac de 100 kg d’engrais.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour payer la scolarité de ses enfants . Elle ambitionne acheter une moto pompe pour agrandir ses surfaces cultivables.
texts.en:
Mrs. Pascaline is responsible for the Oubritenga group. She is the married mother of seven children, the eldest of whom is 19 and the youngest three years old. Two of the children go to school and she has seven persons under her care.

She has been a crop gardener for the past twelve years. She resupplies in surrounding markets. With the money granted, she intends to buy two kilos of seeds and one 100-kilo bag of fertilizer.

She wants to use the proceeds of the loan to pay for her children's schooling. She aims to buy a motor pump so she can expand her arable land.

loans.use: buy two kilos of seeds and one 100-kilo bag of fertilizer

loans.name: Julie

texts.en:
Julie is 36 years old and married with three children.

Julie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, bread, soft drinks, spices, sacks of rice and other groceries.

Julie has borrowed and repaid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 3 years and also earns an income from rice retailing.

Julie aspires to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, bread, soft drinks, spices, sacks of rice and other groceries

loans.name: Mercy

texts.en:
Mercy is 40 years old and married with four children. With two children still in school, Mercy works very hard to provide for them.

Mercy runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc. Mercy has been in this business for 8 years.

She would like to save enough money so that she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, spices, milk, coffee, shampoo, sugar, soft drinks, cooking oil, etc

loans.name: Tabtenga Group

texts.fr:
Mme K. LAURENTINE  est responsable du groupe TABTENGA. Elle est mariée et mère de 06 enfants. Le plus âgé a 18 ans et le moins âgé a 05 ans. 05 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 08 personnes en charge.
Madame fait du maraichage  depuis  18 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent  octroyé, elle compte acheter 04 boîtes  de semence et 01 sac d’engrais.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour payer la scolarité de ses enfants. Elle ambitionne acheter une moto pompe  et agrandir ses surfaces cultivables pour embaucher des gens et payer des moyens de déplacement pour sa famille.
texts.en:
Mrs. K. Laurentine is responsible for the Tabtenga group. She is a married mother of six children, the eldest of whom is 18 and the youngest five years old. Five of the children attend school and she has eight persons under her care.

She has been crop gardening for the past 18 years. She resupplies in surrounding markets. With the money granted, she intends to buy four boxes of seeds and one bag of fertilizer.

She wants to use the proceeds of the loan to pay for her children's education. She aims to buy a motor pump and expand her arable land so she can hire people and pay transportation means for her family.

loans.use: buy four boxes of seeds and one bag of fertilizer.

loans.name: Bagyini Group

texts.fr:
Mme   AMINATA est responsable du groupe BAGYINI. Elle est mariée et mère de 07 enfants. Le plus âgé a 25 ans et le moins âgé a 04 ans. 03 enfants vont à l’école et elle a 07 personnes en charge.
Madame fait du maraichage  depuis 30 ans. Elle s’approvisionne dans les marchés environnants.
Avec l’argent  octroyé, elle compte acheter 05 kg de semence et 50 kg d’engrais.
Elle veut utiliser les bénéfices du prêt pour payer la scolarité des enfants et acheter des équipements pour son activité. Elle ambitionne acheter une moto pompe pour agrandir ses surfaces cultivables.
texts.en:
Mrs. Aminata is responsible for the Bagyoni group. She is the married mother of seven children, the eldest of whom is 25 and the youngest four years old. Three of the children go to school and she has seven persons under her care.

She has been a crop gardener for the past thirty years. She resupplies in surrounding markets. With the money granted, she intends to buy five kilos of seeds and 50 kilos of fertilizer.

She wants to use the proceeds of the loan to pay for the schooling of her children and buy equipment for her business activity. She aims to buy a motor pump so she can expand her arable land.

loans.use: buy five kilos of seeds and 50 kilos of fertilizer

loans.name: Srikandi 2 Group

texts.en:
The Srikandi 2 group can pay off this loan on time. They sell pigs at a good price. Currently, the price for pork is about 21.000 IDR per kg. 

Ni Nengah, the treasurer of the group, maintains fattened pigs. She has sold all of her pigs. She gains a profit 2.000.000 IDR for all of them. She’s really grateful for that. She has a plan to use the profit to renovate her kitchen and for her savings. During her last loan, she had no problems. All the pigs grew well. She’s said thank you to lenders, Kiva and MUK for supporting her business.

To increase the business, the Srikandi 2 group continues to borrow from MUK. They are comfortable with the loans, because they also have been trained by the MUK staff. 

Ni Nengah is a housewife, her husband works as a farmer in his own land. 

After success with the last loan, Ni Nengah will borrow again to purchase 2 superior piglets for fattening pig. She will also use the loan to support her egg selling business. All the profit from this business will be saved.  She hopes the business will grow and that she becomes a successful pig breeder.

One member resigned from the group and she was replaced by a new member.

loans.use: to purchase two piglets and to support her egg selling business.

loans.name: Parvina

texts.en: Parvina is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northwest part of Tajikistan in 1988. She is living in a small village. She has six years of experience doing business. She sews and is well known for her activity. She sews beautiful national dresses for Tajik women. She is married and has one child. She has a good version for Tajik men and she also sews traditional coats and jackets. She has permanent clients and they are all satisfied with her sewing. She loves to work and gains a good profit. She is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy sewing supplies. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy sewing supplies

loans.name: Priscilla

texts.en:
Priscilla is 61 years old and married with three children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Priscilla runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, eggs, shampoo, noodles, spice, etc.

Priscilla has been in this business for three years.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, eggs, shampoo, noodles, and spices

loans.name: Janice

texts.en:
Janice is 27 years old and married with three children. With two of her children still in school, Janice works very hard to provide for them.

Janice runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 13,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, noodles, spice, cooking oil, etc.

Janice has been in this business for eight years. 

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, milk, coffee, noodles, spice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a hardworking woman entrepreneur with three children.

She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 19,000 loan through NWTF to buy items like canned goods, personal care products, etc. to sell in her sari-sari store.

She industriously earns additional income through other business ventures like selling clothes.

Gemma dreams that one day, she will be able to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, and personal care products to sell in her sari-sari store.

loans.name: Grupo Sector Mercado Group

texts.es:
Abraham es un padre de familia de 53 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de dos hijos de las edades entre 20 y 23 años, viven en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Abraham (el primero del lado derecho de la fotografía) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia se dedica a prestar servicios de molino de nixtamal a las personas de su comunidad, pero para poder mejorar sus ingresos también se dedica a la compra y venta de leñas.
Abraham por su amabilidad con la que atiende a las personas, tiene mucha clientela, por lo que el ahora considera que es necesario mejorar sus servicios, aunque una de las dificultades que el tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, por tal motivo a organizado a un grupo de personas para solicitar un préstamo que lo utilizara para darle mantenimiento a su molino de nixtamal comprando así aceite, fajas, ruedos.
El gran sueño de Abraham es poder contar con el crédito para poder mejorar sus servicios y seguir comprando más molinos de nixtamal.
texts.en:
Abraham is 53 years old. He is married with a lovely family - he has two sons who are between 20 and 23 years old. They live in the community of Suchitepéquez. Abraham is the first person on the right in the photograph. He desires to make a living and to support his family, so he provides a corn milling service to the people in his community. He also purchases and sells firewood, which enables him to make more money. 

Abraham has many customers, thanks to the kind manner with which he serves people. Because he has many customers he wants to further improve his services, although one of the challenges he faces is that he doesn't have enough capital. So he organized a group of people to request a loan, which he will use to purchase oil, belts and rings to maintain his flour mill. 

His greatest dream is to be able to get this loan in order to improve his services and to continue purchasing more corn flour mills.

loans.use: to purchase oil, twine and supplies to maintain their mill.

loans.name: Presentation

texts.en:
Presentation is a married woman, 61 years old, with three children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Presentation has a broom-making business in the Philippines. Presentation requested a PHP 18,000 loan through NWTF to buy raw materials like bamboo, sticks, springs and other material for her business.

Presentation has been in this business for nine years. She would like to save enough to build a house for her family.

loans.use: to buy raw materials like bamboo, sticks, springs and other material for her business

loans.name: Ama

texts.fr: Agée de 53 ans, Ama est une femme qui a trois enfants à sa charge. Habitant à Adidogomé, Ama est très dynamique et active pour assurer les charges quotidiennes. Ama vend des charbons de bois à la devanture de sa maison et réalise un revenu favorable. Ama s’approvisionne au marché deux fois par mois. Ama sollicite ce microcrédit pour acheter des sacs de charbons de bois et avoir assez de profits pour promouvoir l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
53-year-old Ama is a woman with three children under her care. Living in Adidogomé, Ama is very dynamic and active in dealing with daily expenses.

Ama sells charcoal in front of her home and generates good income. She resupplies at the market twice a month.

Ama is requesting this microcredit loan to buy bags of charcoal and generate enough profits to promote her children's education.

loans.use: buy five bags of charcoal

loans.name: Abra

texts.fr: Abra est une femme veuve âgée de 55 ans. Abra vit avec cinq enfants à sa charge et habite dans le quartier de Tokoin. Abra désire contribuer activement à l’épanouissement de ses enfants en vendant des tubercules et des céréales. Ce commerce lui génère un gain favorable pour subvenir aux charges quotidiennes. Abra s’approvisionne quatre fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter un sac de maïs, Abra sollicite ce crédit pour son financement et gagner une bonne rentabilité
texts.en:
Abra is a 55-year-old widow. She lives with five dependent children in the district of Tokoin.

Abra wants to contribute actively to her children's development by selling tubers and grains. This trade generates a favorable income to help her meet daily expenditures. Abra resupplies four times a month at the market.

Abra is requesting this loan to finance the purchase of one bag of maize, so she can make a good profit.

loans.use: buy one bag of maize

loans.name: Maribel

texts.en:
Maribel is engaged in fishing. Together with her husband, she catches and sells fish to earn a living. She is a 35-year-old married woman with three children from Talibon, Bohol. Her oldest child is 12 and the youngest is 5. 

Maribel has requested a loan in the amount of 12,000 PHP to buy four bundles of screen, paint, nylon, and epoxy. These could help her improve her on-going catch and probably sell more fish. It would enable her to expand her livelihood and at the same time, provide her children with nutritious diets.
She hopes that she can continue to send all her children to college for a brighter future.

loans.use: to buy four bundles of screen, paint, nylon, and epoxy

loans.name: Mrs. Kac'sgroup Leader

texts.en:
Kac was selected to be the group leader for the loan requested from Maxima. In the group, there are six members and they live in a village in Meanchey district, Phnom Penh, Cambodia.

1- Kac (pictured) is 58 years old and a widow. She has one son and one daughter. They all work. Kac has sold Khmer noodles for fifteen years, while her son and daughter are construction workers.  She is applying her loan off $150 to repair her home because it is so old. She wants to have a good home.

2- Sithon (shown in photo) is 35 years old. She had been married since 2002, and has three daughters. They are students. Sithon is a garment factory worker, while her husband is motor taxi-driver with thirteen years of experience.  Her $200 will be used to repair her home because it is so narrow and old. 

3- Navy (shown in photo) is 37 years old. She had been married since 1996. She has one son and three daughters .They are students. Navy is a room rent worker, while her husband has been a bodyguard for twenty-two years. Her $200 will be used to expand her business to the required market.

4-Chan (shown in photo) is 40 years old and a widow. She has one son. He is a student. Chan has sold groceries for five years. Her loan of $200 will be used to buy vegetables and groceries to sell more. She wants to increase her income to improve her family.

5-Sa Un (shown in photo) is 52 years old. Sa Un had been married since 2001. She has one son and one daughter. They are students. Sa Un has sold groceries for five years, while her husband is construction worker. She would like to use her $150 to buy vegetables to resell . She wants to increase her income to improve her family.

6-Soriya (shown in photo) is 22 years old and a widow. She has one son. He is still young. Soriya has been a waitress for two year. She would like to use her $150 loan to  buy vegetables and groceries to sell as a part time job.  She wants to increase her income to improve her life.

Photo: Kac is on the left hand of the group.

loans.use: to repair their homes and buy vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Salomat

texts.en: Salomat is a hardworking woman. She was born in the southern part of Tajikistan in 1965. She lives in the small village of Farogat. She is married and has five children. She is an educated and honest person. She has been working as a teacher in secondary school since 1984. She is very active and well known among teachers and neighbors. She has land where she plants agricultural products. Recently, she planted potatoes and onions. She is planning to plant cotton and cereals. She hopes her business will be prosperous and profitable. She is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy fertilizers and seeds. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy fertilizers and seeds

loans.name: Fayzigul

texts.en: Fayzigul is a bright woman. She was born in the southern part of the country in 1976. She is divorced and has one child. She is a cleaning woman and works at a medical center. She spends her monthly income for everyday expenditures. Her saved money is not enough to renovate her apartment and have a better standard of living. Fayzigul is a responsible, honest and kind person. She needs to be supported by Kiva lenders because she lives in bad conditions. She awaits your mercy and asks for a loan to renovate her apartment.

loans.use: to renovate her apartment

loans.name: Lorelie

texts.en:
Lorelie is 50 years old and married with five children.

Lorelie works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, spices, bread, soft drinks, juice and other personal care products.

Lorelie has borrowed and repaid eight loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for two years and also earns an income from tailoring.

Lorelie aspires to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, cooking oil, noodles, spices, bread, soft drinks, juice and other personal care products

loans.name: Akbari

texts.en:
Akbari is 30 years old and resides in Lahore, Pakistan. She looks after her family consisting of one son and four daughters. Her husband has been running a restaurant for the last five years. He provides services to the people by serving good and fresh food meals. His restaurant is situated in the main market. Most shop keepers come to his restaurant to eat delicious food. He needs some crockery and fresh food items to develop his business. In this regard, Akbari made contact with Kiva's field partner BRAC Pakistan for a loan. BRAC issued a loan to Akbari for the development of her husband's business.
 
Akbari is very thankful to Kiva and its field partner BRAC Pakistan.

loans.use: to enhance her husband's restaurant business

loans.name: Holmoh

texts.en: Holmoh is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1962. She is a widow and has two children. She lives in a small village in the southern part of the country. She is a businesswoman. She has been trading clothes in the domestic market for about 15 years. She knows well her activity and has permanent clients. Holmoh is planning to enlarge her business and buy a new collection of new season clothes. She requested a loan from Kiva lenders and IMON to buy a new collection of clothes. She awaits your mercy and hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy a new collection of clothes

loans.name: Joralyn

texts.en:
Joralyn is a farmer residing in Talibon, Bohol. She toils the land and grows rice. She is married with two children ages 10 and 3 years old, respectively.  She has been growing and selling rice for four years now. 

She is asking for a loan to buy fertilizers, pay for the farm laborers and buy other farm supplies. These will help improve the yield of her farm and  augment her livelihood. Thus, she will be able to handle her finances. In this way, she can now expand her business and be able to settle her obligations.

In the future, she hopes that she can send all three of her children to college,

loans.use: to buy fertilizers, pay for the farm laborers,  and buy other farm supplies

loans.name: Judy

texts.en:
Judy is a married woman with six children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Judy is 50 years old and two of her children are still in school.

Judy has a farming vegetable business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF to buy seeds, sacks of fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Judy has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy seeds, sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Melanie

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Melanie works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending.  Melanie is borrowing PHP 14,000 through NWTF to purchase fish net and other materials for her fishing business. 

Melanie has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase fish net and other materials for her fishing business

loans.name: Aurora

texts.en:
Aurora is 61 years old and widowed with six children. She works very hard to provide for them.

Aurora runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned good, noodles, milk, sugar, spices, cooking oil, coffee, soft-drinks, etc. She has been in this business for 6 years.

Aurora would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned good, noodles, milk, sugar, spices, cooking oil, coffee, soft-drinks, etc.

loans.name: Mariam

texts.en:
Mariam is a single mother of five children. She lives in her own house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food.

For the past six years, she has operated a clothes selling business, selling from door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of the high cost of seasonality in her business.

With the loan that she is requesting of Kes 50,000, she wants to purchase bales of clothes for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of clothes for resale

loans.name: Maria Etelvina

texts.es:
María, elabora todos los días la venta de antojitos como: yuca, papas fritas, tostadas de plátanos, etc., de esa manera tiene los recursos económicos que necesita para que en su hogar existan menos carencias, vive con su esposo y sus hijos, toda la familia colabora para que el negocio se mantenga funcionando.
Invertirá en plátanos, yuca, papas, aceite, productos desechables, etc., para tener materia prima y elaborar la venta de antojitos, espera que su negocio logre atraer nuevos clientes, por consiguiente aumentar las ventas y ganancias para respaldar el pago de la deuda.
María desea tener una situación financiera estable para construir su vivienda de bloque y que así toda la familia tenga un espacio más seguro para vivir.
texts.en:
Everyday, María make snacks to sell such as manioc, potato chips, plantain chips, etc. This gives her the financial resources she needs so that her family lack fewer things. She lives with her husband and children and the whole family work together to keep the business running.

She intends to buy plantain bananas, manioc, potatoes, oil, disposable products etc. to have raw material and prepare snacks to sell. She hopes that her business will attract new customers and, as a result, increase her sales and profits to pay off the loan. 

María would like to have a stable financial situation to build a brick house so that the family will have a safer place to live.

loans.use: to buy plantains, manioc, potatoes, oil, disposable products etc. to have raw material and prepare snacks to sell.

loans.name: Katerin Aracely

texts.es:
Aracely, de 26 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, posteriormente estudio 2 años de la carrera de laboratorio clínico, está casada y tiene una hermosa hija de cuatro años de edad, actualmente  vive con sus padres ya que le ayudan a cuidar su hija mientras ella trabaja. 

Aracely, es una mujer muy luchadora, actualmente trabaja como cajera en una agencia bancaria  en su pueblo, anteriormente se dedicaba a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, su trabajo actual está a 2 kilómetros de su casa y viaja en microbús, también ha comenzado otro pequeño negocio de venta de prendas de enchape de acero.

Aracely, necesita el crédito para comprar mercadería (enchapes de acero para la venta), ya que este es un ingreso extra que ella obtiene aparte de su sueldo, con esta ayuda lograra adquirir más mercadería para la venta.

Aracely, sueña con hacer crecer su pequeño negocio, para que le pueda generar las ganancias suficientes para cubrir las necesidades básicas de su familia, también anhela darle una mejor educación a su hija y ser un buen ejemplo para ella.
texts.en:
Aracely, 26, received a high school education and then studied a two-year clinical laboratory course.  She is married and has a beautiful four-year-old daughter.  She currently lives with her parents because they help care for her daughter while she works.

Aracely is a very determined woman who works as a bank teller in her village, although she used to sell cosmetics by catalogue.  Her place of work is two kilometers from home and she takes a minibus to get there.  She also has begun a small business selling steel plated jewelry.

She is in need of a loan to buy merchandise (steel plated jewelry to sell) since this the way she earns extra income.  With this help she will be able to buy more merchandise to sell.

Aracely dreams of growing her small business so she can earn enough money to cover her family's basic needs.  She also wants to give her daughter a better education and serve as an example for her.

loans.use: To buy merchandise (steel plated jewelry to sell).

loans.name: Mwanamisi

texts.en:
Mwanamisi is a married woman with two children, one of whom attends school whilst the other one is still too young for school. She owns a house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has been operating a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces the major challenge of creditors taking a long time to repay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Razia

texts.en:
Razia is a 50-year-old woman residing in Lahore, Pakistan. She is a mother of two daughters and one son. She is a housewife and looks after her family at home. Her husband provides services in shuttering work for builders. In this regard, her husband needs raw materials such as soldering rods, welding rods, iron rods and sheets for manufacturing iron accessories to improve his shuttering work. So that he can generate more income to financially support his family, Razia is applying for a loan from Kiva's field partner for her husband's work.

She is thankful to BRAC Pakistan and Kiva.

loans.use: to buy raw material for her husband's shuttering work

loans.name: Mehri

texts.en: Mehri is a hardworking woman. She was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in a small town. She is a widow and has one child. She spins thread into wool and this is her activity to earn some money to feed her family. She buys the hair of sheep (fleece) and makes thread. She works hard and has permanent clients. She loves to do her work because it is profitable and the money that she earns is enough for her family's expenditures. Mehri is asking for financial support from Kiva lenders to buy hair of sheep and enlarge her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: To buy the hair of sheep (fleece)

loans.name: Diovina

texts.en:
As a married parent of three children, Diovina works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending. Diovina is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy fish net, bamboo and other material for her fishing business.

Diovina has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving  enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fish net, bamboo and other material for her business

loans.name: Fidel

texts.es:
Fidel, vive con sus hijos y su compañera de vida, son una familia unida, es agricultor, cultiva granos básicos, con las cosechas abastece a su familia con parte de su alimentación y el resto lo utiliza para venderlo y así obtener ingresos para cubrir otras necesidades, trabaja de siete de la mañana a cuatro de la tarde y tiene más de 15 años de practicarlo, lo aprendió de su familia y no cuenta con apoyo económico del extranjero.
Está necesitando de un financiamiento para comprar abono, insecticidas, herbicidas y semilla de maíz para sembrar, espera realizar todos los trabajos y aprovechar la llegada del invierno para obtener una cosecha más abundante y sin plagas.
Sueña con poder comprar un terreno para realizar los cultivos y disminuir las necesidades de su familia.
texts.en:
Fidel lives with his children and life partner and they form a united family. He is a farmer and grows basic seeds. His harvests supply his family with part of their diet and the rest he sells to obtain income to cover other necessities.

He works from seven in the morning to four in the afternoon and he has been in the business for more than 15 years; he learnt it from his family and he has no outside financial support. 

He needs a loan to buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides and corn seed to sow, he hopes to do all this work and take advantage of the onset of winter to obtain a bigger harvest without pests. He dreams of being able to buy some land to cultivate and thus reduce his family's needs.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, insecticides, herbicides and corn seed to sow.

loans.name: Ang's Group

texts.en:
Ang, 42 years old, is a married mother of six dependent children and one of them is in school. She is a resident of a rural area located in Stoeng Sen district of Kampong Thom province. The sources for her family’s income have been rice farming and factory work for more than 10 years.
 
Ang’s group consists of four members and this is the sixth loan for her with VisionFund. The previous loans helped her to have better living conditions. Now she is leading the group of four to apply for this loan with her portion used to build a private toilet for her family. She hopes that everyone in her family will be healthy.

loans.use: to build a private toilet

location.town: Kampong Thom Province, Stoeng Sen District

loans.name: Fredelyn

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Fredelyn works hard to support her family.

She has a fishing business in the Philippines and earns additional income from fish vending. Fredelyn is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to buy additional fish net, pay for maintenance for her boat and buy other materials for her fishing business.

Fredelyn has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream of saving enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy additional fish net and other materials for her business and pay for maintenance for her boat

loans.name: Josephine

texts.en:
Josephine is 50 years old and married with six children. Two of her children are in school.

Josephine earns a living by farming sugarcane in the Philippines, and she is borrowing PHP 11,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies. She has been farming sugarcane for two years, and also earns additional income from fattening pigs.

She is working tirelessly toward the attainment of her dream, which is to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a 49-year-old, married woman with eight children, who are presently in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Gemma has a cattle raising business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 11,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her cattle. She has been in this business for 4 years. 

Gemma would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy feeds, vitamins and other supplies to raise her cattle

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy kitchen cooking oil and charcol for cooking.

loans.name: Maria Ana Dora

texts.es:
María, se dedica a elaborar tortillas para vender, trabaja todos los días de nueve de la mañana a una de la tarde y tiene su negocio desde hace 3 años, ella vive con sus hijos y  su negocio le permite estar al pendiente de lo que ellos necesitan.
Invertirá en maíz, cal, bolsas y leña, tendrá a su disposición la materia prima con la que su negocio funciona, la compra será de utilidad para atender las demandas de sus clientes y seguir mejorando las condiciones de vida familiar. 
El objetivo que tiene María es administrar bien su crédito y resarcir su deuda en el tiempo estipulado.
texts.en:
Maria makes and sells tortillas.  She works every day from 9:00 a.m. until the afternoon and has been in business for three years.  She lives with her children and her business allows her to look after their needs. 

She plans to buy corn, lime, bags and firewood to have raw materials on hand for her business.  The purchase will allow her to attend to customer demand and to continue improving her family's living conditions.

Maria's goal is to manage her loan well and pay it back on time.

loans.use: To buy corn, lime, bags and firewood to have raw materials on hand for her business.

loans.name: Mwanajuma

texts.en:
Mwanajuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She lives at her own house that has electricity but no piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past three years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, cooking oil and sugar. She faces the major challenge of creditors taking a long time to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting she wants to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil and wheat flour. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business

loans.use: to purchase stock of sugar, rice, maize flour, cooking oil and wheat flour.

loans.name: Ofelia Lourdes

texts.es:
Ofelia, es soltera, vive con tres hijos los cuales son dependientes, por la necesidad de sacar a sus hijos adelante inicio su negocio de venta de tortillas y pupusas, lo atiende a tiempo completo y cuenta con la preferencia de sus clientes.
Comprará maíz, quesillo, cal, chicharrón, aceite, condimentos, etc., le será de ayuda para incrementar su productividad y satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes, espera que las demandas de sus productos aumenten y le generen nuevos ingresos.
Sus sueños son tener una casa propia para que sus hijos tengan un lugar más seguro y reducir sus deudas.
texts.en:
Ofelia is single and lives with her three dependent children.  In order to provide for her family she sells tortillas and pupusas (stuffed tortillas) and works full time.  Her customers prefer her business to others.

She will buy corn, cheese, lime, pork, oil, condiments, etc. to increase production and meet customer demand.  She hopes demand will increase so she can generate more income.

Her goal is to have her own house so her children can live in a safe surrounding, and to pay off debt.

loans.use: To buy corn, cheese, lime, pork, oil, condiments, etc. to increase production and satisfy customer demand.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, bags, straws, pineapples, melons and more for making soft drinks and offering more flavours.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy basic grains since she can get them at a lower price this time of year.

loans.name: Catalino

texts.es:
Catalino, de 49 años de edad, trabaja en el centro escolar de su comunidad, es conocido por todas las personas por su educación y buen trato a los demás, se caracteriza por ser una persona muy solidaria y con un excelente grado de servicio a los demás, está casado y tiene un hijo.

Catalino, tiene 19 años de prestar sus servicios como maestro en la escuela de su comunidad, está profesión la ejerce desde que se graduó de la universidad nacional de El Salvador, que con ayuda de sus padres y sacrificio logro graduarse, de esta forma se gana el dinero para satisfacer las necesidades de su familia.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar materiales de construcción, porque se encuentra mejorando y ampliando su casa, porque planea colocar una librería.

Los sueños de Catalino, son apoyar en la educación de su hijo, también establecer una librería para mejorar sus ingresos y su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Catalino is 49 years old and works in the community school. He is well-known by everybody for being polite and because he treats others well. Catalino is a very supportive person. He is married and has one son.

Catalino has been a teacher at the community school since he graduated from the national university of El Salvador 19 years ago. He was able to graduate with the support of his parents, and thanks to the sacrifices that they made. This job provides Catalino with an income to pay for family necessities.

This loan will be used to buy building material to make improvements to and build an extension to his house so that he can open a bookshop.

Catalino dreams of supporting his son’s education. He also wants to open a bookshop in order to increase his income and improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy building material to make improvements to and build an extension to his house so that he can open a bookshop.

loans.name: Arnel

texts.en:
Arnel, 36, is a married man with two children living in Talibon, Bohol. 

He has a hog raising business where he raises and fattens healthy pigs to earn a living. He has been working in this kind of business for almost 5 years now. 

Arnel is asking for a loan to buy pig feed, and materials for house renovation. This will help him to be able to raise and sell healthy pigs. In this way, he can handle his finances and start to pay back his obligation. A small portion of the loan will be used to purchase materials to renovate his house.

Arnel is determined to expand his existing business for the welfare of his children and to ensure a sustainable living.

loans.use: to buy pig feed, and materials for house renovation

loans.name: Shoista

texts.en:
Shoista is a kind woman who was born in the northern part of Tajikistan in 1968. She lives in a small town with her family. She is married and has two children. 

Shoista is a cook. She cooks traditional “Sambusa” (pastries with meat inside) and “Pirazhki” (another type of pastry with meat or other vegetables). She started her business in 1999. Firstly she sold her pastries to people on the street. Now she has a good place for cooking and serving people with traditional tasty meals. She employs three workers and her business is becoming profitable. 

She is asking for a loan from Kiva lenders to buy products to cook her pastries. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy products to cook pastries

loans.name: Ladessia

texts.en:
Ladessia is a 54-year-old, married woman with four children who are still in school. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Ladessia has a weaving business in the Philippines, and she has requested a PHP 20,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy pineapple fiber cloth and other materials for her business. She has been in this business for 18 years. 

Ladessia would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy pineapple fiber cloth and other materials for her business

loans.name: Maria Antonia

texts.es:
María, es viuda, trabaja realizando cultivos de granos básicos para poder sacar adelante a sus tres hijos, el oficio lo aprendió con la ayuda de su esposo y actualmente lo hace con el apoyo de sus hijos.
Comprará una bomba achicadora para el sistema de riego que utiliza en sus cultivos, ya que pagaba alquiler por dicho equipo, espera que al contar con el equipo completo sus cosechas sean más abundantes y sus utilidades sean mayores.
Los proyectos que tiene María son continuar luchando para salir adelante con su familia, aumentar la producción de sus cultivos y resarcir la deuda.
texts.en:
María, who is a widow, works by growing crops of basic grains to be able to raise her three children. She learned the trade with the help of her husband and now she does it with the support of her children. 

She will buy a bailer pump for the irrigation system that she uses in her crops, since she use to rent such equipment. She hopes that by having the complete equipment, her crops will be more abundant and the earnings will be greater. 

María's plans are to continue fighting to get ahead with her family, increase the production of her crops and to repay her debt.

loans.use: to buy a bailer pump for the irrigation system that she uses in her crops.

loans.name: Maria Digna

texts.es:
María, de 29 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos, también trabaja en el centro escolar de su comunidad como profesora de tercer grado, ella se creció con su abuela, quien se dedicaba a la ganadería y a los oficios domésticos, ella es una mujer muy educada y trabajadora, que con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo terminar sus estudios y graduarse como una profesional de la educación, su familia está formada por su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura y ganadería y un hijo de 3 años de edad.

María, tiene alrededor de 7 años de prestar sus servicios en la escuela de su comunidad, ella disfruta mucho su trabajo, porque ayuda a inculcar principios y conocimientos básicos a los niños y niñas de su comunidad.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar materiales de construcción, ya que está construyendo su propia casa y necesita comprar arena, cemento y tejas para concluir la construcción de su casa y poder garantizar una vivienda digna a su familia.

Las metas de María, son terminar de construir su vivienda, también sueña con tener un vehículo que le sirva para viajar desde su casa, hacia los campos agrícolas a recoger las cosechas de su esposo.
texts.en:
Maria, 29, takes care of her household.  She also works at a community school as a third grade teacher.  She was raised by her grandmother who was a livestock farmer and homemaker.  Maria is a very well-mannered, hard-working woman who, through much effort and sacrifice, was able to get a degree in education.  Her husband is a livestock farmer and works in agriculture and they have a three-year-old son.

Maria has been working at the school for seven years.  She enjoys her work a lot because because it is about teaching the children in her community about values and basic knowledge.

The loan money will be used to buy construction materials since she is building her own house and needs to buy sand, cement and tiles to finish construction.  This is so she can give her family a dignified home to live in.

Maria's goal is to finish building her home, and also to buy a vehicle to travel between her home and the farmland to collect her husband's harvested crops.

loans.use: To buy sand, cement and tiles to finish building her house.

loans.name: Burulkan

texts.ru: Бурулкан, 32 года, замужем. У нее среднее образование, она с 2004 года занимается сельским хозяйством. Благодаря упорному труду Бурулкан, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 3 коровы. На 1,0 Га земли она выращивает клевер и кукурузу. Ежемесячная прибыль от бизнес деятельности Бурулкан составляет около 15,000 сом (KGS). Бурулкан обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку телят для откорма и реализации. Она является участником группы "Элиза", в которой состоят еще 2 человека. Доходы от кредита позволят Бурулкан развить ее бизнес, улучшить благосостояние семьи и построить сараи для скота.
texts.en: Burulkan is 32 years old and married.  She has a secondary education and has been involved in agriculture since 2004.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has three cows on her farm.  She also grows clover and corn on one hectare of land.  She makes a monthly income of 15,000 som (KGS) from her activity and business.  She has turned to the bank Bai Tushum and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy a few calves for fattening and resale.  She is a member of the "Eliza" group, which comprises another two people.  The earnings from her loan will help Burulkan to grow her business, to improve her family's well-being, and to build a barn for her livestock.

loans.use: to buy some calves for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Urtazhi

texts.ru: Уртажи, 60 лет, замужем, есть сын. Она занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав свой бизнес много лет назад. Благодаря упорному труду, в хозяйстве Уртажи на сегодняшний день имеется 3 коровы, 20 овец. Ее прибыль составляет до 45,000 сом (KGS) в квартал. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Уртажи обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 150,000 сом (KGS), целью которого является покупка коров для разведения. Доходы от кредита Уртажи планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en: Urtazhi is 60 years old, married, and she has a son.  She is involved in animal husbandry and crop farming, having started her own business many years ago.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has three cows and 20 sheep on her farm.  Every three months, she makes an income of up to 45,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, Urtazhi has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 150,000 som (KGS) with the intention of buying cows for breeding.  Urtazhi is planning to invest the earnings from her loan into further developing her business.

loans.use: to buy additional cows for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Maribel

texts.es:
Desde muy temprano en la mañana, se escucha en la casa de Maribel el palmeo de la masa para las tortillas, también se mira salir el humo de su cocina artesanal. Ella es una mujer trabajadora de sesenta años de edad, que tiene un negocio de venta de tortillas y cuajadas. Su hija de dieciséis años de edad, le ayuda en su tiempo libre luego de la escuela, para así producir más.
Maribel es muy responsable y comprometida con su negocio, en él pone todas sus fuerzas, su clientela ha incrementado notablemente, es por eso que ella recurre a Kiva y MiCrédito para que se le conceda un préstamo y con este poder surtirse de maíz y productos lácteos que son su materia prima. Todo este esfuerzo lo hace para mejorar su calidad de vida y la de sus seres queridos.
texts.en:
Starting very early in the morning one can hear the slapping of the tortilla dough in Maribel’s home, as well as see the smoke leaving her artisanal stove. She is a hard working woman, sixty years old, who has a business selling tortillas and fresh cheese. Her sixteen year old daughter helps her in her free time after school, so as to produce more.

Maribel is very responsible and committed to her business. She puts all of her strength into it. Her clientele has increased notably. This is why she is appealing to Kiva and MiCrédito to grant her a loan with which to stock up on corn and dairy products which are her raw materials. She makes all of this effort to improve her quality of life and that of her loved ones.

loans.use: to buy corn and dairy products.

loans.name: Dúo Deslumbrante Group

texts.es: Dúo Deslumbrantes quien está integrado por doña Edendida Cecilia de 37 años quien desde hace 7 años se dedica a la venta de ropa en un local que ella posee en su vivienda y su negocio ha sido de mucha ayuda para su familia ya que han podido darle estudio universitario a su hija mayor y también ha sus 2 hijos les están brindando estudios en la escuela, actualmente su negocio ha incrementado con el apoyo que se le ha brindado con el crédito, ella solicita su crédito para la compra de ropa para dama, niños, y caballeros, y para la compra de lociones, juguetes, etc. Ella agradece por todo el apoyo que se le ha brindado y espera nuevamente que se le brinda ayuda para hacer crecer más su negocio ya que ella necesita surtir más su negocio para sus clientas que la visitan con frecuencia en su tienda.
texts.en: The Duo Deslumbrantes group, includes Edendida Cecilia, 37, who for the past 7 years has worked selling clothing in a retail space that she has in her house, and her business has been a great help for her family since they have been able to provide a university education for her oldest daughter and they are also providing an education for her two children. Currently her business has grown with the support that she has been offered with the loan. She asks for her loan to purchase clothing for women, children, men and to purchase lotions, toys, etc. She is grateful for all the support that has been offered to her and hopes again that she will be offered help to make her business grow more since she needs to stock her business more so her customers come more frequently to her store.

loans.use: to purchase clothing to sell.

loans.name: Adalberta

texts.es:
Adalberta es una señora de 31 años de edad, tiene una linda familia de siete hijos de los cuales uno se encuentra en el básico y los demás estudian la primaria en la escuela de su comunidad, ellos viven en una comunidad denominada guiniales.
Adalberta con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la venta de ropa típica, ella es vendedora ambulante en las distintas plazas circunvecinas de su comunidad, ella tiene 7 años de realizar esta labor.
Ella ahora ha considerado en remodelar su casa, pues con el paso de los años se ha ido deteriorando, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta el capital suficiente para poder realizar esta remodelación, por tal razón solicita un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, cal, arena, y hierro.
El gran sueño de Adalberta es poder ver a sus hijos convertidos en grandes profesionales para que lo ayuden a construir una casa más grande.
texts.en:
Adalberta is a 31-year-old woman who has a lovely family of seven children of whom one is in preschool and the others are in the primary school in her community. They live in a community called Guiniales.

Adalberta, with the desire to get more income, and support her husband with the household expenses, works selling traditional clothing. She is a street vendor in the various plazas near her community. She has been doing this work for 7 years.

Now she has considered renovating her house, since with the passing of the years it has been deteriorating, but one of the difficulties that she has is that she doesn't have sufficient capital to be able to do this renovation, so she is asking for a loan which will be used to purchase cement, lime, sand and metal.

Adalberta's great dream is to be able to see her children become great professionals to help them build a bigger house.

loans.use: to purchase cement, lime, sand, and metal to renovate her house.

loans.name: Juan

texts.es:
Juan es un hombre de 47 años de edad, es casado tiene una linda familia de seis hijos de los cuales tres ya se encuentran casados y los otros tres se encuentran bajo su cuidado, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Sololá.
Juan con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia, tiene una pequeña tienda de compra y venta de abarrotes en el de su domicilio, esta actividad lo realiza el desde hace doce años.
Este humilde hombre tiene la capacidad de creer en la superación, por lo que ahora quiere invertirá más en u pequeña tienda para mejorar sus ingresos, pero una de las dificultades que él tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente, por lo que solicita un préstamo para poder invertirlo en su tienda comprando productos como recitos, jugos, azúcar, frijol y sal para satisfacer mejor las necesidades de la clientela.
El gran sueño de Juan es que su negocio sea más grande para el próximo año.
texts.en:
Juan is a 47-year-old man, he is married and has a lovely family of six children of whom three are married and the other three are in his care. This humble family lives in a community in Sololá.

Juan, with the desire to get income and support his family, has a small store selling groceries in his home. He has done this work for twelve years.

This humble man has the capacity to believe in improving himself, for which now he wants to invest more in his small store to increase his income, but one of his difficulties is that he doesn't have sufficient capital, so he is asking for a loan to be able to invest it in his store, purchasing products such as chips, juices, sugar, beans and salt to better satisfy his customers' needs. 

Juan's dream is that his business is larger next year.

loans.use: to buy and sell groceries such as chips, juices, sugar, beans and salt.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar power system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom and install plumbing for sewage. This way, she can guarantee more comfort for her family.

loans.name: Dúo Roca Fuerte Group

texts.es: Dúo Roca Fuerte, este Grupo está conformado por la señora Blanca Isabel de 21 años de edad, ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pan, se ha dedicado a esta actividad desde hace varios años, también como actividad secundaria vende ropa típica, en esta oportunidad ella está solicitando este crédito para la compra de materiales para su panadería, y para la compra de ropa, esperando que le puedan ayudar con el crédito solicitado desde ya les agradece por su ayuda.
texts.en: The Roca Fuerte Duo. This group includes Blanca Isabel, who is 21 years old. She works making and selling bread. She has done this activity for several years. As a secondary activity, she also sells traditional clothing. At this time, she is asking for a loan to buy materials for her bread bakery and to buy clothing. She hopes you can help her with the loan she has asked for, and she thanks you now for your help.

loans.use: to buy materials for a bread bakery and to buy traditional clothing to sell.

loans.name: Cynthia

texts.en:
Cynthia is 47 years old and married with two children. With two children still in school, Cynthia works very hard to provide for them.

Cynthia runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a 10,000 Philippines peso (PHP) loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, spices, eggs, sugar, coffee, cooking oil and personal care products.

Cynthia has been in this business for two years.

She would like to save enough money so she can afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell like canned goods, soft drinks, spices, eggs, sugar, coffee, cooking oil and personal care products.

loans.name: Jenette

texts.en:
Jenette is 46 years old, married with two children.

Jenette works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and has requested a PHP 15000 loan through NWTF to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, cooking oil, spices, coffee, milk, sugar and other personal care products.

Jenette has borrowed and paid 3 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 9 years and also earns an income from fishing.

Jenette aspires to save enough to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more items to sell like canned goods, cooking oil, spices, coffee, milk, sugar and other personal care products.

loans.name: Bahati

texts.en:
