Bahati is married and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past four years, she has operated a business selling cashew nuts, selling at the market to her neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her business. 

Bahati is requesting for a loan to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase six sacks of cashew nuts.

loans.name: Maria Eufemia

texts.es:
Doña María eufemia tiene  53 años es viuda y tiene 6 hijos de (36-34-32-29) años, de los cuales uno de sus hijos va a la universidad. dentro de los sueños y esperanzas para el futuro de Doña maría están la siembra de aguacate y quinua.
El préstamo ayudara en la compra de abono orgánico para el manejo forestal de tara, con 30 años en este negocio le gusta porque la producción es mas rápido que otros cultivos.el préstamo ayudara también en obtener una mejor producción y en la educación de su  menor hijo .
texts.en:
Doña María Eufemia, 53 years old, is a widow with six children (ages 36, 34, 32, and 29), one of whom is currently in college. One of Doña María's dreams and hopes for the future is to plant avocado and quinoa.
This loan will help her buy organic fertilizer for her tara crops. She has been in this business for thirty years and enjoys it because the production time is faster than with other crops. The loan will also help her increase her crop yield and pay for her youngest son's education.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her tara crops.

loans.name: Saiberia Group

texts.en:
Hadija, who is in her middle 40s, is married with three children; two of them are grown-ups, and the other one is still at school. She has been a food vendor for three years now. She works from from 6 a.m. to 10 p.m. daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Hadija's fourth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. She used the previous loans to buy tables and chairs and increased the mamalishe (small restaurant) stock. She is doing great and appreciates Kiva for their support. Now her mamalishe is big and attractive to many customers. She used the profit to pay school fees and loan repayments and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy sodas, water, juice, flours, cooking oil, beans, meat, rice and charcoal for cooking. She dreams of owning a nice hotel.

Hadija will share this loan with her loan group, "Saiberia," which has six members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy sodas, water, juice, flours, cooking oil, beans, meat, rice and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Jenelyn

texts.en:
Jenelyn is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. She is 32 years old and two of her children are currently in school.

Jenelyn has a food processing business in the Philippines. She has requested a PHP 10000 loan amount through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, flour, fish, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

Jenelyn has been in this business for 5 years. She would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, flour, fish, spices, cooking oil and other materials for her food production business.

loans.name: Oeurt

texts.en: Oeurt is 38 years old and lives in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. She is a married mother with five dependent children. Four of her children are studying in high school and the other one is too young to attend school. For a living, she grows rice and cassava as the main sources of income. Sometimes, she works as a paid worker to supplement income. This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizers, seeds and plow the field to grow cassava. She hopes that she can earn more income and support her children’s education.

loans.use: to buy fertilisers, seeds and plow the field to grow cassava.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Salima

texts.en:
Salima is a married woman with three kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family.

Salima operates a grocery stall selling vegetables.  She sells at the market to town dwellers and neighbors. She faces a challenge of perishability in her place of operation. 


With the Kshs 35,000 she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale.

loans.name: Mutabar

texts.en: Mutabar is a hardworking woman. She was born in 1962. She lives in a small town in the northern part of Tajikistan. She is widow and has three children. Mutabar is a generous, goal oriented and confident person. She has done agricultural business for almost three years.  Her business is planting trees and keeping a seasonal garden. She has apricot trees and trades at a domestic market. Her business is good and she is satisfied to earn money doing agriculture. She is asking a loan from IMON and KIVA lenders to buy cattle. Mutabar is planning to keep cattle; she has good conditions to keep them. She hopes to be supported.

loans.use: To buy cattle

loans.name: Khouloud

texts.en:
Khouloud is a 30-year old single lady, who has been running her accessories sales shop since 2009, which is her only source of income, in a well managed way.

Khouloud is the sole breadwinner to another member of her family, that's why she works hard to develop her business to make sure she can increase her income and develop her living standards.

Khouloud's living needs are increasing, and her income is barely enough to cover the requested needs. Thus, for this reason she is acquiring a YOUTH loan from Kiva's field partner Al Majmoua, to increase her business merchandise with a special spring and summer collection that will attract customers' attention and increase her sales.

She hopes to stay capable of developing her business in a well managed way to make sure she can benefit from a better future.

loans.use: to increase her business merchandise with a special spring and summer collection that will attract customers' attention and increase her sales.

loans.name: Gemma

texts.en:
Gemma is a married woman with five children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. Gemma is 50 years old, and one of her children is still in school.

Gemma has a buying and selling of fruits business in the Philippines. Gemma requested a PHP 17,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase more fruits like bananas, oranges, apples, papayas and other kinds of fruits to sell in her food stall.

Gemma has been in this business for 15 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits like bananas, oranges, apples, papayas and other kinds of fruits to sell in her food stall

loans.name: Giorgi

texts.en:
Giorgi, who is an 18-year-old young man, lives in small village named Shilda. He lives with his pensioner grandparents and works hard to create financial stability for the family. Giorgi works as a hired daily worker and generates approximately 300 GEL. As there is high unemployment rate in the region and he was unable to start any stable job, Giorgi decided to be involved in his own business.

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Giorgi requested a loan from Credo to start up a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision of business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to poor people, who do not have access to credit products being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. With the received credit, Giorgi plans to open a small general store near his house. He will purchase necessary equipment, have money for working capital and will start trading among his villagers. This new business initiative, financed with a Kiva start-up loan, will significantly increase the income of the family. Giorgi will be able to improve the living conditions and more effectively meet the daily costs.

loans.use: to renovate a building to open a general store.

loans.name: Edna

texts.en:
Edna is a 49-year-old married woman with four children, two of whom are still in school. She is a very hard working entrepreneur.

Edna has a farming fruits business in the Philippines. Edna requested a PHP 11,500 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Edna has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Reynalee

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Reynalee works hard to support her family.

She has a food vending business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from a buy-and-sell personal collection business. Reynalee is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to buy ingredients like meat, cooking oil, flour, eggs and other materials for her food production business.

Reynalee has been sustaining her business activities through her past 5 loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy ingredients like meat, cooking oil, flour, eggs and other materials for her food production business

loans.name: Chum

texts.en:
Chum is a 39-year-old married mother with three dependent children living in the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. There are two of her children who are studying in high school. She struggles for a living via growing rice and raising pigs as the main sources of income. To supplement her family income, she works for others for a fee. 

For Chum, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will spend her entire loan to renovate her house. She hopes that she will have a proper house, as others do.

loans.use: to renovate her house

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Fe

texts.en:
Fe works hard to support her family. Fe is married and has a buying and selling of fruits business in the Philippines.

Fe requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more fruits to sell like bananas, apples, oranges, mangoes, and other fruits.

Fe has been in this business for 25 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more fruits to sell like bananas, apples, oranges, mangoes, and other fruits

loans.name: Soknorl's Group

texts.en:
Soknorl is 35 years old; she is a married mother of a child who is still depending on her. She lives in a rural area located in the Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province. The main source of her family’s income has come from rice farming for 15 years, and to earn more income, she also works for other farms as well. 

This is the fourth loan for Soknorl’s group, which consists of two members, with VisionFund. The previous loan helped her family to have enough money to support her family’s daily needs. Now, she is leading this group to apply for this loan; with her portion, she will buy fertilizer and pay for laborers to work on her farm. She hopes that she could earn more money to have a better standard of living and the ability to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor

loans.name: Jose Osmar

texts.es:
José, desarrolla diferentes actividades como pescador, jornalero y albañil, para generar ingreso con lo que cubre sus compromisos familiares, aprendió los oficios como ayudante, con la experiencia necesaria decidió independizarse, vive junto a su familia.
Comprará cucharas, escuadras, palas, hierro, cemento y arena, tendrá herramientas para realizar sus trabajos y además adquirirá materiales para hacer reparaciones en su vivienda, su objetivo es mejorar la calidad de sus servicios y hacer que su negocio sea más popular.
Sus sueños son ser una persona con más experiencia en su negocio, remodelar su vivienda y darle a su familia una vida más confortable.
texts.en: José works in diverse activities such as fisherman, daily laborer and construction worker in order to generate income for his family commitments. He learned the work as a helper. With the needed experience, he decided to do the job on his own. He lives with his family. He will buy spoons, protractors, shovels, iron, cement and sand in order to have tools for his work, and he will also buy materials to make repairs to his house. His objective is to improve the quality of his services and make his business more popular. His dreams are to be a person with more experience in his business, to remodel his house and to give his family a more comfortable life.

loans.use: to buy spoons, protractors, shovels, iron, cement and sand to have tools for his work and to make repairs in his house.

loans.name: Hafiza

texts.en:
Hafiza is a generous woman. She was born in 1956. She is an experienced and challenged person. She is from the northern part of a country. She lives in small town. She is married. She has an agricultural business. 

Hafiza is busy with keeping, feeding and selling livestock. She knows her duties well. She wants to enlarge her business. But she has not enough money to enlarge her business. 

Hafiza is asking for financial support from KIVA project to buy horned cattle for her business. She awaits your mercy.

loans.use: to buy horned cattle

loans.name: Maura

texts.en:
Maura works hard to support her family. She is widowed and has a weaving business in the Philippines.

Maura requested a PHP 12,500 loan through NWTF to buy pineapple fiber cloth and other materials for her business.

Maura has been in this business for 20 years now.

She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy pineapple fiber cloth and other materials for her business

loans.name: Amalia

texts.en:
Amalia is a married woman with nine children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Amalia is 52 years old and has three children who are still in school.

Amalia has a farming fruits business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 8,500 loan amount through NWTF to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Amalia has been in this business for three years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase sacks of fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Jessica

texts.en:
As a married parent of five children, Jessica works hard to support her family.

She has a buy and sell ready to wear  business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from fishing and food vending.  Jessica is borrowing PHP 10,000 through NWTF to purchase more ready to wear products to sell like pants, t-shirts, shorts, etc.

Jessica has been sustaining her business activities through her past five loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more ready to wear products to sell like pants, t-shirts, shorts, etc

loans.name: Sopheap's Group

texts.en:
Sopheap is age 47 years old, and she is a widow woman with six children, four of whom are dependent children. She is a resident in a rural area of Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province. The sources of her family’s income have been from rice farming and potato farming for 20 years. 

Sopheap’s Group consists of two members; this is the first loan for her with VisionFund, while the other one is an existing client who has borrowed loans for three cycles already and completely paid off the loans. 

Now, Sopheap is leading the group to borrow this loan, with the portion to buy farming supplies to support her current business. She hopes that she could gain more profit to support her family’s needs.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Ana Edelmira

texts.es:
Ana, vive con su hijo y un hermano, ella tiene 43 años de edad, su actividad económica es la venta de ropa y cosméticos, desde hace más de 20 años y lo hace de forma ambulante casa por casa, hasta la fecha no representa dificultades en el negocio.
Comprará variedad de prendas de vestir para ambos sexos, esta inversión le permitirá tener un mejor inventario para satisfacer los gustos de sus clientes, espera que las ventas sean mayores y tener una mejor situación financiera.
Su objetivo es mantenerse trabajando hasta lograr tener un local para atender mejor a sus clientes y ofrecer otro tipo de mercadería.
texts.en:
Ana lives with her son and brother, and she is 43 years old.  For more than 20 years, she has made a living by selling clothing and cosmetics.  She does this as a street vendor by going from house to house.  So far she has not had difficulties with her business.

She will buy a variety of clothing for both sexes.  This investment will allow her to have better inventory to satisfy her customers' tastes.  She hopes that sales will be larger and she will have a better financial situation.  Her goal is to continue working until she manages to get a place where she can better tend to her customers and offer another type of merchandise.

loans.use: to buy a variety of clothing for both sexes.

loans.name: Yoeurn's Group

texts.en:
YOEURN is age 55 years old, and she is a widow woman who has three children; they are all dependent children. She is a resident in a rural area of Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province. The sources of her family’s income for 35 years are from rice farming, potato farming, and also feeding pigs to sell. She could earn around 30,000KHR per day to support her family’s needs.

This is the first loan with VisionFund for YOEURN’s group, which consists of three members. Now, she is leading the group to borrow this loan with the portion to buy food for feeding pigs. 

She hopes that she could gain more profit and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy food for feeding pigs

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Arsenia

texts.en:
Arsenia runs a sari-sari (variety) store. She sells various commodities ranging from bread, mineral water, canned goods, condiments, beverages, soap and soft drinks. In addition to that, she also sells bamboo (for house materials like walls or fence). She is a mother of six children. Two of them are still attending school. 

She is asking for a loan to buy stocks of bamboo and purchase a motor boat.  This will help Arsenia cater to her customer's needs. She could now also purchase a brand new boat that will help improve her fishing livelihood.

In this way she will be able to expand her business and able to handle her finances.

In the future, Arsenia hopes that she could be able to continue send her children for a college education.

loans.use: to buy stocks of bamboo and purchase a motor boat

loans.name: Lina

texts.en:
Lina is a married woman with five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lina is 47 years old, and has five children who are currently in school.

Lina has a farming fruits business in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 14,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Lina has been in this business for seven years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Farida

texts.en:
Farida is a married woman with one child who attends school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, and sugar. She faces a major challenge of transportation to her place of operation.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Maria Josefina

texts.es:
María, utilizo el crédito anterior para adquirir la materia prima con la que elaboraría manualidades y así obtener mejores ingresos, su familia se encuentra en buenas condiciones de salud y ella por su parte ha asistido a cursos de elaboración de  manualidades para perfeccionar sus conocimientos y seguir agregando nuevos productos, además comenta que hoy en día tiene  una venta de atoles.
Invertirá en papelería, alambre, pegamento, para elaborar piñatas y comprara azúcar, harina, bolsas, etc., así podrá preparar la venta de atoles, espera dar un mejor servicio a sus clientes y que su progreso continúe.
texts.en: María used her previous loan to buy basic materials with which she made handcrafts, and in this way obtain better income. Her family is in good health, and she has attended some handicraft classes in order to perfect her knowledge and continue adding new products. Additionally, she says that nowadays she sells "atoles" (hot beverages). She will invest the loan in paper goods, wire, glue in order to make piñatas, and in sugar, flour, bags, etc. to prepare atoles for sale. She hopes to give her customers a better service and that her progress continues.

loans.use: to buy paper goods, wire, glue in order to make piñatas; and to buy sugar, flour, bags, etc. in order to prepare atoles (hot beverages) for sale.

loans.name: Kashi

texts.en:
Kashi is a married woman with two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour, salt and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: Angela Misaela

texts.es:
Ángela, de 40 años de edad, se dedica a los oficios domésticos de su hogar y a la venta de tortillas, es una persona muy conocida por la actividad productiva que realiza, su familia está formada por su esposo y sus tres hijos, de los cuales dos se encuentran estudiando en la escuela de su comunidad, mientras que su hijo mayor le ayuda en los trabajos agrícolas a su padre.

Ángela, tiene 20 años de experiencia en realizar esta actividad productiva, la cual ha aprendió de su madre quien dedicó toda su vida a esta actividad.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar maíz a precio económico y para comprar una nueva estufa, porque la que tiene ya está muy deteriorada y necesita una nueva para continuar su negocio y poder dar un buen servicio a sus clientes.

Las metas de Ángela, son mejorar las instalaciones de su negocio y comprar un vehículo porque planea vender verduras por las comunidades cercanas.
texts.en:
Ángela, 40, is a homemaker.  She also sells tortillas and is very well known for her work.  Her family is made up of her husband and her three children, two of whom attend school in the community.  Her oldest son helps his father with the farming tasks.

Ángela has 20 years of experience in this job.  She learned it from her mother, who spent her whole life in that line of work.

She's going to use the money to buy corn at a good price.  She's also going to buy a new stove because her current one is worn out and she needs a new one to continue with her business and give good customer service.

Ángela's goals are to improve her business facilities and buy a vehicle, because she plans to sell vegetables in the nearby communities.

loans.use: to buy corn at a good price as well as a new stove

loans.name: Hilda

texts.es: La señora Hilda tiene 38 años de edad es casada y su esposo se dedica a chófer tiene 4 hijos (20-17-4)años, todos van a la escuela y dentro de los sueños y esperanzas de doña Hilda están arreglar su casa y dar una educación profesional a sus hijos. con 10 años en el negocio de la tara y con certificado orgánico le gusta porque es un negocio que no requiere mucha mano de obra y cuenta con todo el asesoramiento técnico brindado por los ingenieros que trabajan dentro de la asociación de tara.
texts.en:
Hilda is 38 years old. She is married and her husband works as a driver. She has 4 children (20, 17, 4 years old). All of them go to school. 

Hilda dreams and hopes of fixing up her house and giving her children a professional education. 

She has been working for 10 years in the tara and organic certificate business and likes it because it is a business that does not require a lot of labor and she has technical advice offered by the engineers working at the tara association.

loans.use: to buy organic fertilizer for her tara trees

loans.name: Zviadi

texts.en:
Zviadi is a 34-year-old married man from the village of Dablatsikhe. He has six family members. Zviadi is busy with a small-scale agricultural business. He has requested loans from local financial institutions several times for agricultural business start-up, but without any success. His loan requests were rejected all the time because of his low income and his family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of income for the family is seasonal income from their agricultural business. They have a vineyard and a plot of land where they grow nut trees. Also, they take care of cattle and produce dairy products. They sell nuts and cheese at the local open market. The average monthly income of the family is 250 GEL. It is hardly enough for food for a six-member family. 

According to Credo estimations, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. Zviadi requested a loan from Credo to start a new type of business. His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative of Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program provides business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions to rural poor people who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income and who, therefore, do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Zviadi plans to purchase a hand tractor and to start working on private orders. He will generate significant income and will do his best to provide financial stability for his family. Zviadi awaits your support.

loans.use: To purchase a hand tractor

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: la señora acudio a una clinica por molestia de su placa dental que se le habia quebrado, actualmente esta trabajando pero tiene que solventar sola los gastos de su casa y familia ya que es el sosten de una familia, por lo cual le es imposible adquirir una nueva placa ya que no cuenta con el dinero, y es por eso que solicita el apoyo.
texts.en: This woman turned to a clinic because of a problem with her dentures, which had broken.  She is currently working, but she needs to pay the household and family expenses by herself.  She supports the family.  Therefore, it is impossible for her to get new dentures because she does not have the money.  That is why she is requesting the support.

loans.use: to pay for dental treatment.

loans.name: Asenal Group

texts.en:
Tusajigwe, who is in her late 20s, is married with one child who is still at school. She has been running a beauty salon for three years now and works from eight in the morning through nine at night to make a good monthly profit. Tusajigwe is a member of the loan group “Asenal,” which has four members who will hold each other accountable for repaying the loan.

Tusajigwe is requesting a loan to buy salon equipment to meet customer demand. This will be her first loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  In the future, she dreams of expanding her salon and adding clothing to her salon.

loans.use: to buy salon equipment to meet customer demand

loans.name: Mirzonabi

texts.ru: Мирзонаби 57 лет. Он женат и отец одного сына. Его сын женат. Мирзонаби вместе семей проживает в районе Гафуров. Мирзонаби активный и умный человек. Он занимается маленьким бизнесом. У него есть киоск, где он продает хлеб, кукурузы, напитки, криешки и другие. Ему нравится своя работа. В дальнейшем он хочет стать большим и хорошим бизнесменом. Он хочет купить легковую машину и сам заниматься привозом товаров. Из-за нехватки денежных средств он обратился за кредитом. Мирзонаби верит в Вас и на Вашу поддержку. Поддержите его.
texts.en:
Mirzonabi is 57 and married with one son, who is also married. He and his family live in the Gafurov region. He is an active and intelligent person who runs a small business. He has a kiosk where he sells bread, corn, drinks, snacks, etc. He likes his work and wants to become a bigger and better businessman in the future.

Mirzonabi wants to buy a car to transport his goods himself. He is looking for a loan because he doesn't have enough of his own money. He has faith in you and your support. Please support him.

loans.use: to buy a car to transport goods

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 52 years old and married with one child. For the past four years, she has run a general store in the Philippines and also earns an income from poultry. Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She has borrowed and repaid three previous loans from NWTF.

Teresita is requesting a 10,000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more groceries to sell. She aspires to save enough money to expand her business and repair her house.

loans.use: to purchase groceries to sell

loans.name: Carmelita

texts.en:
Carmelita is 62 years old and married with nine children. For the past 15 years, she has operated a fishing business in the Philippines. Carmelita is a very hardworking entrepreneur. 

Carmelita is requesting a 15,000 PHP loan through NWTF to buy fishing gear and other equipment. In the future, she would like to save enough money to support the financial stability of her family.

loans.use: to buy fishing gear and equipment

loans.name: Juan Ernesto

texts.es:
Juan, vive con su esposa y uno de sus hijos, en su hogar él trabaja para poder tener alimentación vestuario y alud, se dedica a cultivar maíz, maicillo y frijol, una parte de la cosecha es almacenada para consumo familiar y la otra es utilizada para comercializarla.
Con el crédito tendrá los recursos para comprar insumos agrícolas que necesita para llevar a cabo en el tiempo justo la siembra de maíz, espera obtener buenos resultados con la inversión y cancelar su deuda.
Su principal objetivo es mantener con vida su negocio para proveer a su familia de todo lo necesario para tener una vida digna.
texts.en:
Juan lives with his wife and one of his children.  He works to provide his household with food and good health.  He earns a living growing corn, sorghum, and beans.  He stores part of his harvest for the family and sells the rest.

The loan will give him the resources to buy the agricultural inputs he needs to plant his corn at just the right time.  He hopes the investment will yield good results so he can pay back his debt.

Juan's main goal is to keep his business running so he can give his family everything they need to have a decent life.

loans.use: to buy the agricultural inputs he needs to plant his corn at just the right time

loans.name: Willian Bladimir

texts.es:
Willian, con el financiamiento anterior complemento la compra de una moto taxi, le ha sido de mucho beneficio para mejorar las condiciones financieras y familiares, no ha tenido problemas para mantenerse trabajando.
Está solicitando de un nuevo crédito con el que comprara llantas, batería y otros repuestos necesarios para optimizar las condiciones de su moto taxi, le permitirá dar seguridad y comodidad a sus clientes.
texts.en:
Willian used the previous loan as a supplement to purchase a ‘moto taxi’ [three wheeled motorized vehicle].  It has been a big help to him in improving his financial and family situations.  He has not had any problems maintaining his work.

He is requesting a new loan to buy tires, a battery, and other replacement parts that are needed to optimize the condition of his moto taxi.  This will allow him to make his customers safe and comfortable.

loans.use: to buy tires, a battery, and other replacement parts that are needed to optimize the condition of his moto taxi.

loans.name: Anonymous

texts.es: El señor tiene 65 años es casado, pensionado desde hace varios años, diabético de diez años de evolución que desde hace dos años comenzó a tener disminución visual consulta con otro medico oftalmólogo quien decide dar tratamiento quirúrgico teniendo pésimos resultados actualmente el señor presenta sangrado activo en la retina de ambos ojos que merma su calidad de vida. Es necesario que el señor reciba la atencion urgentemente ya que el señor labora de comerciante para mantener a su familia.
texts.en:
This man is 65 years old and married.  He has been receiving a pension for several years.  He has been a diabetic for ten years.  Two years ago he started to have decreased vision.  He consulted with another eye doctor, who decided to treat him surgically, which had bad results.

He now has active bleeding in the retinas of both eyes, which reduces his quality of life.  This man urgently needs attention because he works for a merchant in order to support his family.

loans.use: to pay for eye surgery.

loans.name: Mohamad

texts.en:
Mohamad is a 36-year-old married father of one child. He is a Palestinian refugee who has worked as a fisherman for 21 years. Mohamad adores the sea; he was born as a fisherman and can't imagine himself working at anything else. He used to go out to the sea with his elder brother who taught him this profession and Mohamad became talented. He has a very good reputation and is liked by most of his relatives and friends.

Mohamad is a hardworking man. He describes himself at the fish in his own sea. Mohamad has been an Al Majmoua borrower for nine consecutive loan cycles. He used his previous loans to invest in his business and they had a very good impact. He has been able to maintain his boat to keep it in good shape, ensure that his business is going fine, increase his income, and improve his family's social and financial situations. 

Mohamad is requesting a loan to maintain his boat to keep it in good condition. He will use his loan to improve his living and increase his income. Mohamad is working hard so that one day he will be capable of buying a bigger boat. In the future, Mohamad hopes to increase the number of boats he owns and be able to recruit others to improve their living.

loans.use: to maintain his boat to keep it in good condition to improve his living

loans.name: Carmen

texts.en:
Carmen runs and operates a store selling rtw (ready-to-wear), like t-shirts, pants, dresses and other apparel.  She is a widow woman with four dependents. Two of her children are still attending school. She resides in Talibon, Bohol.

She has requested a loan to buy more supplies like garments, pants and various dresses. This will help improve her daily sales and  provide various stock for her store. In this way, she could expand her business and start to venture into other business opportunities to be productive. Thus, she would continue financing the schooling of her children and able to provide them with basic needs. 

She is hoping that she will be successful in handling her livelihood in the near future.

loans.use: to buy more supplies like garments, pants and various dresses

loans.name: Alice

texts.en:
Her name is Alice, 51, a resident of Dasmarinas, Cavite, Philippines. She is married to Edgardo, a collector. She manages her own household while operating the business. She works hard to augment their income for their daily household and personal needs. 

Alice has a direct selling business. She sells natural organic vitamins. Filipinos are now more knowledgeable and health conscious. They are learning to take natural vitamins to support their well-being for the love of their family. Aside from vitamins, she also sells personal goods such as beauty products from popular direct selling brands. Her regular customers are her neighbors, friends, family and the local community. She earns a minimum of Php1,500 in sales every week.

To help her sustain her business, she is requesting a Php 15,000 loan which she will use to buy merchandise items such as natural vitamins and some beauty products to sell to her customers. Her regular customers are her neighbors, relatives, friends and the local community. She is thanking God and you in advance for a good return on her investment, and for the financial help that will be given her. 

Alice aims to grow her business and be able to save for their old age. She prays to stay strong and healthy so she could still see her future grandchildren. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship members to share stories of her work every week and where she can also draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies. 

* All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and pay microfinance loans.

loans.use: To pay for natural organic drinks and skin products to sell.

loans.name: Mary Grace

texts.en:
Mary Grace is a married woman with four children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Mary Grace is 35 years old and all of her children are in school.

She has a general store business in the Philippines. Mary Grace requested a PHP 15,000 loan amount through NWTF in order to purchase additional stocks of groceries to sell.

Mary Grace has been in this business for 13 years. In the future, she would like to save enough money so she can continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase an additional stock of groceries to sell.

loans.name: Adima

texts.en:
Adima is a 41-year-old married man with three children living in Kasese, Uganda. He has been a teacher for 16 years, and works eight hours a day. He also does farming and forestry, and owns a general merchandise shop to earn extra income. 

Because of his love for young children, he was inspired into service and his dreams are to educate his children up to university and also to upgrade his studies. 

Long distances to his work place is a challenge. Adima intends to use the loan to buy a motorcycle to help him with transportation to work.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle to help him with transportation to work.

loans.name: Mary

texts.en:
Hello, world! Meet Mary. She is a smallholder Kenyan farmer making a living off dairy, poultry and maize farming. She started farming 20 years ago when she tied the knot with her better half. She did it to help her husband put food on the table for their family. 

Mary had a difficult childhood, growing up in a poor family. She has become hardened to the realities of life, but she is deeply worried about her children's future. She struggles every day to afford education expenses to ensure that her children lead a more comfortable and fulfilling life. 

With this request, she is seeking a KES 30,000 loan to purchase poultry. The brood of chickens will lay eggs that will generate income for Mary through sales and the hatching of chicks. She will use the money from the sale of eggs to pay for all her expenses, including loan debt and her children's education. 

She will continue working on the 0.5-acre farmland to make a decent living and keep her spirit alive. Mary's family will be very grateful for the loan that will go a long way toward improving their lives. 

Help out an enterprising mother with a creative mind and big dreams!

loans.use: To purchase poultry.

loans.name: Joshua

texts.en:
Joshua is a 35-year-old hard working man, married with five children, living in Kasese, Uganda. Joshua sells salt as the main source of income and gets additional income from a bakery. He is looking forward to educating his children, however, weather changes are looked at being major challenges affecting his business. 

Joshua is requesting a loan to buy salt for selling.

loans.use: to buy salt for selling.

loans.name: Mapenzi

texts.en:
Mapenzi is from the town of Likoni. For more than seven years, she has owned a food café downtown. Mapenzi’s business has attained a good reputation in the neighborhood and, thanks to that, has a good clientele. Mapenzi is a very hardworking person who has always worked to reach her goals and objectives. She defines herself as a person who always strives to the maximum to attain what she wants. 

Mapenzi is requesting a loan to purchase tomatoes, onions, chicken, rice, cooking oil, and other good products to stock offer her customers. She is grateful for this opportunity to get a loan that will help her very much.

loans.use: to purchase tomatoes, onions, chicken, rice, and cooking oil

loans.name: Teak's Group

texts.en:
A father of three dependent children, two of whom are in school, Teak is 40 years old and living in the Bovel district of Battambang province. He can earn income to support his family’s living via growing rice on a one hectares area. Moreover, he works for other farmers to earn extra income. He has been involved this business for 15 years, and it earns him about 54,000KHR per day. 

For Teak, this is his second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and he has fully repaid back his past loan completely. 

He will spend his entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay laborers fee for plowing land. He hopes that he can get more income to repair his old house.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay laborers

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane is grateful that she was granted a 30,000 PHP loan which she used to purchase more fruits/vegetables to sell. Through her earnings she is able to support her family and meet their daily basic needs. Aside from her fruit stand, she also makes rags to augment her income.

She would like to apply for Php 20,000, which she will use to buy more fabric, scrap cloth, thread and other materials needed in sewing rags to sell. Her round palm sized rags are useful in cleaning cabinets and kitchen counters. Rags are major items for housekeeping and cleaning and is changed constantly to ensure a bacteria-free rag. She is thanking God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given her, for her income from selling rags is a big help in their daily sustenance and for her children's education.

Mary Jane hopes to be sustain and grow her businesses so she could send all her three schooling children to college. She dreams to give her family a better life through all her hard work. She faithfully meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work every week and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God she studies.

 *All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to pay for scrap cloth, fabrics, and needles to make her rags and partly for fruits and veggies to sell.

loans.name: Ana Miriam

texts.es:
Ana, requiere de un nuevo financiamiento con el que podrá comprar arroz, frijoles, maíz, azúcar, aceite, etc., y útiles escolares, así mantendrá la competitividad de su negocio y sus ingresos serán estables.
Al invertir el crédito anterior en nuevos productos para su negocio Ana ha logrado tener nuevos clientes y mejores ganancias con las que cubre los gastos de su hogar y mantiene un buen record crediticio.
texts.en: Ana needs new financing that she will use to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, oil, etc., as well as school supplies. This will allow her to maintain the competitiveness of her business and stabilize her income. When she invested the previous loan in new products for her business, Ana was able to attract new customers and improve her income, thus allowing her to cover her household expenses and maintain a good credit report.

loans.use: to buy rice, beans, corn, sugar, oil, etc. as well as school supplies to maintain the competitiveness of her business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build an electric pump at their home to improve access to water.

loans.name: Jose Ysrael

texts.es:
José, de 43 años de edad, está casado, tiene 2 hijos y se dedica a realizar trabajos de albañilería por contratos y también trabaja en la siembra de granos básicos. 

José, se dedica a la albañilería desde la edad de 18 años, esta actividad la aprendió junto a su padre, quien le acompañaba todos los días en sus jornadas de trabajo, motivado por las ganancias que le genera, decidido continuar ejerciendo esa actividad, también su esposa le da un aporte económico a su familia, pues ella se dedica a la venta de tortillas los fines de semana, de esta manera apoya a satisfacer las necesidades de su hogar.

El dinero será utilizado para comprar materiales de construcción, porque se encuentra reparando el techo de su casa que se encuentra en mal estado y aprovechará la época de verano para desmontar y renovar todo el techo de su casa, de esta manera podrá brindar una mayor seguridad a su familia.

Las metas que tiene a futuro son, tener una vivienda más adecuada y amueblada, comprar un vehículo y apoyar en la educación de sus hijos, ya que uno de ellos sueña con ser médico veterinario.
texts.en:
José is 43 years old, is married and has two children. He works as a bricklayer bu contract and also works growing basic grains. José has worked as a bricklayer since he was 18. He learned this trade together with his father who accompanied him every day at his work.

Motivated by the income that it generated he decided to continue doing this work. His wife also contributes to the family economy as she sells tortillas on the week-ends. In this way she helps to fulfill the household needs.

The money from the loan will be used to buy construction materials as he is repairing the roof that is currently in poor condition, taking advantage of the summer to tear apart and renovate the whole roof. In this way he can provide better security for the family.

The goals that he has for the future are to make his house more appropriate and furnished, buy a vehicle and support the education of his children as one of them dreams of becoming a veterinarian.

loans.use: to buy construction materials to repair the roof of his house.

loans.name: Valentin

texts.es:
Don Valentin tiene 53 años es casado y tiene 2 hijos (18-13)años en la secundaria y en la universidad; dentro de los sueños y esperanzas del propietario están dar una profesión a sus hijos y/o sembrar nuevos cultivos.
con 33 años conociendo el negocio de la tara le gusta por ser un negocio que no necesita mucha inversión y cuenta con el asesoramiento técnico por parte de los ingenieros de la asociación de tara, lo que garantiza que el negocio tenga éxito.
texts.en: Valentin is 33 years old, is married and has two children aged 18 and 13 years old who are in secondary school and university. Part of the wishes and dreams of this property owner are to provide his children with a profession and to plant new crops. At 33 years old he knows that the tara (a thorny native shrub) business doesn't need much investment and has the technical assistance of the engineers of the Tara association, that guarantees the success of his business.

loans.use: to buy organic manure for his tara (a thorny native shrub) crops.

loans.name: Chhunly

texts.en:
Chhunly is a 20-year-old single teacher who resides in the Banteay Meanchey province in Cambodia. He has been working as a teacher since 2014, earning approximately $4 per day. He is  pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in management, and is in his second year. 

He lacks the finances to pay for his second-year university fees and requests a loan to complete the second year at the university. 

In the future, he wants to save money to open his own business and build a new house.

loans.use: to pay his second-year university fees.

loans.name: Kongneou

texts.en:
Kongneou is 25 years old and single. He is a student from the Kampong Cham province in Cambodia. He is taking a finance and banking major at a university. In order to support his study, he has also worked at a children's center in the city. Being on staff, Kongneou can earn approximately $6 per day.

Kongneou is in the second year at the university, and since he is lacking finances to pay his second-semester tuition fees of the second year, he requested a loan, which will help him finish the second semester of the second year successfully. In the future, he plans on finding another better job with a reasonable salary.

loans.use: to pay his second-semester tuition fees

loans.name: Haseed

texts.en: Haseed, who is in his early 30s, is single with no children. He has been selling retail electronics for seven years. He works from 8 am to 5 pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit. This will be Haseed's third loan from Kiva's partner,Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase his product line and to buy his products from reputable companies to avoid buying fake brands. He has managed to pay back all his loans successfully. He appreciates Kiva lenders for their support. He will use this loan to buy up-to-date electronics items for his shop. He dreams of increasing his stock to international level. Haseed will make sure he pays back his loan according to the loan schedule.

loans.use: to buy up- to-date electronics items for his shop.

loans.name: Mary Jane

texts.en:
Mary Jane  has raised hogs for 2 years. She lives in Talibon, Bohol and is a 40-year-old married woman with five dependents. Her oldest child is 16 and the youngest is 5. She augments her income selling  banana cue, which  Is made with fried bananas coated in caramelized brown sugar. Her husband has an income to help defray the family's expenses. 

She  requests 4,000 PHP  to buy pig feed, bananas, and flour. Mary Jane could prepare more banana cue to be sold in her community. These will also improve the growth of her hogs.

She will be able to repay her obligations and expand her existing business.

She is hoping that her business will be successful for the welfare of her children.

loans.use: to buy pig feed and purchase supplies for food vending.

loans.name: Ahmad

texts.en:
Ahmad is a 23-year-old single man, who started his own cafe business in November 2014, to increase his income and develop his living.

He used to work in a supermarket and a mobile  shop, but his limited monthly salary, and the increasing living needs, forced him to stand up and plan for his future career.

He opened his small coffee and hot drinks business to increase his income and develop his living.  His business is going on just fine, but since it is a newly established business, it still needs a lot of development to reply to customers increasing needs.

Ahmad requests a YOUTH loan to buy  raw materials for his new  business. He will buy a refrigerator, coffee, sugar, cups, and spoons.

Ahmad hopes to buy his own coffee shop in the future.

loans.use: to buy necessary raw materials requested for his newly established business.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a bathroom so her family can enjoy better living conditions.

loans.name: Daniel

texts.en:
Daniel is a 25-year-old single man and a timber dealer at Kilifi Kenya. He supports three siblings.

Danile has been in the  construction business  for two years.

This marks his fourth loan from VisionFund Kenya and he has successfully repaid previous loans. 

He will use the requested loan to purchase  timber and will use the anticipated profits to pay his loan and educate his siblings. He hopes to own a big timber yard in the future.

loans.use: to purchase  timber.

loans.name: Angie

texts.en: Angie is 33 years old and married with one child, who is still in school. Angie works very hard to provide for her family. For three years, she has operated a general store in the Philippines. Angie has requested a 5000 PHP loan through Kiva's partner, Negros Women for Tomorrow Foundation, to purchase more groceries to sell in her shop such as canned goods, personal care products, coffee, noodles, milk, etc. She would like to save enough money to provide a secure future for her family.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell in her shop

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena is 68 years old and widowed with seven children.

Elena works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care product, noodles, soft drinks, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.

Elena has borrowed and repaid one loan from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 5 years and also earns an income from farming vegetables.

Elena aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy items to sell like canned goods, personal care products, noodles, soft drinks, milk, coffee, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Peninah

texts.en: Peninah is a married woman with two kids, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expense is food for the family. Peninah sells vegetables at a market stall to local residents. She faces a challenge of high cost of transportation to her place of operation. With the 20,000 KES, she wants to purchase green vegetables, two crates of tomatoes, and onions for resale. She decided to join Kiva's partner, Yehu, to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase vegetables for resale

loans.name: Pauline's Group

texts.en:
Pauline has 5 children and is  described as a very hardworking individual, which is why she was selected to become the group leader. Pauline represents a group of 11 farmers in Kakamega South District and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Pauline has been a farmer for 10 years and, in order to have access to the best seed prices, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. Her loan will not only include farming inputs but also a solar light.  The light will help her to  have an overall improved quality of life. With the profits from this coming season, Pauline is planning to repair her home.

A total of 6.75 acres will be planted by Pauline's Group who will receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds, fertilizer, and  a solar light.

loans.name: Soeu

texts.en:
Soeu is a 36-year-old woman with  two schoo-aged children living in Kampong Cham province. 

She  has grown cassava and pepper on two hectares for ages and earns 41,700 KHR per day. 

This is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid previous loans. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay labor costs. 

She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's living standards.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for labor costs.

loans.name: Zypranza's Group

texts.en:
Zypranza,leads a  group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2008 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has 3 children.

 Zypranza will purchase maize seeds, fertilizer, and a solar light.  Zypranza plans to use the profits to send her children to school.

Zypranza’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 6.25 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds, fertilizer, and a solar light.

loans.name: Soklim

texts.en:
Soklim, 34, lives with her family members in a rural village of Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of six children, five of whom are still in school and the other one is too young.

For her living, she grows cassava as the main source of income and works for others for a fee to supplement her income. This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor fees.

She hopes that she can get more yields than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for labor fees.

loans.name: Mujeres De La Trinidad Group

texts.es:
Maria es una señora de 45 años de edad, es casada tiene una hermosa familia de dos hijos de las edades entre diez y diecisiete años, esta humilde familia vive en una comunidad de Suchitepéquez.
Maria (es la señora que se encuentra en medio de la fotografía de blusa blanca) con el afán de mejorar sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa, se dedica a la compra y venta de abarrotes en el lugar de su domicilio, esta actividad lo realiza ella desde hace ocho años.
Maria gracias a la amabilidad con la que atiende a sus clientes, su pequeña tienda tiene mucha demanda, por lo que ahora cree que es necesario surtir mejor su tienda y así poder satisfacer las necesidades de la clientela, aunque una de sus dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder invertirlo, por tal motivo se ha unido a un grupo de personas para solicitar un crédito que le permitirá comprar sus productos como: azúcar, consomé, sal, frijol, y maíz.
El gran sueño de Maria es poder contar con este crédito para que su negocio prospere y que logre mejores ganancias.
texts.en:
Maria is 45 years old, married and has a beautiful family with two children aged between 10 and 17 years old. This humble family lives in a community of Suchitepéquez. Maria (is in the middle wearing a white blouse) with the aim of improving her income and supporting her husband with the household expenses works buying and selling groceries at her house. She has been doing this activity for 8 years.

Thanks to the friendliness with which Maria looks after her customers, her store is quite busy. So now it is necessary to stock her store more and this be able to satisfy the needs of her clients. One of her difficulties is that she does not have the sufficient capital to be able to make this investment.

So for this reason she has joined a group of people to request a loan which will allow her to buy products like sugar, consume, salt, beans and corn. Maria's great dream is to be able to count on this loan so that her business prospers and she can make more profit.

loans.use: to buy grocery products like sugar, consume, salt, beans and corn.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizers and seedlings

loans.name: Charles Alberto

texts.es:
Charles tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero, vive en casa familiar en una zona rural del distrito de Oyotún, una comunidad que se encuentra ubicada en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería en diferentes cultivos de su distrito, cuenta con herramientas propias, realiza esta actividad desde hace 5 años por lo que cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con clientes que brindan buenas referencias personales y laborales de el. Solicita préstamo para la compra de dos palanas (herramientas) y para brindar mantenimiento a sus herramientas actuales que se encuentran en mal estado, esto le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas y darle una mejor apariencia, para poder brindar mejores servicios lo que incrementará su nivel de ingresos y le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Charles is 24 years old, and single. He lives with his family in a rural zone in the district of Oyotún, a community located in the province of Chiclayo in the Lambayeque Region of Peru’s northern coast. The inhabitants of this district work in agriculture, commerce, and animal-raising.

He provides day labor service on different farms in his district, and he has his own tools.  He has been doing this work for five years, so he has experience in this business and customers who provide him with good personal and work references. 

He is requesting a loan to purchase two shovels (tools), and to maintain his current tools, which are in poor condition. This will help him to keep his tools in better condition and give him a better appearance, so that he can provide better services that will increase his income level and allow him to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to purchase two shovels (tools), and to maintain his current tools, which are in poor condition.

loans.name: Lizah

texts.en:
Lizah is a very hard-working, energetic young farmer with ten years of experience. She has good farming practices and puts  a lot of effort to take care of her family. She learned this from her parents.

She has been able to take care of her family and provide basic needs for her parents. Lizah lives near londiani in the Kericho area of Kenya, an area with good weather patterns and favorable weather conditions that support farming. Maize is a very common crop in Kenya and is a staple food for many who regularly eat “ugali,“ or hard porridge cooked from maize. One can usually buy sifted maize flour in the market, but its cost is higher because of the processing. Flour can be less expensive, however, if it is milled directly using a posho mill. The Londiani area has only one diesel posho mill that serves a great number of people. The main problem here is that the posho mill keeps breaking down so farmers cannot grind their maize. 

Lizah intends to change this by buying another posho mill to serve the area. She will buy an electric, rather than diesel, posho mill, as they are more reliable. Hopefully, breakdowns will be few and far between. To accomplish this, Lizah is applying for a 100,000 KES through Juhudi Kilimo to buy a mill. 

Profits derived from the mill will be used to  repay the loan. In the next two years, Lizah sees herself  running more than one posho mill.  Lizah, with her enterprising spirit and her vigor and tenacity, wants to continue struggling to complete her dream of owning her own posho mill. 

She patiently waits for your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a posho mill for processing maize flour.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for medicine and medical visits for his wife.

loans.name: Touch's Group

texts.en:
Touch, 54 years old, is a widowed mother of five children; one of them is dependent child that she needs to look after. She lives in a rural area located in the Kroch Chhma district of Kampong Chan province. The main source of her family’s income is from potato farming and, to better support her family, she also works for other farms as well. She can earn around 45,000KHR per day for her family’s needs.

Touch’s group consists of four members and this is the third micro loan for her with VisionFund Cambodia. Now she is leading the group of four to apply for this loan with a portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees.

She hopes that she could earn more income and be able to expand her current business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province; Kroch Chhma district

loans.name: Mwanahai

texts.en:
Mwanahai is a married mother of five children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are school fees and household consumables.

For over six years, Mwanahai has operated an open air food selling business, selling from home to her neighbors and passersby. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of business. 

With the KES 50,000 loan, she wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat. She decided to join Yehu Microfinance Trust to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour, tea leaves, and cooking fat.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy a solar energy system.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy and build an electric pump.

loans.name: Helene

texts.en:
Helene is 63 years old, married, and has five children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Helene operates a farm, raising sugar cane in the Philippines, which she has been doing for two years. 

Helene requested a loan from NWTF for 5,000 PHP, which she will use to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies. She would like to save enough to buy more farm land.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Las Manzaneras De Panimache Cuarto Group

texts.es:
Pascuala es una mujer de 44 años de edad, es casada tiene una linda familia de cuatro hijos de las edades entre 20 y 24 años, este humilde familia vive en una comunidad de  Chichicastenango.
Pascuala (es la tercera del lado izquierdo de la fotografía de traje color rosado pálido) con el afán de obtener sus ingresos y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de la casa se dedica a la compra y venta de blusas típicas de su región en la plaza de su comunidad, ella tiene  5 años de realizar esta actividad.
Pascuala ahora ha tenido la iniciativa de mejorar su negocio, ofreciéndole a la clientela una variedad de blusas típicas con precios bajos y de buena calidad, pero una de las dificultades que ella tiene es que no cuenta con el capital suficiente para poder realizar esta inversión, por tal motivo solicita un préstamo junto a un grupo de personas que lo invertirá comprando blusas típicas de tipo, seda, alemán, lustrina.
El gran sueño de Pascuala es ver  graduados a sus cuatro hijos y construir una casa más grande para ellos.
texts.en:
Pascuala is 44 years old, married, and has a beautiful family of four children who are between the ages of 20 and 24 years old. This humble family lives in the community of Chichicastenango. 

Pascuala (third from the left in the photo, wearing a light rose dress) buys and sells traditional blouses from her region so that she can earn some income and help her husband with the household expenses. She sells them in her community's town square and has been doing this for five years. Now Pascuala wants to improve her business, offering her customers a variety of traditional blouses at low prices and good quality. But one of her difficulties is that she does not have enough capital to invest in her business. So with a group of people, she is asking for a loan to buy traditional blouses made with silk and German embroidery floss. 

Pascuala's big dream is to see her four children graduate and to build a bigger house for them.

loans.use: to buy and sell traditional clothing.

loans.name: Jovita

texts.es:
La socia Jovita  pertenece al banco comunal SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE, la socia sigue dedicándose a la compra y venta de granos como trigo, maíz entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan, a la vez la socia sigue con su negocio de ferreteria, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de granos como maíz entre otros.
texts.en:
Jovita  is a member of the SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE communal bank. She continues buying and selling grains like wheat, corn, etc. and is grateful for the loan she has received. She promises to make her payments on time. 

She continues to sell her merchandise to her customers and she also still runs her hardware store business, and this is how she is able to raise her family. She is asking for a loan so she can buy grains such as corn and others.

loans.use: to buy grains such as corn and others.

loans.name: Nazario

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE, él socio sigue  dedicándose a brindar el servicio de transporte, el socio se siente agradecido por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, él socio también continua con su negocio de compra y venta de madera, siendo de esta manera que el socio saca  adelante a su familia.
El socio solicita el crédito para realizar el cambio de aceite.
texts.en:
The borrower is a member of the San Isidro de Compone community bank.  He continues to work offering a taxi service.  He is grateful for the loan he received and promises to make his payments on time.   He also continues with his business buying and selling wood, and feels that this helps his family to get ahead.

He is requesting this loan to get an oil change.

loans.use: to get an oil change.

loans.name: Bertha

texts.es:
La socia Bertha pertenece al banco comunal SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE,la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de frutas, la socia se siente agradecida con el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa a la vez la socia también se dedica a brindar el servicio de  transporte, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de manzanas, peras entre otros.
texts.en:
Bertha is a member of the San Isidro de Compone community bank.  She continues to work buying and selling fruit.  She is grateful for the loan provided and promises to make her repayments on time.  She is a responsible and enterprising person who also offers transportation services.  This is how she helps her family get ahead.

Bertha is requesting this loan to purchase apples, pears, and other items.

loans.use: to purchase apples, pears, and other items.

loans.name: Selene

texts.es:
La socia Selene pertenece al banco comunal SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE, la socia sigue  dedicándose al negocio de crianza de animales menores como cuyes, gallinas entre otros, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete  a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia continua criando estos animalitos para luego venderlos a sus clientes que le solicitan, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de cuyes entre otros.
texts.en:
Selene is a member of the San Isidro de Compone community bank.  She continues her business raising small animals including guinea pigs, chickens, and other animals.  She is grateful for the loan provided and promises to make her repayments on time.  She continues to raise these animals to later sell them to customers who order them.  This is how she supports her family.

Selene is requesting this loan to purchase guinea pigs and other animals.

loans.use: to purchase guinea pigs and other animals.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La socia Luz Marina pertenece al banco comunal SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE, la socia sigue dedicándose al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir los pagos de su cuota, la socia continua vendiendo su mercadería a sus clientes que le solicitan como arroz, azúcar ente otros, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de aceite entre otros.
texts.en:
The member Luz Marina belongs to the San Isidro de Compone community bank.  She continues dedicating herself to her business of a grocery store.  The member feels very thankful for the loan she received and commits herself to meet her installments.  The member continues selling her merchandise to her clients, who request rice, sugar and other goods, and this is how she helps her family move forward.  

The member requests a loan to buy oil and others.

loans.use: to buy oil and other things.

loans.name: Los Angeles De Quelloccocha Group

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal LOS ANGELES DE QUELLOCCOCHA,el banco está ubicado en la provincia de Calca, distrito de Lamay y departamento de Cusco.
La socia Cristina tiene 26 años de edad es soltera y tiene 01 hijo, la socia alterna sus actividades diarias dedicándose a la ganaderia, la socia lleva buen tiempo con su negocio el cual le va bien gracias al empeño que le pone cada día  a su negocio, la socia desea poder seguir trabajando para de esta forma seguir apoyando a su familia.
La socia solicito el crédito para la compra de una vaca.
Los demás socios se dedican a la crianza de animales, ganaderia, agricultura.
Los socios agradecen el préstamo otorgado y se comprometen a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas.
Al momento de tomar la foto hay dos socios (una mujer y un varon) que salen sus rostros tapados por sus compañeros, la razón es que los socios son tímidos pero se comprometieron tomarse la próxima foto correctamente.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the "LOS ANGELES DE QUELLOCCOCHA' which is located in the province of Calca, Lamay district, in the department of Cusco.

Cristina is 26 years old and is single with one child. She mixes her daily activities with her work of raising cattle. She has been in the business for a long time and things are going well thanks to the determination she brings to her work each day. She wants to continue with her work and in this way continue to support her family. She is requesting a loan to buy a cow.

The rest of the members work in raising animals, raising livestock and agriculture. They are grateful for the loan and promise to comply with the given payments. At the time of taking the photo two members (one male and one female) are being blocked out by their companions. The reason is that the members are timid but they have promised to take the next photo correctly.

loans.use: to buy a cow.

loans.name: Rosa María

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Andrés De Vera De Miraflores.
En este lugar vive la señora Rosa, tiene 42 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos, uno mayor y el menor de 13  años que estudian en universidad y colegio, ella también tiene una hija de crianza la misma que la tiene desde pequeñita y que actualmente tiene 8 años y estudia en escuela. Su esposo es ebanista,
Doña Rosa para ayudarle a su esposo realiza el crédito para que el invierta en su negocio, el tiene un pequeño taller de ebanistería, allí él le da forma a la madera y elabora todo tipo de muebles, camas, cajoneras, literas, juegos de comedor, puertas entre otros productos, realiza sus obras por pedidos de sus clientes que saben de la calidad de sus trabajos, el lleva más de 17 años con su taller y con eso el lucha para que nada les falte a su familia.
Este crédito es para comprar madera, pintura y otros materiales más para elaborar sus obras. Esta desde el inicio  en el Grupo De Crédito y le gusta porque con los créditos ella puede ayudarle a su marido. Sus sueños son darles lo mejor a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Andrés de Vera de Miraflores Credit Group meets every fifteen days in Andrés de Vera Parish in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as “The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees”.

Rosa lives here. She is 42 years old, and married, with two children from this relationship. One is older and studying in the university, and the younger one, age 13, is in high school.  She also has a foster daughter, whom she has had since she was very, very small, and who is now 8 years old and studying in school. Her husband is a furniture maker.

Rosa is taking out a loan in order to help her husband, so that he may invest it in his business. He has a small furniture making shop where he shapes the wood, and makes all kinds of furniture, such as beds, chests of drawers, bunk beds, dining sets, doors, and other products. He makes his furniture on order from his customers, who know the quality of his work. He has had his shop for 17 years, and this is how he fights so that his family may want for nothing.

This loan is for the purchase of wood, paint, and other materials for making his furniture. She has been in the credit group since the beginning, and she likes it because she can help her husband with the loans. Her dream is to give the best to her children.

loans.use: to purchase wood, paint and other materials.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sugar, beans, soft drinks, snacks, and juices for her daily goods store.

loans.name: Josefina

texts.en:
Josefina, 54, is a married woman with four children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur.

Josefina has a buy-and-sell fruit and vegetable business in the Philippines. She requested a 10000 PHP loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits and vegetables such as squash, bananas, eggplants, and beans to sell.

Josefina has been in this business for 20 years. She would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits and vegetables such as squash, bananas, eggplants, and beans to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to pay for labor for his cocoa farms and to restock his retail business.

loans.name: Racheal's Group

texts.en:
Racheal is 57 years old and has six children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Racheal is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by nine farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Racheal started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family. This year, she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Racheal’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 6.5 acres of land. Additionally, one of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of one solar light.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Mejumaa

texts.en:
Mejumaa is married and has two children, both of whom attend school. She owns a house that neither has electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has owned a food stall business, and her customers are neighbours and town dwellers. She faces the major challenge of transportation in her business.

With the 50,000 KES loan, she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the future.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Demetrio Candelario

texts.es:
El sr.
