Demetrio es casado tiene 67 años de edad y tiene 9 hijos de los cueles uno todavía va a la universidad, el préstamo ayudara al mejoramiento de su parcela y en el incremento de la canasta familiar;dentro de los sueños y esperanzas de Don Demetrio esta brindar una educación a su último hijo y la compra de 4 vacas lecheras
Don Demetrio tiene 30 años en el negocio de la tara y le gusta porque es una herramienta que le es de gran ayuda para mantener su familia.
texts.en:
Demetrio, 67, is married and has nine children, one of whom is still in college.  His dreams include paying for his last child's education and buying four dairy cows.

Demetrio has 30 years of experience in the tara business and he likes it because it's a tool that's a big help to him in supporting his family.  The loan will help him improve his plot of land and increase his production for the family breadbasket.

loans.use: to buy organic soil amendments for tara root

loans.name: Arcoiris De Colores Group

texts.es:
En el centro de la ciudad mejor conocida como “La Novia del Sol” (llamada así por las altas temperaturas que se experimentan) se aprecia el movimiento comercial de los habitantes, locales donde se ofrecen distintos tipos de productos, principalmente comida. Cerca de este lugar se consolidó el grupo llamado “Arcoiris de Colores”, cuyos integrantes buscan fortalecer cada una de sus actividades:

Reyna, Margarita,  Jorge – Venta de Comida
Liliana - Venta de Novedades Y Refrescos 
Jose - Venta de Productos Naturistas
Itzel – Venta de Calzado
Omar – Venta de Carne

Don José o “Pepe” como lo llaman sus conocidos, es un hombre activo que siempre busca superarse. Desde hace 2 años se unió a l equipo de distribución de una empresa de productos naturistas. Decidió tomar este camino ya que la empresa le ofrece grandes oportunidades de crecimiento conforme vaya cubriendo sus metas. Aunque la mayoría de las personas establece un club nutricional, él decidió vender de manera ambulante, lo que le ha permitido conocer mejor otras comunidades de su municipio.

Pepe utiliza sus ganancias para solventar los gastos del hogar, satisfacer sus gastos personales e invertir nuevamente en productos naturistas. El nuevo préstamo lo ocupará para comprar aloe, polvo para malteada, proteínas y cápsulas que son los productos que más consumen sus clientes. 

Mientras Pepe sigue trabajando, motivado por escalar en el esquema de ventas de la empresa y obtener su primer premio: un viaje a la playa. 

“Gracias por la confianza que depositan en nosotros con la oportunidad de obtener un préstamo para mejorar en nuestra actividad”.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Jorge, Don José es quien viste playera verde.
texts.en:
In the center of the city known as the “La Novia del Sol” (the sun's wife, due to the high temperatures it experiences) you can see the commercial activity of the people, stands that offer all types of products, mainly foods. Close to this spot the group called “Arcoiris de Colores” got together, the members looking to strengthen each of their businesses.

Liliana - The sale of novelties and soft drinks
Jose - The sale of Natural products
Itzel – Shoe sales
Omar – Selling meat

José o “Pepe” ,as his acquaintances call him, is an active man who is always looking to excel. For the past two years he has joined a distribution team of a company that sells natural products. He made this decision as the company offered great opportunities to expand depending on fulfilling your goals. Although the majority of people form a nutrition club, Pepe decide to sell itinerantly which has allowed him to get to know other communities in his municipality.

Pepe uses his profits to pay the household expenses, satisfy his personal needs and invest again in Naturalist products. He will use the new loan to buy aloe, malt powder, protein and capsules, which are the product most used by his customers. Meanwhile Pepe continues working motivated to ascend the sales ladder of the company and get his first prize of a trip to the beach. "Thanks for the confidence you have in us to allow us to have the opportunity to get a loan to improve our businesses".

The photograph was taken at Jorge's house. Jose is wearing the green shirt.

loans.use: to buy aloe, malt powder, proteins and capsules.

loans.name: Noche Buena Group

texts.es:
Los caminos de terracería, el canto de las aves y los árboles de mango son testigos del esfuerzo que realizan los campesinos en sus largas jornadas en una comunidad del estado de Veracruz. En esta comunidad se consolidó un grupo llamado “Noche Buena” con el firme propósito de solicitar un préstamo a VisionFund México e invertirlo para mejorar su actividades:

Elsa – Venta de Elotes, Esquites Y Chicharrones Preparados 
Marlen - Venta de Ropa, Zapatos
Irene,  Josefa - Venta de Cosméticos 
Karen - Venta de Ropa Y Bolsas 
Guadalupe - Venta de Comida Y Antojitos Y Postres 
Teresa - Venta de Abarrotes
Beatriz- Venta de Comida Y Servicio De Taxi
Sofía – Venta de Cosméticos Y Abarrotes
Manuel - Venta de Cosméticos Y Tejidos

Elsa tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de 2 niños, el mayor cursa 3° año de primaria y el más pequeño está a punto de ingresar al preescolar. Por las mañanas, Elsa se dedica a los quehaceres del hogar y prepara el lunch de su hijo. A mediodía, comienza su labor como vendedora: prepara los elotes, esquites, servilletas, mayonesa, limón, chile, palitos para elote,  vasos, cucharas, sal, la mesa, las vaporeras, es decir, todo lo necesario para la venta de elotes, esquites y chicharrones.

Elsa comenzó desde niña a ayudar a la señora de la casa donde vivía, ella era quien se dedicaba a vender todo tipo de antojitos. Recuerda cómo al principio se quemaba con frecuencia al intentar ensartar los palos en las mazorcas de elote o con el vapor de los esquites. Con el paso del tiempo Elsa adquirió experiencia y aprendió a ser más hábil, tener todo listo y atender rápidamente a los clientes. Años después, Elsa heredó el negocio de la señora quien la veía como su propia hija y como la única que podía dar continuidad a la actividad que había comenzado. 

Por esa motivación y por sus hijos, Elsa hace su mejor esfuerzo todos los días en su negocio. Las personas disfrutan de sus antojitos desde las 5pm que es cuando el pequeño puesto está listo y aproximadamente a las 9pm, cuando Elsa termina de vender toda la comida del día, está lista para regresar a casa. Además, Elsa también vende hielo blanco, hielitos de sabores, chamoyadas y naranjas congeladas aprovechando la época de calor que le ayuda a tener buenas ventas. 

Cada uno de los préstamos que Elsa ha recibido le ha ayudado mejorar sus ganancias con las que paga sus gastos y la escuela de su pequeño.  Esta vez invertirá su préstamo en mayonesa, servilletas, vasos, queso, palos para elote, cucharas y elotes y una pequeña parte en la compra de ropa interior para dama ya que quiere iniciar esta nueva actividad y seguir creciendo junto con sus ganancias.

El grupo está agradecido con cada una de las personas que hace posible la oportunidad de recibir otro préstamo.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Beatriz que es donde se realizan las reuniones de cobranza, Elsa es quien viste blusa color azul cielo y pantalón de mezclilla azul.
texts.en:
The dirt roads, singing birds and mango trees are witness to the efforts made by farmers in their long work days in a community in the state of Veracruz. In this community a group called "Noche Buena" was formed with the firm intention of requesting a loan from VisionFund Mexico to invest it to improve their businesses:

Elsa – Sells corn, esquites (appetizer made of corn),and pork rinds
Marlen – Sells clothes and shoes
Irene, Josefa – Sell cosmetics
Karen – Sells clothes and bags
Guadalupe – Sells food, appetizers, and desserts
Teresa Sale – Sells groceries
Beatrice – Sells food and has a taxi service
Sofia – Sells cosmetics and groceries
Manuel – Sells cosmetics and textiles

Elsa is 28 years old and is the mother of two children; the eldest is in 3rd grade and the youngest is about to enter kindergarten. In the morning, Elsa is does housework and prepares lunch for her child. At noon, she begins her work as a saleswoman: preparing the corn, esquites, napkins, mayonnaise, lemon, chile, sticks for the corn, cups, spoons, salt, the table, and steam cooker, which is everything needed for the sale of corn, esquites, and pork rinds.

Since she was a child, Elsa helped the lady of the house where she lived, who sold all kinds of snacks. She remembers how at first she often burned her self trying to skewer sticks into the ears of corn, or from the steam from the esquites. With time Elsa gained experience and gained more skill, have everything ready and quickly serving her customers. Years later, Elsa inherited the business from the lady, who saw her as her own daughter and as the only person who could take over her business.

For this reason, and for her children, Elsa does her best every day in her business. People enjoy her snacks from 5pm, which is when the little stand is ready, to about 9pm, when Elsa finishes selling all her food for the day and is ready to go home. Moreover, Elsa also sells ice, flavored ice cubes, frozen oranges, and slushies, taking advantage of the hot season that helps her have good sales.

Each of the loans that Elsa has received has helped improve her profits, which she uses to pay for her costs and for the school fees for her little one. This time she will invest her loan in mayonnaise, napkins, cups, cheese, sticks for corn, spoons, and corn on the cob, and a small portion in buying women’s lingerie, as she wants to start this new business and continue to grow her income.

The group is grateful to each of the people who made it possible to receive another loan.

* The photograph was taken at Beatriz's home, which is where meetings are held. Elsa is wearing a sky blue colored blouse and blue jeans.

loans.use: to buy mayonnaise, napkins, cups, cheese, sticks for corn, spoons, and corn on the cob, and women’s lingerie, to start a new business.

loans.name: Annet

texts.en: Annet is 26 years old, married and the mother of three children who lives in Kasese, Uganda. She earns a living by selling shoes and also owns a beauty salon where she earns additional income. She began her businesses to help care for her family and herself. Annet has great hopes of growing her business and becoming rich. Her main challenges are a shortage of capital and competition. She intends to use her loan to buy shoes to sell.

loans.use: to buy shoes to sell.

loans.name: Verónica Candelaria

texts.es:
En la parroquia Andrés De Vera de la ciudad de  Portoviejo, capital de Manabí conocida desde hace muchos años  como la ciudad de los reales tamarindos, se reúnen  cada quince días las socias del Grupo De Crédito Andrés De Vera De Miraflores.
En este lugar vive la señora Verónica, tiene 30 años de edad, está casada y de esta relación tienen dos hijos de 12 y 11  años que estudian en colegio y escuela. Su esposo es maestro soldador. Ella hace varios años aprendió corte y confección en una academia de la localidad. 
Doña Verónica con la finalidad de obtener sus propios ingresos y aprovechando sus conocimientos en corte y confección puso en su casa un pequeño taller de costura, ahí ella se dedica a confeccionar todo tipo de ropa para damas, caballeros y niños, trabaja a base de pedidos de personas particulares, este taller tiene por más de 10 años el cual le da muy buenas satisfacciones, ella también le da parte de sus crédito a su marido para que él lo utilice en materiales que necesita en su taller de soldadura que tiene en su casa. De esta forma ellos logran ganar el sustento diario para ellos y su familia.
Este nuevo crédito lo va utilizar en comprar telas y sueldas para el taller de su marido. Lleva dos años en el Grupo De Crédito y  le gusta de la Fundación por la ayuda que le dan con los créditos y el interés es bajo. Su sueño es tener un taller  más grande.
texts.en:
The Andrés de Vera de Miraflores Credit Group meets every fifteen days in Andrés de Vera Parish in the city of Portoviejo, the capital of Manabí, which has been known for many years as “The City of the Royal Tamarind Trees”.

Verónica lives here. She is 30 years old and married, and from this relationship she has two children, ages twelve and eleven, who are studying in high school and grade school. Her husband is a teacher and a welder. She learned dressmaking several years ago, in an academy in town.

Verónica set up a small dressmaking shop in their house in order to obtain her own income and make use of her dressmaking skills. There, she makes all kinds of clothing for ladies, gentlemen, and children.  She works on the basis of orders from individual persons.  She has had this shop for more than ten years, and it provides her with many satisfactions. 

She is also giving part of her loan to her husband, so that he may use it for materials he needs in his welding workshop that he has at their house. In this way, they manage to earn a daily living for themselves and their family. She is going to use this new loan to purchase fabric, and metal solder for her husband’s workshop.

She has been in the credit group for two years, and she likes it because of the help that they give her with the loans, and because the interest rate is low. Her dream is to have a larger shop.

loans.use: to purchase fabric and metal solder.

loans.name: Elizabeth's Group

texts.en: Elizabeth is 53 years old, has eight children and leads a group of ten farmers in Kenya's Kakamega South District. She has been farming with the One Acre Fund since 2009. She joined largely a result of her desire to have access to the best seed prices and produce an even better harvest than the one she grew last year, which she believes she can do by continuing to work with the fund. Elizabeth also decided to buy a solar light with her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to have light during dark hours so her children can study. This loan will allow Elizabeth's group to receive a total of seven solar lights and supplies to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Edelyn

texts.en: Edelyn earns a living by fishing with her husband. She is 36 years old and the mother of five children who range in age from 17 to 8. She has been fishing for more than 10 years and is requesting this loan to buy new supplies such as a net. This will help her increase her catch and have more fish to sell in the local market, which will allow her to provide her children with more nutritious meals. In short, these supplies will allow her to expand her business and increase her income. Edelyn hopes to continue to send her children to school so they can have a bright future and also successfully manage her business.

loans.use: to buy fishing supplies.

loans.name: Angellou

texts.en:
Angellou is 24 years old, married, and has one child who is in school.  

Angellou is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

Angellou has been farming vegetables for five years now, and has borrowed six times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, she would like to save enough money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seedlings for her farm.

loans.name: Lea

texts.en:
As a married parent of two children, Lea works hard to support her family.

She has a direct selling business in the Philippines, and also earns additional income from raising pigs and farming rice.  Lea is borrowing PHP 20,000 through NWTF to  purchase more product to sell such as body lotion, perfume, make up, beauty soap and other personal care products.

Lea has been sustaining her business activities through her past four loans from NWTF. She hopes that her hard work will help her attain her dream to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to purchase more product to sell such as body lotion, perfume, make up, beauty soap and other personal care product

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies for her beauty salon.

loans.name: Birkhamba Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Chandri lives with her husband and three children in Koraput district, Odisha. Chandri is a housewife, whereas her husband is a barber who runs a salon. The roof of the salon is made of straw, which needs to be changed. When there are strong winds or heavy rains, the roof falls, and Chandri's husband has to spend two days fixing the roof. This means he loses two days of business.

Hence, to do away with all this, Chandri's husband wants to replace the shed roof with corrugated iron sheet, but they do not have enough money for the same. Hence, Chandri, along with Subasini, is asking for a loan of 36,000 INR. Chandri will use her portion to build a strong roof made of iron for her husband’s salon business.

loans.use: to build a strong roof made of iron for her husband's salon business.

loans.name: Edith's Group

texts.en:
Edith is 46 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by eight farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Edith has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Edith also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Edith's Group will be able to receive a total of 2 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Birkhamba Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Tuni, standing on the left in the photo, is a 33-year-old farmer from a small village in Koraput district, Odisha. Tuni often engages all her family members in cultivation work. Her husband is a farmer. The income she earned from farming was quite sufficient for her family until the soil started losing its fertility. Their household monthly income is 7,000 INR, which is barely enough to support her family.

In order to improve their financial situation, Tuni formed a group with Durga to seek an enterprise loan of 36,000 INR from Peoples Forum to help them start or expand their vegetable selling business and goat rearing. With the Kiva loan, Tuni wants to supplement her income by rearing goats.

Both the group members are happy to receive the loan and thank Kiva and Peoples Forum for the support.

loans.use: to buy goat kids for rearing and selling.

loans.name: Mujeres Triunfadoras Group

texts.es: Leocadia es socia del grupo “Mujeres Triunfadoras” constituida por 06 personas activas y responsables. Leocadia de 53 años es casada. Hace 25 años que Leocadia se dedica a la venta de golosinas. Este negocio le ha permitido a  Leocadia apoyar a sus hijos, pues ha tenido que esforzarse para salir adelante. Su mayor deseo es de terminar de construir su casa. Con el fin de seguir mejorando solicitó el crédito pues comprará chicles, caramelos, galletas y chupetines.  El grupo “Mujeres Triunfadoras” agradecen a las personas que hicieron posible éste crédito, pues le  permite su desarrollo. Leocadia es la primera del lado izquierdo viste blusa azul y tiene un velo blanco en la cabeza.
texts.en:
Leocadia is a member of the group “Mujeres Triunfadoras” which consists of 6 active and responsible people. Leocadia is 53 and married. It's been 25 years since Leocadia began making a living from selling sweets. This business has allowed Leocadia to support her children but she has had to struggle to get by. Her biggest wish is to finish building her house. With the goal of continuing to improve, she applied for a loan to buy gum, candy, cookies and lollipops. 

The group “Mujeres Triunfadoras” are grateful to the people who made this loan possible as it allows their development. Leocadia is the first on the left wearing a blue blouse and a white headscarf.

loans.use: to buy gum, candy, cookies and lollipops.

loans.name: La Guadalupe Group

texts.es:
En una región productora de caña se consolidó el grupo llamado “La Guadalupe” que debe su nombre a la devoción y fe que los integrantes tienen a la virgen de Guadalupe. Ellos dedican su tiempo a una actividad económica para brindar mejores oportunidades a su familia:

Irma – Venta de Comida 
Maricela - Venta de Ropa 
Diana, Luis - Venta de Ropa y Calzado por Catálogo
Leticia - Venta de Pollo 
Mercedes – Venta de Calzado

Leticia es una señora joven, está casada con Gilberto y es madre de una niña de 1 año de edad. Ella sólo tuvo la oportunidad de estudiar hasta el segundo año de secundaria.

Hace 2 años “Lety”, como todos le llaman, decidió iniciar con la venta de carne de pollo de lunes a sábado de 7:00 am a 1:00 pm, con las ganancias obtenidas apoya a su esposo con los gastos y construcción de la casa que será el patrimonio de su pequeña.

El préstamo anterior le fue muy útil ya que lo invirtió en la compra de pollo en pie, bolsas plásticas, una bandeja para el pollo y una cubeta de lámina para poner el agua a hervir  necesaria para limpiar los pollos. Ahora necesita un nuevo préstamo para comprar 30 pollos más, alimento para los mismos y una báscula nueva. 

“Me gustaría vender pollos asados a la leña los fines de semana” explica Lety al hablar de sus planes a futuro quien notó que para comprar este platillo, las personas de su comunidad tienen que caminar casi media hora hasta el local más cercano. 

“Siempre se hace todo cuanto se puede por el bienestar de las personas a quien uno quiere” y con esa intención, todos los días Lety se levanta a las 5 am para tener todo listo y comenzar a vender a las 7 am. 

El agradecimiento por los préstamos otorgados se manifiesta en la estabilidad de las actividades de los clientes y en sus pagos responsables.

*La fotografía fue tomada en casa de Felipe, Lety es quien viste blusa blanca y tiene en brazos a su pequeña.
texts.en:
In a sugar cane stalk-producing region, the group named “La Guadalupe” was established, named after the devotion and faith that the members have for the Virgin of Guadalupe.  They each dedicate their time to a commercial activity in order to provide their families with better opportunities.

Irma – food sales
Maricela – clothing sales
Diana, Luis – clothing and footwear catalog sales 
Leticia – chicken sales
Mercedes – footwear sales

Leticia is a young woman, married to Gilberto and is the mother of a one-year-old daughter.  She only had the opportunity to study until her second year of junior high school.  Two years ago, “Lety,” as everyone calls her, decided to start selling chicken meat from Monday to Saturday from 7:00 am to 1:00 pm.  With her profits, she helps her husband with expenses and with building the house that will be her daughter’s inheritance.  The previous loan was very useful, since she invested it in the purchase of live chickens, plastic bags, an oven tray for the chicken and a metal pot to boil the water needed to clean the chickens.  Now, she needs a new loan to purchase 30 more chickens, chicken feed and a new scale.

“I would like to sell fire-roasted chicken on the weekends,” explains Lety when talking about her future plans, who noted that in order to buy this dish, people from her community have to walk almost half an hour to the closest place.  “You do everything that you can for the well-being of the people you love,” and with this intention, Lety wakes up every day at 5 am to have everything ready and to start selling at 7 am.  

The appreciation for the loans granted is shown in the stability of the clients’ professions and in their responsible payments.  

*This picture was taken at Felipe’s house.  Lety is the one wearing the white shirt and holding her daughter.

loans.use: to purchase 30 chickens, chicken feed and a scale

loans.name: Berlinda

texts.en:
Berlinda took out and repaid a prior 15,000 PHP loan which she used to buy various items and products to sell in her store. Through her earnings she is able to send her children to school and meet their daily living expenses. She would now like to apply for a 20,000 PHP loan to buy more groceries such as rice, coffee, soda, instant noodles, and frozen foods to sell. She knows that more items in her store will generate more sales and thus increase her earnings. Berlinda dreams of having a bigger store in the future and aims to give her children the best possible education so they can have a better future. Every week, she meets up with her co-fellowship* members to share stories of her work and to draw strength and inspiration from her religion.

 *All Center for Community Transformation (CCT) community partners/clients are organized into groups that meet weekly. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners who gather each week to study religion, build social capital and repay microfinance loans.

loans.use: to buy groceries, toiletries and beverages for her business.

loans.name: Fatuma

texts.en:
Fatuma is a married woman with three children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water.

She has operated a retail shop business for the past two years, selling household consumables like wheat flour, maize flour and sugar. She faces a major challenge of creditors taking too long to pay for goods taken on credit. 

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of sugar, rice, maize flour and wheat flour

loans.name: El Charquito Group

texts.es:
El Charquito es un grupo conformado por mujeres mazahuas habitantes de una comunidad que se caracteriza por sus amplios campos de maíz, cultivo principal de la región. 
Carmen es una mujer muy amable, mientras platicaba su vida sonreía en todo momento. Desde hace 15 años mantiene una relación estrecha con VisionFund, “Cuando me ofrecieron el préstamo para mí fue una gran oportunidad, ahora estoy muy agradecida por todo el apoyo”. En aquél tiempo sus tres niños eran muy pequeños y no quería salir a trabajar para no descuidarlos pero también sabía que tenía que apoyar a su esposo ya que entre los dos sería más fácil cubrir los gastos de la familia. 
Entonces Carmen utilizó su crédito para comprar un buey, lo cuidó durante algunos meses y al venderlo obtuvo buenas ganancias lo que la animó a continuar con la actividad. Por el momento no tiene ningún animal y necesita invertir un becerro. Para alimentar a sus animales, aprovecha la pastura del campo y en tiempo de sequías también compra zacate, pastura y maíz.
A corto plazo, Carmen planea mejorar el lugar donde conserva a los bueyes, por el momento sólo está techado pero quiere construir las paredes del corral. También le gustaría comprar una camioneta para transportar a los animales y sabe que para lograrlo necesita comenzar a ahorrar.

Las demás integrantes del grupo son Gabriela quien invertirá en tienda de abarrotes; Placida, Natalia, Gregoria y Araceli, en borregos; Maribel, en pollos y Lizbeth, en zapatos.

*En la imagen aparecen las integrantes del grupo, doña Carmen es quien viste un suéter rojo*
texts.en:
El Charquito is a group made up of women of Mazahua ethnic origin who live in a community characterized by its extensive corn fields, the main crop of the region.

Carmen is a very friendly woman.  While talking about her life, she always smiled.  For 15 years, she has maintained a close relationship with VisionFund.  “When they offered me the loan, it was a great opportunity for me.  I am now very grateful for all of the support.”  At that time, her three children were very little and she did not want to go out to work because they would be neglected, but she also knew that she had to support her spouse, since between the two, it would be easier to cover the family’s expenses.

Carmen then used her loan to purchase a bull, cared for it for a few months and obtained a good profit when she sold it, which encouraged her to continue with this profession.  For the time being, she does not have any animals and needs to invest in a young bull.  To feed her animals, she makes use of the pastures and in times of drought, she also purchases fodder, grass and corn.

In the short term, Carmen plans to improve the place where she keeps the bulls.  Currently, the roof is constructed but she wants to build the walls of the corral.  She also would like to purchase a truck to transport the animals and knows that in order to achieve this, she needs to start saving.

The other members of the group are Gabriela, who will invest in a grocery store; Placida, Natalia, Gregoria and Araceli, in lambs; Maribel, in chickens; and Lizbeth, in shoes.  The group members are pictured in the image.  Carmen is wearing a red sweater.

loans.use: to purchase a young bull

location.town: San Felipe del Progreso, Estado de México

loans.name: Las Fresas De Yondese Group

texts.es:
“Las Fresas de Yondese” se conformó en una comunidad de origen mazahua, los habitantes están orgullosos de sus raíces y de vez en cuando, aún se escuchan algunas conversaciones en su lengua materna. Las actividades más importantes del lugar son el cultivo de maíz y la ganadería. Una peculiaridad de la región es que la mayoría de las casas aún están construidas con madera lo que otorga una vista agradable. 
Guadalupe es una de las integrantes del grupo, tiene 48 años y está casada con Aurelio quien se dedica a trabajar el campo. Ellos formaron una familia de tres hijos, hoy en día mayores de edad. 
Desde hace 20 años Guadalupe comenzó a hacerse cargo de la tienda de abarrotes que pertenecía a su madre. Desde pequeña ella le ayudaba a su madre a atender el negocio. Mucho tiempo después, la señora enfermó y nadie en la familia invertía en la pequeña tienda hasta que Guadalupe decidió retomarla. 
Esta es la primera vez que solicita un préstamo, pero por la experiencia de su esposo quien ha invertido en su propia actividad, decidió que un crédito sería de gran ayuda para comprar verduras, productos enlatados y refrescos que es la mercancía que más compran sus clientes. 
Además, Guadalupe tiene una actividad extra que ayuda a mantener su comunidad más limpia: se dedica a recolectar las botellas de plástico y cada mes las vende a un cliente que llega directo hasta su casa. En ese periodo, Guadalupe junta alrededor de 10 costales llenos de botellas por los que recibe a cambio cerca de $1,000 pesos. 
La meta de Guadalupe es volver a criar cerdos y borregos como lo hacía hace años, para lo cual necesita trabajar con empeño y comenzar a ahorrar. 
Las demás integrantes del grupo son María Cristina y Adriana quienes invertirán en pollos y Cesaria, en accesorios para el cabello y joyería de fantasía. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en las escaleras del kiosco del municipio donde viven las integrantes.
texts.en:
“Las Fresas de Yondese” formed in a community of Mazahua origin. The residents are proud of their roots and occasionally some conversations can even be heard in their mother tongue. The most important activities in this location are the cultivation of maize and livestock. A peculiarity of the region is that most of the houses are still constructed of wood which gives a nice view.

Guadalupe is one of the members of the group. She is 48 years old and is married to Aurelio who makes a living in farming. They form a family of 3 children, who are now older.

Twenty years ago Guadalupe began to take over the grocery store that belonged to her mother. Since she was young she was helping her mother to attend to the business. Much later, her mother got sick and no one in the family invested in the small shop until Guadalupe decided to take it up.

This is the first time that she has requested for a loan, but for the experience of her husband who has invested in his own activities, she decided that a loan would be a great help to buy vegetables, canned goods and soft drinks as those are the commodities that most customers buy. Moreover, Guadalupe has an extra activity that helps her to maintain a cleaner community: she works to collect plastic bottles and every month she sells them to a customer who takes them straight to her home. In this period, Guadalupe collected around 10 bags full of bottles for which she received a return of about $1,000 pesos.

The goal of Guadalupe is to return to raising pigs and sheep as they did years ago, for which she needs to work hard and start saving. The other group members are María Cristina and Adriana who will invest in chickens, and Cesaria in hair accessories and costume jewelry.

*The photograph was taken on the steps of the town kiosk where members live.

loans.use: to buy vegetables, canned foods and refreshments.

location.town: YONDESE DEL CEDRO, SAN JOSE DEL RINCON

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to increase her stock of candies

loans.name: Birkhamba Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Forty-five-year-old Purnabasi is a mother of two children and is from a small village of Koraput district of Odisha. She lives with her husband and children in a small house. Their children are studying in class 11th and class 12th respectively. Her husband is a farmer by occupation. He cultivates different vegetables on his farmland during different seasons and sells them in the market. Purnabasi also assists her husband in fieldwork after managing her household work.

Now, they have decided to cultivate paddy on their farmland; this is an all-season crop. Being the staple food of Odisha, it is in demand throughout the year. So, they think it will be a profitable business that will generate good income.

Thus, Purnabasi, along with Sukaldei, is requesting a loan of 36,000 INR. Purnabasi will use her portion to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc. to grow paddy.

She has a lot of faith and hope of getting ahead with this business because her household expenses depend on this business. With her profits, she plans to purchase more land in the future and to provide good education to her children.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies such as seeds, fertilizers, manure, etc.

loans.name: Violande

texts.fr: Violande a 40 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 3 enfants. Elle est propriétaire d’une petite épicerie où elle vend un peu de tout( produits alimentaires, produits cosmétiques, ustensiles de cuisines, etc.). Elle souhaiter augmenter les revenus de son activité. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour ajouter un stock de savons de toilette et des déodorants à son entreprise.
texts.en: Violande is 40 years old. She is married and mother of 3 children. She is the owner of a little grocery shop where she sells a little bit of everything (food products, cosmetics, kitchenware etc.) She hopes to increase her business income. She needs a microloan for her business to increase her stock of soap and deodorant.

loans.use: to buy soap and deodorants

loans.name: Marie Jolene

texts.fr: Marie Jolene a 51 ans. Elle est mariée et a 6 enfants. Elle fait la revente de produits alimentaires. Cette activité lui procure des revenus suffisants pour faire vivre sa famille et faire un peu d’épargne. Elle a recours au microcrédit pour développer son commerce et en tirer plus de bénéfices. Elle cherche un prêt pour acheter un stock de spaghetti.
texts.en: Marie Jolene is 51 years old. She is married and has 6 children. She resells food products. This activity allows her to have enough income to meet the needs of her family and save a little. She uses microloans to develop her business and increase her income. She is seeking a loan to increase her stock of spaghettis.

loans.use: to buy more spaghettis

loans.name: Liberty

texts.en:
Liberty is a hardworking entrepreneur who has a business farming crops in the Philippines.

She is borrowing PHP 4,000 through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies for her business farming crops.

Liberty has been in this business for four years. She earns more income from farming vegetables.

Liberty has been sustaining her business activities through her own efforts with the help of the loans from NWTF. She dreams of saving enough money so she could afford to send her children to college in the future.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies

loans.name: Lalen

texts.en:
Lalen works hard to support her family. She is married and has a buy-and-sell fruits business in the Philippines.

Lalen requested a PHP 8,000 loan through NWTF to purchase more fruits to sell such as watermelons, bananas, mangoes, apples, etc.

Lalen has been in this business for three years now, and also earns additional income from E-Loading.

She would like to save enough money so she could send her children to school.

loans.use: to purchase more fruits to sell  such as watermelons, bananas, mangoes, apples, etc.

loans.name: Edone

texts.fr: Edone, 56 ans, est marié et père de deux enfants. Entrepreneur assidu et très dynamique, il tient une petite boutique de revente de tissus en gros et aux détails. Cette activité lui permet de prendre soin de sa famille et de faire un peu d’épargne. Il a besoin d’un prêt pour augmenter son stock de tissus scolaires.
texts.en: Edone is 56 years old, married and father of two children. He is a very dynamic and hard-working entrepreneur. He has a little store where he wholesales and sells at retail fabrics. This activity allows him to take care of his family and to save a little. He needs a loan to increase his stock of fabrics for school uniforms.

loans.use: to increase his stock of fabrics for school uniforms

loans.name: Gasnor

texts.fr: Gasnor est âgée de 39 ans. Il est divorcé et a un enfant qu’il élève seul. Pour répondre aux besoins quotidiens de la maison et pour assurer la scolarisation de son enfant, il vend des chaussures d’occasion. Il a besoin d’un microcrédit pour acheter un stock plus important de chaussures.
texts.en: Gasnor is 39 years old. He is divorced and has one child that he raises alone. He sells second-hand shoes to meet the needs of his household and to ensure his child can go to school. He needs a microloan to increase his stock of shoes.

loans.use: to increase his stock of shoes

loans.name: Proyecto Productivo El Mirador Group

texts.es:
La historia de “Proyecto Productivo el Mirador” es un ejemplo de que el éxito no sólo es cuestión de coincidencias, sino la unión de motivación y trabajo para convertirlas en excelentes oportunidades.
Tiempo atrás, Esteban ya había solicitado crédito a VisionFund México, ahora regresa conformando un grupo de préstamo con sus socias, ya que es la manera en que podrán invertir mayor capital en su proyecto. 
Esteban comenzó a criar truchas casi por una coincidencia. Un día, algunos conocidos lo invitaron a comer truchas a otra comunidad y quedó encantado con la preparación del pescado. “Es un alimento de primer nivel” describe Esteban quien mientras cuenta su historia se nota claramente cómo lo invade la emoción contagiando a quienes lo escuchan. De aquél criadero de truchas/restaurante no sólo salió con un buen sabor de boca sino con 17 kilos de pescado y un trato para convertirse en distribuidor, activad que desempeñó durante tres años. 
Después, Esteban pensó que era tiempo de seguir avanzando y construyó 2 estanques en su casa para comenzar a criar truchas él mismo. Esteban no tenía conocimiento alguno, pero contó con todo el apoyo de sus proveedores.
Ahora, Esteban ya tiene más de 10 años de experiencia y 9 estanques en casa, pero lo más importante es que tiene un proyecto aún más grande: su meta es tener un restaurante, tener personas que le ayuden a preparar el pescado y causar en otros el miso efecto que él mismo experimentó hace años al probar la trucha. 
Aunque ha contado con el apoyo de otras instituciones de gobierno a lo largo de los años, para llevar a cabo su proyecto necesita invertir en material de construcción para levantar tanques que le ayudarán a captar el agua de lluvia y hacer frente a su reto de falta del líquido vital.
Esteban está muy motivado por alcanzar su meta y trabaja para alcanzarla, sabe que sus ganancias pueden aumentar significativamente lo que beneficiará de gran manera a su familia.
En el grupo también se encuentran Ismael y Josué quienes se dedican a criar borregos y bueyes respectivamente, así como las socias de Esteban, Sara, Antonia y Norma, quienes invertirán en el mismo proyecto de las truchas.

*La fotografía fue tomada en la fuente que se encuentre en el centro del parque del municipio, don Esteban viste una chamarra color café.
texts.en:
The story of “Proyecto Productivo el Mirador” is an example of how success is not just a matter of coincidences, but the joining together of motivation and work to turn them into excellent opportunities.  

Awhile ago, Esteban had requested a loan from VisionFund Mexico.  Now, he is returning as a member of a credit group along with its other members, since this is how they will be able to invest the greatest amount of capital in their project.

Esteban started raising trout almost by coincidence.  One day, some people he knew invited him to eat trout in another community and he became interested in the preparation of the fish.  “It is a first-rate food,” says Esteban, and it is clear that his excitement is contagious for those who listen as he tells his story.  He left that trout farmer and restaurant owner with no just a good taste in his mouth, but with 17 kilos (37 pounds) of fish and an agreement to become a distributor, an profession that he practiced for three years.

Later, Esteban thought that it was time to continue advancing and he built two pools at his house to start raising trout himself.  Esteban did not have any knowledge, but he could rely on all the support of his suppliers.  Now, Esteban has over ten years of experience and nine pools at his house, but the most important thing is that he has an even bigger project: his goal is to have a restaurant, to have people who help him to prepare the fish, and to cause in others the same effect that he experienced years when he tried the trout.

Though he has relied on the support of other government institutions over the years, in order to carry through with his project he needs to invest in construction materials to build reservoirs that will help him to collect the rainwater and to address his challenge of lacking this vital liquid.  Esteban is very motivated to reach his goal and works to achieve it.  He knows that his earnings could increase significantly, which would benefit his family greatly.

Also members of this group are Ismael and Josué, who make a living raising sheep and bulls respectively, as well as the members Sara, Antonia and Norma, who will invest in the same trout project.

*The photograph was taken at the fountain located in the center of the municipality’s park.  Esteban is wearing a brown jacket.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials, such as cement, lime, sand, gravel, etc.

location.town: San Felipe del Progreso, Estado de México

loans.name: Naomie

texts.fr: Naomie, mère de 3 enfants, est âgée de 44 ans. Elle habite à Port-au-Prince et  vit en union libre.  Son activité consiste à revendre des meubles d’occasion importés des USA ou de la république dominicaine. Elle s’approvisionne au centre-ville de Port-au-Prince mais vend ses marchandises chez elle. Elle cherche un microcrédit pour faire l’acquisition d’un nouvel arrivage de lits d’occasions chez son fournisseur.
texts.en: Naomie is 44 years old and mother of 3 children. She lives in Port-au-Prince with her partner. Her business consists in reselling second-hand furniture imported from the US or the Dominican Republic. She gets her supplies in downtown Port-au-Prince but sells her products from her home. She is seeking a microloan to buy a new arrival of second-hand beds from her supplier.

loans.use: to buy second-hand beds

loans.name: Mwanakombo

texts.en:
Mwanakombo is a married woman and has four children, all of whom attend school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past six years, she has owned a food stall business for neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation. With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour and cooking fat oil.

loans.name: Roseline

texts.fr: Roseline, 31 ans, habite à Port-au-Prince. Elle vit en union libre et mère de deux enfants qui sont régulièrement scolarisés. Pour subvenir aux besoins de sa famille, Roseline a ouvert une petite épicerie chez elle. Elle y vend des produits alimentaires et des produits cosmétiques. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour augmenter son stock d’huile de cuisine et son stock d’ingrédients culinaires.
texts.en: Roseline is 31 years old and lives in Port-au-Prince. She lives with her partner and is mother of two children who attend school regularly. To meet the needs of her family, Roseline has opened a little grocery store in her home. She sells food products and cosmetics. She needs a microloan to increase her stock of cooking oil and culinary ingredients.

loans.use: to increase her stock of cooking oil and culinary ingredients

loans.name: Marie Rose

texts.fr: Marie Rose est âgée de 43 ans. Elle est divorcée et élève seule ses deux enfants qui sont tous bien scolarisés. L’activité de Marie Rose est une petite pharmacie fonctionnant légalement dans la zone. Elle a besoin d’un microcrédit pour acheter de nouveaux médicaments pour attirer plus de clients.
texts.en: Marie Rose is 43 years old. She is divorced and raises alone her two children who go to school. Marie Rose has a little pharmacy working legally in her area. She needs a microloan to buy new medicines to attract more customers.

loans.use: to buy new medicines

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es:
La socia Andrea pertenece al banco comunal SAN ISIDRO DE COMPONE, la socia continua dedicándose al negocio de compra y venta de leche, a socia se siente agradecida por el crédito otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con sus cuotas establecidas, la socia es una persona responsable y empeñosa, la socia a la vez sigue dedicándose a la agricultura y venta de leña, siendo de esta manera que la socia saca adelante a su familia.
La socia solicita el crédito para la compra de leche entre otros.
texts.en: The member, Andrea, is part the communal bank “San Isidro de Compone.”  She continues to make a living with her business buying and selling milk.  She is grateful for the loan that was granted and is committed to making her payments as scheduled.  She is a responsible and hardworking person.  At the same time, she continues working in agriculture and selling firewood, thus moving her family forward in life.  She is requesting the loan to purchase milk and other items.

loans.use: to buy milk and other items

loans.name: Las Cafeteras Group

texts.es:
“Las Cafeteras” es el nombre de un grupo de mujeres unidas por el mismo fin: el bienestar de su familia. La comunidad donde se encuentra el grupo es de clima húmedo lo cual favorece la siembra de café, naranja y caña de azúcar, siendo esta última el cultivo principal de la región. 

El nombre del grupo se debe a que las 5 integrantes tienen en común la producción de café, aunque la mayoría también desempeña una segunda actividad:

Rosa – Venta de Ropa 
Magdalena - Venta de Café 
María - Venta de Abarrotes
Patricia - Venta de Antojitos 
Amada – Venta de Calzado Por Catalogo

Doña Magdalena es una mujer muy trabajadora y empática, está casada con José Luis con quien ha procreado 4 hijos de los cuales ya solo uno depende económicamente de ellos.

El esposo de doña Magdalena proviene de una familia productora de café la cual tiene el beneficio cafetalero (fábrica) donde el grano se somete a una serie de procesos para obtener el producto final orgánico y libre de conservadores que comercializa la familia. 

Desde hace ya 6 años, Magdalena y su esposo se independizaron  y ahora tienen su propia marca de café. Cada mata de 5 cm la compran en 1 peso y las hojas y cáscara las utilizan como abono para el resto de la finca. El proceso de preparación del café es meticuloso ya que si el tueste se llega a pasar hasta unos instantes, el grano se echa a perder por completo. Doña Magdalena y su esposo se dan a la tarea de moler el grano, antes en licuadoras, y de empaquetarlo en bolsas de ¼,1/2, y 1 kg para distribuir con mayor facilidad en distintas comunidades. 

Con el préstamo anterior doña Magdalena compró bolsas, etiquetas, una báscula nueva, una licuadora y una selladora de bolsas y con sus ganancias compró un molino eléctrico pequeño donde tarda menos en moler el café y además le permite regular el tamaño del grano. Esta vez utilizará su préstamo para comprar más bolsas y otro molino ya que la producción y venta continúan aumentando. 

El próximo objetivo de Magdalena es comprar una desalmendradora y una secadora para seguir optimizando sus procesos en la finca. 

Las cafeteras agradecen la oportunidad de formar parte de VisionFund México y por el apoyo que reciben para hacer sus sueños posibles. 

*La fotografía fue tomada en el parque del municipio al que pertenece la comunidad, doña Magdalena es quien viste blusa floreada y falda color azul.
texts.en:
“Las Cafeteras” [coffee growing women] is the name of a group of women united for a common goal: the wellbeing of their families. The community where the group is located has a humid climate conducive to growing coffee, oranges, and sugar cane, the latter being the main crop of the region.

The name of the group is due to the fact that the five members have coffee production in common, although the majority also run a second business:

Rosa – clothing sales
Magdalena – coffee sales
María – grocery sales
Patricia – sale of prepared food
Amada – catalog shoe sales

Doña Magdalena is a very hardworking and empathetic woman. She is married to José Luis, with whom she has four children. Only one of them is still economically dependent on them.

Magdalena's husband comes from a coffee producing family that has a coffee processing facility where the beans are subjected to a series of processes in order to obtain the final organic, preservative-free product that the family sells. 

Six years ago, Magdalena and her husband began working independently and now have their own coffee brand. They buy each 5 cm shrub by weight; the leaves and hulls are used as fertilizer for the rest of the farm. The process of preparing the coffee is meticulous, because if a bean is roasted a moment too long, it is lost completely. Doña Magdalena and her husband take on the work of grinding the beans (previously in blenders) and packaging them in bags of 1/4, 1/2, and 1 kilo to easily distribute them in different communities.

With the previous loan, Doña Magdalena bought bags, tags, a new scale, a blender, and a bag sealer. With her profits, she bought a small electric grinder with which she spends less time grinding the coffee; in addition, it allows her to regulate the size of the grind. This time she will use her loan to buy more bags and another grinder, as her production and sales continue to increase.

Magdalena's next objective is to buy a coffee hulling machine and a coffee drier to continue optimizing the processes on the farm.

Las Cafeteras are grateful for the opportunity to be part of VisionFund México and for the support that they are receiving to make their dreams possible. 

* The photograph was taken in the community's municipal park. Doña Magdalena is the one wearing a flowered blouse and blue skirt.

loans.use: to buy bags and another grinder

loans.name: Teresita

texts.en:
Teresita is 65 years old and widowed with two children.

Teresita works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 15,000 loan through NWTF in order to purchase more groceries to sell.

Teresita has borrowed and paid back 29 loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 35 years and also earns an income from businesses farming sugarcane and raising livestock.

Teresita aspires to repair and renovate her family home.

loans.use: to purchase more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Irene's Group

texts.en:
Irene is 64 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very resourceful person. Even though Irene is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group, formed by eight farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Irene started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Irene’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 3.75 acres of land. Additionally, one of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive one solar light.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Shirly

texts.en:
Shirly is a married woman with seven children. She is a very hardworking entrepreneur. She is 47 years old and has four children who are currently in school.

Shirly has a business farming sugar cane in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 5,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

Shirly has been in this business for two years. She would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to college.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Omm Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Mina, the lady standing on the left in the photo, is a 51-year-old woman from a village in Koraput district of Odisha and a hardworking laborer, micro-entrepreneur and a responsible homemaker. She toils in the agricultural farms to earn a daily wage and simultaneously takes care of her animal husbandry business. She was formerly a household servant and has had a rough past which she has left behind in order to start afresh.

Mina does all this work while still taking care of her family and managing her household. The monthly income of 4,000 INR that she earns is barely enough to support her family, owing to high expenses. With an aim to increase her savings in order to attend to any financial emergencies in the future, she plans to expand her micro-enterprise by buying a new buffalo. She and Bhanu seek a loan of 36,000 INR for this purpose. This loan could mean an opportunity to Mina and Bhanu and their families to establish themselves financially and gain access to a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milking

loans.name: Birkhamba Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Ratnamani, the lady standing on the left in the photo, is a 37-year-old woman from a small village in the Koraput district of Odisha. She was formerly a household servant who has left behind her past to start afresh in life. At this age, she works full time as an agricultural laborer, earning a daily wage. She also runs a cattle-rearing business. Ratnamani earns a monthly income of 3,500 INR to support herself. She spends close to 2,500 INR on household expenses and manages to save the remaining amount.

Because of increasing expenses, it has become necessary for her to increase her income. She now wants to expand her business by buying a new buffalo. She and Dutika seek a loan of 36,000 INR from which she will use her portion to buy a buffalo. By lending 36,000 INR to Ratnamani and Dutika, lenders can provide them an opportunity to work hard and save enough money to support themselves in the future.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milking

loans.name: Birkhamba Shg-E Group

texts.en:
Sundarmani, the lady standing on the left in the photo, is a very active lady of 35 years from Koraput district, Odisha. She can only can sign her name. She is a responsible mother of two school-going sons, studying in classes 9 and 10. Sundarmani's husband runs a grocery shop in their locality. He purchases varieties of grocery items and daily use  products from the wholesale market and sells them in his small shop. He sells items like rice, sugar, oil, eggs, bread, biscuits, detergent etc. in his grocery shop. Sundarmani also assists her husband in this business after managing her household activities.

Now, Sundarmani and her husband aim to expand their business to obtain a better income and to attract more customers. Thus, she, along with Manima, is applying for a loan of 36,000 INR from People's Forum. Sundarmani will use her portion to invest in buying more grocery items, so that she can give financial sustenance to her family and provide a better education to her sons.

loans.use: to invest in buying more grocery items in bulk to resell

loans.name: Anastancia's Group

texts.en:
Anastancia is 58 years old and has five children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Anastancia is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group, formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Anastancia started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Anastancia’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light, so with this loan the group will also receive a total of six solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season.

loans.name: Vevencia

texts.en:
Vevencia is 37 years old and has three children.  Vevencia is married and has two children who are in school.

Vevencia is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines. Vevencia requested a PHP 12,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Vevencia has been farming vegetables for ten years now, and has borrowed five times in the past from NWTF to sustain it.

In the future, Vevencia would like to save enough money so she could afford to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Eunice

texts.en:
Wonderful Kiva lenders! Meet Eunice, a 52-year-old mum who is so humble, honest and a very hardworking woman on this planet Earth. Eunice is the mother of seven lovely children that she really adores so much and will always do anything good so that they never go to bed with hungry stomachs. Eunice hails from the Bungoma area of Kenya. She never got the opportunity to advance her education and get a white collar job but this did not kill her dream of wanting to succeed in life.

Eunice started farming and has been doing farming for the past six years. Throughout those years, she has gathered so much experience and all the farming techniques are at her fingertips. Eunice practices mixed farming on her farm and through the profits, she has managed to take care of her family's needs and give her children a good education because she believes that education is the only “key to success”. Eunice is a mum who is very enterprising. She is seeking a loan of KES 60,000 to start horticulture farming on her farm. Because of favorable weather patterns, a good road network in her village, good soil and a ready market for horticulture products, Eunice wants to take advantage of that and reap more profits.

Juhudi Kilimo is partnering with Kiva and Kiva lenders to help aspiring mums like Eunice to make their farming dreams come to reality through training and loan financing. Eunice hopes that through the loan, she will improve her living conditions. Her dreams and projections are that by the end of the first year, she will not only be selling in the local market but will also be selling in international markets by exporting fruits and vegetables. Through this, she will be able to assure her children a secure future and uninterrupted learning because she will be able to pay tuition fees on time. Eunice is not a selfish mother and will also want to impact positively on society. That is why she will employ people to work for her on her horticulture farm, hence having an impact on society. Kindly help her out!

loans.use: To start horticulture farming

loans.name: Sarien's Group

texts.en: A local farmer from the Srey Snom district of Siem Reap province, Sarien is 32 years old and a married woman. To support her family’s living, she and her husband grow rice. In order to supplement her family income, she raises two pigs. For Sarien, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). Now she is leading a group of three to get a loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy piglets to bring up. She hopes that she can expand her business to get more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy piglets to bring up

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Soeb's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Kampong Cham province, Soeb is 52 years old and a mother of one child. To support her family, she grows cassava on one hectare area as their single main source of income. She has been involved this business for ages and earns about 37,500 KHR per day. 

For Soeb, this is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She has fully repaid her past loans and used them wisely to improve her living conditions at a gradual pace. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide and pay for laborers' fees. She hopes that she can get more yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy pesticide and pay for laborers.

loans.name: Anjelina's Group

texts.en:
Anjelina is 34 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Anjelina has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to feed her family and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Anjelina also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Anjelina's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Andriano's Group

texts.en:
Andriano's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Andriano, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 30 years old, married, and has two children. Andriano has been a farmer for seven years and is often referred to as a very reliable person.

Andriano isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed that his life has changed; especially in the sense that he has had a larger farm  support group ever since. This year, Andriano will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have an overall improved quality of life.

Using this loan, Andriano's Group will purchase a total of six solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Sovannary's Group

texts.en:
Sovannary, a farmer living in Bovel district of Battambang province, is 49 years old. She lives with three dependent children, two of whom are studying in high school. To support her family, she grows rice on three hectares of farmland. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

The leader for this group of three members, Sovannary will spend her loan portion to buy pesticides, fertilizers, seeds, and plow the field to grow rice. She hopes that she can earn more income to update her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy pesticides, fertilizers, seeds and plow the field to grow rice

loans.name: Leakna's Group

texts.en:
A villager from Kampong Cham province, Leakna is 33 years old. She is a mother of four children, one of whom is still too young for school. The other three are in school. She grows cassava on one hectare area as their single main source of income. She has been involved in this business for ages and it earns her about 26,700 KHR per day. 

This is Leakna's third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She is leading a group of two to get new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide, pay for land fees, and laborers' fees. She hopes that she can get a better yield from her farm than last year.

loans.use: To buy pesticide, pay for land fees and laborers' fees.

loans.name: Julio Miguel

texts.es:
Julio Miguel tiene 43 años de edad, no tiene hijos, vive en la casa de sus padres en el distrito de Colasay, provincia de Jaén, región de Cajamarca, sierra norte de Perú. Los pobladores de este distrito se dedican principalmente a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

Julio Miguel se dedica al cultivo de arroz, desde hace 10 años, en el caserío de Cuyca. Cuenta con experiencia en este negocio y con buenas referencias en su distrito. Julio Miguel desea el crédito para la compra de fertilizantes y pago de peones para la instalación en su cultivo de arroz, con esto incrementará los rendimientos de su cultivo. Él posee conocimientos en el negocio por lo que se asegurá que será una buena inversión que le generará mayores ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Julio Miguel is 43 years old, and he does not have any children. He lives at his parents' house in the Colasay district, which is located in the Jaen province in the Cajamarca region in the northern mountains of Peru. The people who live in this district work primarily in agriculture, commerce, and raising animals.

Julio Miguel has made a living cultivating rice for the past 10 years in the village of Cuyca. He relies on experience in this business and on good references in his district. Julio Miguel is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers and to pay laborers to plant his rice crops. This way, he will increase his crops' yield. He is knowledgeable about this business; therefore, he is sure that this will be a good investment that will help him generate more earnings and, ultimately, improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and to pay laborers to plant his rice crops.

loans.name: Hen's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Cham Province, Hen is 47 years old and a mother of five children. To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows cassava on five hectares of farmland. Moreover, she works for others for a fee to earn more income.

This is her fourth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans successfully. In a group of three members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy pesticide and pay a plowing fee. She hopes that she can earn more income to expand her farmland.

loans.use: to buy pesticide and pay a plowing fee.

loans.name: Yvan

texts.es:
Yvan tiene 35 años de edad, su estado civil es conviviente, tiene 2 hijos a su cargo, cuenta con casa propia en el distrito de Oyotún en la provincia de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte de Perú, en este distrito se dedican a la agricultura y a la crianza y venta de animales de corral,, dicho lugar es una zona rural.

El se dedica a brindar servicio de jornalería, realiza esta actividad desde hace 10 años. Cuenta con mucha experiencia en este negocio y con cientes fijos quienes dan buenas referencias de el. Solicita préstamo para la compra de herramientas para implementar su negocio así como para brindar mantenimiento a sus actuales herramientas, esto le servirá para tener en mejores condiciones sus herramientas para poder brindar mejores servicios lo que le generará un incremento en sus ingresos y por ende mejorará su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Yvan is 35 years old. He has a partner as well as two children under his care. He lives in his own house in the Oyotun district, which is located in the Chiclayo province in the Lambayeque region in the northern coast of Peru. The people in this district work in agriculture and raising and selling farmyard animals. It is a rural place. 

For the past 10 years, he has made a living as a day laborer. He relies on lots of experience in this business and on regular customers who provide him with good references. He is requesting a loan to buy new tools in order to continue with his business and to provide maintenance to his current tools. This will allow him to maintain his tools in better conditions and to provide better services, which will allow him to increase his income and, ultimately, to improve his quality of life.

loans.use: to buy new tools in order to continue with his business and to provide maintenance to his current tools.

loans.name: Phanice

texts.en:
Phanice, 39, is a housewife who practices small-scale dairy farming in Chwele, a village in the Rift valley province of Kenya.

Phanice is active when it comes to commercial activities. She is a pragmatic problem solver. Her distinguishing factor is that she adds a business angle to every cultural way of life. While her community keeps cattle and poultry for food, she does the same at a greater scale in order to sell the surplus.

Phanice is seeking a loan to purchase a brood of hens. To grow her poultry farm, she will use the same technique she used to grow her dairy farm. The flock of hens will lay eggs, half of which will be sold and the rest kept for hatching and family consumption.

With your investment, Phanice will be able to uplift her family's livelihood by contributing to the income they generate. She will use the money from the poultry farm to grow the business and pay for her children's education.

loans.use: to buy poultry

loans.name: Rosenie

texts.en:
Rosenie is 54 years old and married with five children. One of her children is in school. 

She is in the agricultural business, farming vegetables in the Philippines, and has requested a PHP 11,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

Rosenie has been farming vegetables for 30 years now and has borrowed from NWTF 10 times in the past to sustain her business. In the future, she would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies

loans.name: Magret's Group

texts.en:
Magret, featured in the above picture, is representing her farming group formed by six farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She is 45 years old and a married mother of five children, and she is often described as a very trustworthy person. 

Although Magret has been a farmer for more than 20 years, she is new to One Acre Fund and decided to join this year because she really wanted to earn enough to send her children to school. Even though she is new to the program, Magret wanted to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. With the profits earned from this season’s harvest, Magret hopes to be able to invest in a business.

With this loan, the group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 2.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of two solar lights, as, even though Magret decided not to, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light as part of their loan package.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Nat's Group

texts.en:
Nat is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school; the other one is too young. She lives in Kampong Cham province. Nowadays, she grows rice as her main source of income to make a living. She has been involved this business for ages and earns about 46,900 KHR per day.

This is Nat's first time borrowing with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed to support her farm. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and seed to support her farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Lydia

texts.en:
Lydia is 47 years old and married with one child. She works hard to provide for her family. She runs a general store in the Philippines and requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy more groceries to sell.

Lydia has borrowed and repaid twelve loans from NWTF before this loan. She has been running the general store for 23 years and also earns an income from food vending.

Lydia aspires to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy cassava flour to sell.

loans.name: Mélanie

texts.fr: Agée de 48 ans,  Mélanie est une femme veuve très active qui vit dans le quartier d’Attiégou. Mélanie a deux enfants et pour les nourrir, elle vend des bananes plantains et du charbon de bois pour trouver un bénéfice. Mélanie s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché local. Pour équiper son stock, Mélanie demande ce crédit pour commander des sacs de charbons de bois et des bananes plantains pour réaliser un bon profit et assurer l’éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Aged 48,  Mélanie is a very active widow who lives in the neighborhood called Attiégou. Mélanie has two children and in order to feed them, she sells plantains and charcoal to earn a profit. She stocks up twice a month at a local market. 

To bolster her inventory, Mélanie is requesting this loan so that she can order some sacks of charcoal and plantains and make a good profit so as to ensure the education of her children.

loans.use: to buy nine piles of plantains and some charcoal for resale

loans.name: Omm Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Subarna, the lady standing on the right in the photo, a 49-year-old woman from a village in the Koraput district of Odisha, works for a daily wage in the agricultural farms. In order to maximize her efforts, she is running a small scale animal husbandry business, too. The family of five earns a monthly household income of 8,000 INR. Two-thirds of the income being utilized to cover expenses, they end up saving 3,000 INR per month.

Subarna has bigger dreams. She wants to get rid of financial dependency and wants to become secure. This will need a lot of savings and a lot of hard work. Subarna doesn't think twice before investing her best efforts. She wants to expand her animal husbandry business and increase her income. She and Mita are seeking a loan of 36,000 INR from People's Forum. She will use her portion to buy a buffalo, with which she expects to increase her monthly income by 2,000 INR. She is thankful to Kiva for this support.

loans.use: to buy a buffalo for milking

loans.name: Awoussi

texts.fr: Awoussi est une femme veuve de 45 ans qui vit à Attiégou avec ses sept enfants. Awoussi est une femme très dynamique et entreprenante qui vend des épices dans son quartier. Son commerce lui procure le revenu nécessaire pour répondre favorablement aux besoins quotidiens. Awoussi s’approvisionne  deux fois par mois au marché. Awoussi demande ce crédit pour acheter des sacs de piment afin de faire plus de bénéfice et répondre aux attentes de ses clients.
texts.en: Awoussi is a 45-year old widow who lives in Attiégou with her seven children. She is a very energetic and enterprising woman selling spices in her neighborhood. Her business brings in a revenue allowing her to manage everyday expenses. Awoussi stocks up twice a month at the market. She is requesting this loan to buy bags of pimento in order to increase her revenues and better meet customer demand.

loans.use: to buy two bags of pimento.

loans.name: Akouvi

texts.fr: Agée de 51 ans Akouvi est une femme mariée qui vit à Hédzranawoé avec ses deux enfants. Etant très entreprenante et active dans le développement, Akouvi prépare de la pate bandée à base du maïs dans son quartier. Ce commerce lui permet de bénéficier d’un revenu pour aider son mari à financer l’éducation de leurs enfants. Akouvi s’approvisionne une fois par mois au marché. Pour acheter un sac de maïs, Akouvi demande ce crédit pour réaliser ses objectifs et avoir une bonne marge bénéficiaire.
texts.en:
Aged 51, Akouvi is a married woman who lives in Hédzranawoé with her two children. Being very enterprising and active in development, she prepares wrapped balls of maize porridge in her neighborhood. This business allows her to make a profit so that she can help her husband to pay for the education of their children. She stocks up once a month in a market. 

To buy a sack of maize, Akouvi is requesting this loan so that she can reach her goals and make a good profit.

loans.use: to buy one sack of maize

loans.name: Un Futuro Mejor Group

texts.es:
En una región cañera del estado de Oaxaca, uno de los ingenios donde se procesa la caña para obtener azúcar, hace sonar su silbato tres veces al día indicando la hora a los habitantes y el cambio de turno de los trabajadores.

Muy cerca del ingenio, viven los integrantes del “Gurpo Un Futuro Mejor” quienes pretenden ofrecer un mejor porvenir a los suyos con ayuda de sus actividades: 

Ernesto  - Venta de Refrescos Y Abarrotes
Alicia - Venta de Ropa  Y Dulces 
Dulce – Servicio de Caseta Telefónica Y Venta de Calzado 
Teresa - Venta de Abarrotes Y Pollo 
Everardo - Venta de Abarrotes 
Tirso – Venta de Ropa

La señora Teresa, mejor conocida como “Tere” es madre de un joven de 15 años. Con la motivación de tener sus propios ingresos, sentirse productiva y apoyar a su esposo con los gastos de su hijo, hace 10 años comenzó a vender abarrotes. Aunque inició sólo con algunos productos, hoy en día Tere ofrece un mayor surtido: ahora también vende queso y carne de pollo. 

Los préstamos de VisionFund los ha invertido en mercancía para la tienda y en carne.
