El nuevo préstamo lo utilizará para comprar arroz, frijol, aceite, refrescos, papel higiénico, y detergente ya que son los productos que más vende. Con el alza en el precio de los huevos y las pocas posibilidades que tienen los habitantes de su población para consumir con tanta frecuencia este producto, Tere ahora tiene la idea de comenzar a vender huevos de rancho que son de mejor calidad, más naturales y de un precio más accesible. 

El grupo da las gracias a Kiva y a VisionFund México  por preocuparse por el bienestar de las familias mexicanas y otorgarles préstamos que cambian sus vidas.

*La fotografía fue tomada afuera de la casa de la señora Alicia. En la imagen se aprecian los rieles de la vía por donde transita el tren, Teresa es quien viste  blusa color azul y pesquero color negro.
texts.en:
In a sugarcane-producing region of Oaxaca, one of the mills where the sugar cane is processed blows its whistle three times a day indicating the time to the inhabitants and the change of shift to the workers.

Very close to the mill live the members of the group “Un Futuro Mejor” [A Better Future] who try to offer a better future to their loved ones through their activities:

Ernesto - Sales of Soft Drinks And Groceries
Alicia – Sales of Clothes And Sweets
Dulce - Phone Booth Service and Sales of Footwear
Teresa – Sales of Groceries And Chicken
Everardo – Sales of Groceries
Tirso – Sales of Clothes

Teresa, known as "Tere," is the mother of a 15-year-old boy. Motivated to make her own income, to feel productive, and to support her husband with the expenses related to their son, 10 years ago she started selling groceries. Although she started with only a few products, today Tere offers a wider choice: now she also sells cheese and chicken.

She has invested her VisionFund loans in merchandise for the store and meat. She will use the new loan to buy rice, beans, oil, soft drinks, toilet paper, and detergent, since these are the products that she sells the most. With the rise in the price of eggs and the inability of the inhabitants of her village to consume this product frequently, Tere now has the idea to start selling farm eggs, which are better quality, more natural, and more affordable.
The group thanks Kiva and VisionFund Mexico for caring about the welfare of Mexican families and giving them loans that change their lives.
* The photograph was taken outside the home of Alicia. In the picture the train track can be seen. Teresa is the one wearing the blue blouse and black capri pants.

loans.use: buy rice, beans, oil, toilet paper, detergent, and soft drinks.

loans.name: Afi

texts.fr: Afi est une femme mariée qui vit à Attiégou avec son enfant. Afi vend des produits cosmétiques et des mèches pour gagner son revenu et favoriser une éducation adéquate à son enfant. Grâce à cette activité, Afi arrive à faire une bonne épargne et tirer un bon profit de son activité. Afi s’approvisionne deux fois par mois au marché local. Pour équiper son atelier, Afi demande ce prêt pour acheter des mèches, des tissages et des défrisants pour gagner son revenu et atteindre ses objectifs.
texts.en: Afi is a married woman who lives in Attiégou with her child. Afi sells beauty products and hair extensions to earn income and to ensure the adequate education of her child.  Thanks to this business, Afi manages to earn a good profit and build her savings.  Afi stocks up twice a month at the local market.  To supply her workshop, Afi is asking for this loan to buy hair extensions, hair weaves and hair straighteners to earn her income and achieve her goals.

loans.use: to buy 4 dozen hair extensions, 3 dozen weaves and 7 dozen hair straighteners.

loans.name: Miguel Angel Coreas

texts.es:
Miguel, considera que al hacer uso de créditos y al administrarlos bien la sastrería esta mejor equipada y cuenta con más clientela, su familia se mantiene y no han tenido ninguna dificultad para trabajar.
Está solicitando un nuevo crédito para comprar telas, hilos, hombreras, botones, agujas, dedales y otros materiales de costura que necesita para confeccionar las prendas de vestir, así mantendrá la calidad y puntualidad de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Miguel, believes that by making use of this loan and properly administering it, the tailor shop would be better equipped and have more customers, his family will be supported, and he will have no difficulty in working.  

He is requesting a new loan to buy fabrics, threads, shoulder pads, buttons, needles, thimbles, and other sewing materials needed to make clothing, and continue the quality, and timeliness of his work.

loans.use: to buy fabrics, yarn, shoulder pads, buttons, needles, thimbles and other sewing materials that he needs to make garments.

loans.name: Oscar Alejandro

texts.es:
Oscar, ha tenido un impacto positivo al invertir el crédito anterior que tan amablemente se le otorgo, actualmente su negocio está más surtido, ya que no solo ofrece CDS y DVDS, y puede mantener el apoyo económico a su familia.
Para cubrir las nuevas demandas está solicitando un préstamo con el que  comprara CDS, DVS, artículos plásticos, jabón, entre otros productos que sean de utilidad para mantener a sus clientes satisfechos.
texts.en:
Oscar has had a positive outcome after investing the previous loan that was so graciously granted to him. Now his business offers a wider selection since he offers not only CDs and DVDs, and he can continue to generate financial support for his family. 

To meet new demands he is seeking a loan with which he will buy CDs, DVDs, plastic items and soap, among other useful products to keep his customers satisfied.

loans.use: to buy CDs, DVDs, plastic items and soap, among other useful products to keep his customers satisfied.

loans.name: Jackline's Group

texts.en:
Jackline, pictured above, has been a farmer for more than 30 years, and is now proud to represent her group of 13 farmers in Kakamega South District. She is 60 years old, is married, and has six children.

Jackline likes to think of herself as a very hard-working individual. She has been working alongside One Acre Fund since 2014 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers. She says that being part of the One Acre Fund community has meant that she has had more profits from each harvest. Jackline plans to use the profits from this coming season to send her children to school.

In total, Jackline’s Group will receive inputs to cultivate 8 acres of land. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize

loans.name: Vanesa Roxana

texts.es: Vanessa tiene 29 años es soltera vive con sus padres tiene un hijo de 10 meses, vive en el Cantón Ventanas Provincia de los Rios, Ella trabaja en una farmacia hace algunos años, solicita el crédito para la compra de un televisor ya que el que tenia se le daño para asi compartir con su hijo en su tiempo libre, la compra realizara en Ventanas, su sueño es tener un negocio propio los desafios a los que se enfrenta es las enfermedades y su pasatiempo es hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Vanessa, who lives in Los Rios Province in the Canton of Ventanas, is 29, single, and the mother of a 10-year-old son. She has for several years made a living working in a pharmacy. Vanessa would like to go into business for herself, but one obstacle to achieving that goal is illness.  

Vanessa likes to play sports in her spare time, and also spends some time watching television with her son. The television she has now, however, has been damaged. Vanessa is applying for a loan for the purchase of a new television.

loans.use: to purchase a television.

loans.name: Maria Del Carmen

texts.es:
María, vive con sus tres hijos y su esposo, tiene su propia venta de verduras, trabaja de cuatro de la mañana a once de la mañana, el oficio lo aprendió de su familia y tiene una experiencia de más de 20 años, hasta el momento no representa dificultades en su negocio.
Comprará cebollas, chiles, tomates, repollos, güisquiles, yuca, etc., ofrecerá mercadería fresca a sus clientes, espera que la inversión sea de ayuda para aumentar sus ventas y tener estabilidad económica.
Los sueños de María son mantener su negocio en el mercado, reparar su vivienda y dar a sus hijos educación superior.
texts.en:
María lives with her three children and her husband. She has her own business selling vegetables. She works from four in the morning until eleven in the morning. She learned the trade from her family and she has more than 20 years of experience. At the moment she is not experiencing any difficulties with the business.

She will buy onions, peppers, tomatoes, cabbage, chayote, yucca etc. and will offer fresh produce to her customers. She hopes that the investment will help her to increase her sales and have financial stability. 

María’s dreams are to keep her business in the market, make repairs on her home and offer her children a superior education.

loans.use: to buy onions, peppers, tomatoes, cabbage, chayote, yucca etc. in order to offer fresh produce to her customers.

loans.name: Huon's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Sangke district of Battambang province, Huon is 65 years old. She is a widow with six children. To support her family, she grows vegetables and works as a construction worker. She also raises chickens to supplement her family's income. She can earn about 27,800 KHR per day from her work.

This is Huon's fifth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loan. She leads a group of two borrowers seeking a new loan. She will spend her loan portion to buy chickens to bring up and soybean seeds to grow. She hopes that she can expand her current business and get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy chickens to bring up and soybean seeds to grow

loans.name: Ry's Group

texts.en:
A young woman living in Kampong Cham province, Ry is 24 years old and a mother of a young child. She overcomes her family’s hardship by growing cassava on a one-hectare plot. She can earn extra income by working for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 35,600 KHR per day.

This is Ry's second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loan successfully. She leads a group of three members seeking a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing. She hopes that she can get a better yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pay for plowing.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Manuel Antonio

texts.es:
Manuel, es un agricultor que siembra maíz,  frijol y tomate, vive con su esposa y tres de sus hijos, estos le ayudan a realizar los trabajos agricolas, toda su vida ha trabajado en el campo y es así como obtiene los recursos económicos para subsistir con su familia.
Invertirá en semilla, insecticidas, herbicidas y abono, para sembrar y dar un buen trato a los diferentes cultivos, espera tener una cosecha abundante para tener producto suficiente para abastecer a su familia y a sus clientes.
Manuel sueña con poder comprar un terreno para dejar de pagar alquiler y ampliar sus cultivos.
texts.en:
Manuel, is a farmer who grows corn, beans, and tomatoes. He lives with his wife, and three of his children. They help carry out the farm work. All his life, he has worked in the field, and this is how he obtains the resources to subsist with his family.

He will invest in seed, insecticides, herbicides, and fertilizers, to grow, and to give good treatment to different crops. He hopes to have an abundant harvest, to have enough to feed his family, and his customers.

Manuel dreams of being able to buy land, to stop paying rent, and to expand his crops.

loans.use: to invest in seed, insecticides, herbicides and fertilizer to grow, and to give good treatment to different crops.

loans.name: Chanry

texts.en:
Chanry is 50 years old. She is a widowed mother of five children. Four of her children are still depending on her, and one is in school. She lives in a rural area located in Bovel district of Battambang province. For 10 years, the sources of her family’s income have been rice farming and selling groceries.

This is the first loan for Chanry with Kiva’s partner, VisionFund. She applied for this loan in order to buy seeds and more groceries to sell. She hopes that her family will earn more income and have a better standard of living.

loans.use: to buy seeds and more groceries to sell.

loans.name: Toeur's Group

texts.en:
Toeur, 32, is a farmer living in the Bovel district of Battambang province. She grows rice and cassava as the main sources of her family's income. Sometimes, she also works as a paid worker to supplement income.

This is Toeur's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two members, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to rent farmland to grow cassava. She hopes that she can earn more income and provide family members with a better living standard.

loans.use: to rent farmland to grow cassava.

loans.name: Stanely

texts.en:
Stanely is aged 32 years, married with two children, and lives in Bundibugyo, Uganda. He deals in cocoa farming and selling. He started the business to raise income for his family.

His clients are mainly cocoa companies and dealers. The challenge he meets is limited capital. He hopes to expand the business, open a retail shop, and educate his children.

He has asked for a loan to buy more cocoa for selling.

loans.use: to buy cocoa beans for resale.

loans.name: Ra's Group

texts.en:
Ra, 44, lives with family members in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province. She is a mother of four dependent children, three of whom are in school and the other one is too young. 

Ra grows cassava and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved this business for ages and earns about KHR 26,500 per day. 

This is Ra's third cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. 

In a group of two members, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer and pesticide to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Sharon

texts.en:
Sharon, aged 32, is married and has four children, three of whom who are in school. She is in the agricultural business, and has been farming vegetables in the Philippines for the past 12 years. 

Sharon has borrowed 12 times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business. She has now requested a PHP 10,000 loan through NWTF to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

In the future, Sharon would like to save enough money so she can afford to continue to send her children to school.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers and other farm supplies.

loans.name: Thy's Group

texts.en: Thy, a mother of four dependent children living in Kampong Cham province, is 40 years old. She earns income to support her family by growing cassava on a two-hectare area. Moreover, she can earn more income by repairing motors and working for others for a fee. This is her third loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loans. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her portion of the loan to pay the fee for plowing. She hopes that she can realize higher yields than last year.

loans.use: to pay the fee for plowing.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Ponhea Krek district

loans.name: Chhoung's Group

texts.en:
Chhoung, a farmer from the Bovel district in Battambang province, is 47 years old. She is the married mother of seven children, five of whom are dependent on her and still in high school. For a living, she grows rice and cassava. To supplement her income, Chhoung sells pork at the market near her house. She has been involved in her job for 10 years. 

This is Chhoung's third time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her previous loans. She leads a group of five to take out a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to rent a two-hectare plot of farmland to grow cassava. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her standard of living.

loans.use: to rent a two-hectare plot of farmland to grow cassava

loans.name: Nena Estrella

texts.es:
Nena es una mujer de 25 años de edad, soltera, tiene una hija mujer de 6 años, y su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad en su tienda de barrio.
Ella es buena madre, paciente, solidaria, emprendedora, independiente, responsable y trabajadora. Su negocio lo desarrolla en la zona ‘villa Fátima’ un sitio caracterizado por recibir la cosecha de la hoja de Coca procedente del norte del departamento y por encontrarse la terminal de transporte público; con destino a poblaciones del norte, de clima frío y ventoso, vientos que llegan de la cordillera a una altura de 3600 metros sobre el nivel del mar.
Nena es de tez morena, ojos marrones, cabello largo rojizo lo usa amarrado, baja estatura, complexión física delgada, su lengua materna es el Aymará y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que administra. Su vida la realiza junto a su hija que estudia en la escuela, viven en un cuarto alquilado construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y cuenta con agua potable, energía eléctrica, gas domiciliario y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de alimentos y artículos de primera necesidad, como; pan, azúcar, harina, arroz, fideo, refrescos, leche, galletas, golosinas y otros. Anteriormente trabajaba con su ex pareja en el servicio de transporte público a raíz de su separación ella vio por conveniente abrir un nuevo negocio. “inicié mi negocio hace un año, invertí todos mis ahorros y con la ayuda de mi madre abrí mi tienda…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que no tiene competencia en el lugar, la desventaja es la falta de capital de inversión para cubrir su demanda. Su sueño es ahorrar para invertir en su negocio para darle una mejor vida a su hija, ella desea ampliar su negocio realizando la compra de una heladera para almacenar embutidos y otra para almacenar helados. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 1 años que se dedica a esta actividad.
Es por esos motivos que Nena solicita un préstamo para la compra de una heladera para embutidos y otra para helados para incrementar sus ventas y pagar los gastos escolares de su hija.
texts.en:
Nena is a 25-year-old single woman.  She has a 6-year-old daughter, and her business is selling food and basic necessity items in her neighborhood store.

She is a good mother, patient, caring, enterprising, independent, responsible, and hard working.  She carries out her business in the “Villa Fátima” zone, an area characterized as the recipient of the coca leaf harvest that comes from the north of the department, as well as a terminal of public transit to villages in the north.  It has a cold and windy climate, with winds coming to the mountain range at an altitude of 3600 meters above sea level.

Nena has a dark complexion, Nena is a 25-year-old single woman.  She has a 6-year-old daughter, and her business is selling food and basic necessity items in her neighborhood store.

She is a good mother, patient, caring, enterprising, independent, responsible, and hard working.  She carries out her business in the “Villa Fátima” zone, an area characterized as the recipient of the coca leaf harvest that comes from the north of the department, as well as a terminal of public transit to villages in the north.  It has a cold and windy climate, with winds coming to the mountain range at an altitude of 3600 meters above sea level.

Nena has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long reddish hair which she wears tied back, a short stature, and thin build.  Her native language is Aymara, and she speaks Spanish due to the mainstream culture and the business she administers.  She lives her life along with her daughter, who attends school.  They live in a rented room, built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof, and which has potable water, electric energy, residential gas, and a plumbing system.  Her business is the sale of food and basic necessity items, such as bread, sugar, flour, rice, noodles, soft drinks, milk, cookies, sweets, and others.  Previously, she worked with her ex-partner in public transit service.  As a result of their separation, she thought it best to open a new business.  She says, “I started my business a year ago.  I invested all of my savings, and with the help of my mother, I opened my store.”  The advantage of her business is that she has no competition in her area.  The disadvantage is the lack of investment capital to fulfill the demand.  Her dream is to save up to invest in her business, so she can give her daughter a better life.  She wants to expand her business and purchase a cooler to store cold cuts, and an additional one to store ice cream.  This is her first loan cycle with the lending institution in the one year she has been working in this business.

Nena is requesting a loan to purchase a cooler for cold cuts and one for ice cream, to increase her sales and pay her daughter’s school expenses.
 eyes, long reddish hair which she wears tied back, a short stature, and thin build.  Her native language is Aymara, and she speaks Spanish due to the mainstream culture and the business she administers.  She lives her life along with her daughter, who attends school.  They live in a rented room, built of brick and cement, with a corrugated iron roof, and which has potable water, electric energy, residential gas, and a plumbing system.  Her business is the sale of food and basic necessity items, such as bread, sugar, flour, rice, noodles, soft drinks, milk, cookies, sweets, and others.  Previously, she worked with her ex-partner in public transit service.  As a result of their separation, she thought it best to open a new business.  She says, “I started my business a year ago.  I invested all of my savings, and with the help of my mother, I opened my store.”  The advantage of her business is that she has no competition in her area.  The disadvantage is the lack of investment capital to fulfill the demand.  Her dream is to save up to invest in her business, so she can give her daughter a better life.  She wants to expand her business and purchase a cooler to store cold cuts, and an additional one to store ice cream.  This is her first loan cycle with the lending institution in the one year she has been working in this business.

Nena is requesting a loan to purchase a cooler for cold cuts and one for ice cream, to increase her sales and pay her daughter’s school expenses.

loans.use: to buy a cooler for cold cuts and one for ice cream, to increase her sales and pay her daughter's school expenses.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase fertilizer, seedlings and an irrigator, and to also add stock to her retail shop .

loans.name: Orlando

texts.es:
Orlando tiene 59 años de edad, vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Cayaltí, una comunidad que se dedica a la agricultura, comercio y ganadería, ubicada a dos horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, región Lambayeque, en la costa norte del Perú.

El brinda servicio de maestro de construcción tanto en su distrito como en zonas aledañas a su comunidad, es conocido por el buen servicio que ofrece, ha solicitado un préstamo para la compra de madera que es una herramienta de trabajo para armar las columnas y de esta manera seguir brindando un mejor servicio a sus clientes y al mismo tiempo generar mayores ingresos para una mejor calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Orlando is 59 years old and lives in his family’s home in the District of Cayaltí. His community is known for agriculture, trade, and livestock breeding. It is located two hours away from the city of Chiclayo in the region of Lambayeque, which is on the northern coast of Peru.

Orlando offers his services as a master builder in his district and in the areas that surround his community. He is known for the good service that he offers. Orlando is requesting a loan so that he can buy wood, which is the material he uses for his work, so that he can assemble columns and continue providing good service to his customers. At the same time, he will be able to generate more income and achieve a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy wood to use in his work.

loans.name: Carolyne

texts.en: Hello, lenders. Meet Carolyne. She is a smallholder farmer from the Chwele location in the Bungoma region of Kenya. Carolyne enjoys the support her mixed-farming business gets from her husband of 28 years, Julius. She is looking to expand by leveraging her business. Carolyne is seeking a loan to purchase more poultry to increase the number from the 25 she already has on the farm. This will ensure that she can cut costs, reduce waste, and increase egg production. She also makes supplementary income from a dairy cow. Besides livestock farming, Carolyne grows food crops such as maize, beans, and trees. Her plan is to invest this loan in a way that will give her enough income to take care of her six children's basic and educational needs. All that she patiently waits for is your kindness.

loans.use: To buy additional poultry

loans.name: Wendie

texts.en:
Wendie is 21 years old, married and has two children.

Wendie is in the agricultural business, raising pigs in the Philippines. She requested a PHP 9,000 loan through NWTF in order to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

Wendie has been raising pigs for two years now, and has borrowed four times in the past from NWTF to sustain her business.

In the future, Wendie would like to save money to expand her business.

loans.use: to buy feed and other supplies to raise her pigs.

loans.name: Ismail

texts.ru: Исмаил, 49 лет, женат, есть 2 детей. У Исмаила среднее образование, уже 4 года он занимается земледелием и животноводством. Сегодня в хозяйстве Исмаила есть земельный участок мерою 0,37 Га, где он выращивает картофель и есть 3 коровы. Ежемесячный доход Исмаила составляет в среднем 15,000 сомов (KGS). Он очень трудолюбив и ответственен. Обратился в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 10,000 сом (KGS), на который он купит скот для увеличения поголовья. Доходы от кредита позволят Исмаилу увеличить его хозяйство и отремонтировать дом.
texts.en: Ismail is 49 years old, married, and has 2 children. Ismail has a secondary education, and he has been farming and raising animals for 4 years. Ismail's farm now has a .37 hectare plot of land, where he grows potatoes and has 3 cows. Ismail's monthly income averages 15,000 som (KGS). He is very hardworking and responsible. He has approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 10,000 som (KGS) to purchase livestock to increase the size of his herd. The proceeds from his loan will let Ismail enlarge his farm and repair his house.

loans.use: to purchase additional livestock for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Cheang's Group

texts.en: Living in a rural area of the Kampong Cham province, Cheang is 32 years old. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school. The other two children are too young for school. She grows rice as the main source of her income; she also grows vegetables to supplement her income. She has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 41,900 KHR per day. This is Cheang's third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and seed, and to pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and seed, and to pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Violet's Group

texts.en:
Violet, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group of seven farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2010 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers. She is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Violet will not only purchase maize seed and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that she will be able to reduce her consumption of paraffin fuel and, therefore, save more money. Violet plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

Violet’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 4.75 acres of land. They will also receive a total of one solar light.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seed and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: To's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer living in Kampong Cham province, To is 39 years old and a mother of five dependent children. 

To support her living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved in this business for 21 years and she earns about KHR 36,100 per day. 

This is To's second cycle with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. 

She leads a group of five members to get a new loan. As the group leader, To will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm. She hopes that she can get a greater yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her rice farm.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Prey Chhor district

loans.name: Sareun's Group

texts.en:
A single woman living in Kampong Cham province, Sareun is 40 years old. She earns income to support her living conditions via rice cropping and working for others for a fee. She can earn income of about KHR 29,200 per day. 

This is Sareun's first time with VisionFund Cambodia (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan. 

As the group leader, Sareun will spend her entire loan portion to buy rice seed and pay for plowing fees. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her family's conditions.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and pay for plowing fees.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Tbaung Khmum district

loans.name: Sreyny

texts.en:
Sreyny is a 20-year-old single student who is pursuing a Bachelors Degree, majoring in marketing. She is in her second year. Sreyny lives in the Prey Veng province of Cambodia. Her father is a teacher and her mother is a grocer. 

She is short of finances to pay her tuition fees from second to fourth year, therefore she would like to request a loan. With this loan, she will be able to earn her Bachelors Degree successfully. In the future, Sreyny is going to find a good job with a reasonable salary. This will help her to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay her tuition fees from second to fourth year.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy various items

loans.name: Tania Del Rosario

texts.es:
Tania tiene 40 años, es soltera, tiene 2 hijos el primer hijo tiene 18 años y la hija tiene 9 años viven en casa propia en el sector de Chaltura que pertenece a la ciudad de Antonio Ante por el sector las personas se dedican a la agricultura y también a las tradiciones de ofrecer platos típicos como son el cuy con papas por eso Chaltura es conocido como la ciudad de los cuyes.
Tania se dedica al comercio de productos Avon, yanbal y también realiza otra actividad como comercio de calzado. Desde hace 1 año atrás, por motivos personales y de la familia regreso desde España a Ecuador y desde  entonces tiene en su propia casa un local de ventas de productos y le va muy bien  ella sola está sacando adelante a sus hijos mediante el negocio tiene ingresos para solventar todo lo que viene en el mes, cuando ella vivía en España ha tenido días muy difíciles al estar sola sin la compañía de los suyos ella ha luchado para brindar lo mejor a sus hijos les ha dado el estudio universitario y también a la hija le está haciendo estudiar en la escuela que queda cerca del domicilio, ahora con el negocio que tiene tranquilamente ha venido solventando los gastos del hogar y con el capital que Fundación Alternativa va incrementar más productos para incrementar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Tania is 40 years old, single and has 2 children. The first child is 18 years old and the daughter is 9 years old. They live in their own home in the Chaltura sector which belongs to the city of Antonio Ante. People in this area work in agriculture and also sell traditional foods like cuy con papas (guinea pig with potatos). This is why Chaltura is known as the city of the guinea pigs.

Tania works selling products from Avon, Yanbal and also does other jobs like selling shoes. One year ago, for personal and family reasons she returned to Ecuador from Spain and since then she has had a store inside her home selling products. It is going very well for her. She alone is moving her children forward with the business. She has enough to cover everything that comes up during the month. When she was living in Spain she had very difficult days being alone without the company of her children. 

She has struggled to provide the best for her children. She has given them an education and is also having her daughter study at the school close to their home. Now with her business she has been calmly covering the household costs and with the capital from Fundación Alternativa she will increase her products to increase her earnings.

loans.use: to buy more products and increase her income that way.

loans.name: Koeun's Group

texts.en:
Koeun, a farmer living in Kampong Cham province, is 54 years old and the mother of five children. To earn her living, she grows rice on a one-hectare plot and works for others for a fee to earn more income. Koeun has been involved in this business for ages and earns about 44,400 KHR per day. 

This is Koeun's second loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid her past loan. She leads a group of two to take out this new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farmland. She hopes that she can get  a higher yield than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer to support her farmland.

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Cheung Prey district

loans.name: Herman's Group

texts.en:
Herman is 49 years old and has six children. As a group leader, he is representing his group that has been formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Herman has been farming with One Acre Fund for a few years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family and, although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Herman also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Herman's Group will be able to receive a total of five solar lights, as well as farming inputs, such as cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer, to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Gerald's Group

texts.en:
Gerald is 64 years old and has seven children. He has been a farmer for more than 40 years, and is always said to be a very trustworthy person. Even though Gerald is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Gerald started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2011, and decided to do so because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to spread the story of One Acre Fund farmers.

Gerald’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.25 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light. With this loan, the group will also receive a total of seven solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvest season.

loans.name: Khoeurn's Group

texts.en:
Khoeurn, a farmer living in the Sangke district of Battambang province, is 31 years old and a mother of four dependent children, one of whom is in school. She and her husband sell vegetables at the marker near her house, and also work as musicians as their main sources of income. Khoeurn also raises chickens and ducks to supplement her family income. 

This is her second loan with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loan. As the group leader of three members, Khoeurn will spend her loan portion on buying more vegetables to sell. She hopes that she can expand her current business to earn more income.

loans.use: to buy more vegetables to sell.

loans.name: Savai's Group

texts.en:
Residing in Kampong Thom province, Savai is 45 years old and a mother of one child. She grows rice as her main source of income. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 26,400 KHR per day. 

For Savai, this is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In her group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can update her family's living conditions so that they can be in good health.

loans.use: to build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Nicodemus's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Nicodemus who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by nine farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to four children, known by his community as a very trustworthy person.

Initially, Nicodemus joined One Acre Fund in 2008 because he wanted to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Since he joined the program, he says that his life has improved, especially because he has had more profits from each harvest. With the profits from the coming harvest season, Nicodemus plans to invest in a business.

Between the nine farmers in Nicodemus's Group, a total of 6.5 acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light. With this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve their harvest of maize.

loans.name: Naret's Group

texts.en:
A villager living in Kampong Thom province, Naret is 34 years old. She is a mother of two children, one of whom is in school and other one is too young. Nowadays, she grows rice as the single main source of income. 

This is Naret's fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She leads a group of six members to get new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to build a decent latrine. She hopes that she can improve her family healthy living.

loans.use: To build a decent latrine.

loans.name: Julia's Group

texts.en:
Julia, pictured above, has five children and is always described as a very friendly person, which is why she was selected to become the group leader of her group. Julia is representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, and is happy to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

Julia has been a farmer for more than 20 years and, in order to earn enough to send her children to school, she decided to join the One Acre Fund program this season. 

Her loan will not only include farming inputs, but also a solar light, which she is very happy to be getting as that means she will now reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With the profits from this coming season, Julia is planning to invest in a business.

A total of 6 acres will be planted by Julia's Group, and between them they will receive a total of 7 solar lights."

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 60 years old and is often described as a very friendly person. She has four children and is married. 

As a group leader, Jane is representing her group of eight farmers in Kakamega South District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Jane's desire to earn enough to send her children to school. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting to her as she will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. 

With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to invest in a business.

Jane and her group will receive a total of 1 solar light as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 4.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Asylkul

texts.ru: Асылкул 41 год, замужем, мать 4 детей. У нее среднее образование. В качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав в 2002 году с суммы 15,000 сом. Благодаря упорному труду, Асылкул на сегодняшний день имеет 10 овец. На 1,92 Га собственной и 2,0 Га арендованной земли, выращивает фасоль. В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 30,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 10 овец. Скот Асылкул будет содержать в сараях. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее развитие своего бизнеса.
texts.en:
Asylkul is 41 years old, married, and the mother of 4 children. She has a secondary education, and as the primary income for her family, she practices field and animal husbandry. She began doing this in 2002, with 15,000 som (KGS). Thanks to her hard work, Asylkul now has 10 sheep. She grows beans on 1.92 hectares of her own land and 2.0 hectares of rented land. 

In order to further develop her business, she approached Bai Tushum Bank CJSC for a loan of 30,000 som (KGS) to buy 10 sheep. Asylkul will house her livestock in barns. She plans to put the proceeds from her loan toward further expansion of her business.

loans.use: to buy 10 sheep for fattening and subsequent resale.

loans.name: Sopoeurng's Group

texts.en:
Sopoeurng, 36, lives with family members in a rural village of the Siem Reap province. She is a mother of three children, two of whom are in school and the other one is too young. 

To overcome her family’s hardship, she grows rice and raises pigs to earn extra income. This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). 

In a group of three members, she is the group leader. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy more piglets and pig feed. 

She hopes that she can get more income to update her family's condition better than before.

loans.use: To buy more piglets and pig feed.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Ngen

texts.en:
Ngen, 56, lives in the Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. She is a married mother with seven children, two of whom are dependent on her. The main source of her income is from growing rice. She also raises pigs to supplement her income. 

This is her fourth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loans. 

She will spend her entire loan to buy more piglets to bring up. 

She hopes that she can earn more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy more piglets to bring up

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Hean's Group

texts.en:
A mother of two dependent children living in Kratie province, Hean is 35 years old. To support her family’s living, she grows cassava as the single main source of income. 

This is Hean's first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She leads a group of two to get a new loan.

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy a solar panel. 

She hopes that she can upgrade her house with enough electric like other houses.

loans.use: To buy a solar panel.

loans.name: Lona Rose

texts.en:
Lona Rose is a married woman with two children. She is a very hard working entrepreneur. Lona Rose is 30 years old and both of her children are in school.

She has a frozen foods business in the Philippines. Lona Rose requested a PHP 50,000 loan amount through NWTF to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

Lona Rose has been in this business for five years. In the future, she would like to build and expand her business to secure the future of her family.

loans.use: to buy more stock of frozen foods to sell.

loans.name: Aracely Del Carmen

texts.es:
Aracely, vive con su familia compuesta por su madre y un hijo mayor de edad, toda su vida le ha gustado cocinar y con ayuda de su madre aprendió a elaborar pupusas, yuca frita, enchiladas, etc., de esa manera solventa algunos gastos familiares y ha podido salir adelante con su familia.
Invertirá en la reparación de un coche en el que elabora algunos antojitos y en remodelar la parte de la casa en que está ubicado su negocio, de esta forma trabajara con más comodidad y sus clientes recibirán un mejor servicio.
Aracely tiene como sueño comprar un terreno o casa propia para tener un patrimonio familiar.
texts.en: Aracely lives with her family made up of her mother and a child of legal age. All her life, she's liked to cook and with the help of her family, she learned to make pupusas, fried yuca, enchiladas, etc. In this manner, she covers some family expenses and she's been able to get ahead with her family. She will invest in the repair of a car in which she makes some snacks and in remodeling the part of the house where her business is located. In this manner, she will work with more comfort and her customers will receive a better service. Aracely has a dream of buying land or her own house to have a family inheritance.

loans.use: to invest in the repair of a car in which she makes snacks and remodel a part of the house where her business is located.

loans.name: Cristina Del Carmen

texts.es:
Cristina, esta mejorando su negocio con la inversión de créditos, tiene la oportunidad de brindar un mejor estilo de vida a su familia y a pagado buena parte del lote en donde está su vivienda.
Está solicitando un nuevo financiamiento para invertirlo en verduras, gallinas indias, conejos y otros animales de corral, seguirá fortaleciendo su negocio para continuar progresando.
texts.en:
Cristina is improving her business with the investment of loans. She has the opportunity to bring a better lifestyle to her family and she has paid for a good part of the lot where her home is.

She is applying for a new loan to invest it in vegetables, free-range chickens, rabbits and other farmyard animals; she will continue strengthening her business to continue progressing.

loans.use: to invest in vegetables, free-range chickens, rabbits and other farmyard animals; she will continue strengthening her business to continue progressing.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy shirts, dresses, pants and other garments. She will strengthen her business to have new customers.

loans.name: Timoteo Aparicio

texts.es:
Timoteo, con la buena inversión del crédito anterior se mantiene trabajando en la agricultura, sus cosechas son más abundantes con las que puede cubrir las necesidades familiares y de sus clientes, uno de sus hijos ya no vive con él y por el momento no ha tenido dificultades para trabajar.
Se decidió por un nuevo crédito para comprar insumos agrícolas y sembrando granos básicos, así mantendrá la continuidad de su negocio.
texts.en:
Timoteo, with the good investment of the previous loan, maintains himself working in agriculture. His harvests are more abundant than those that can cover the basic family needs and those of his customers. One of his children already doesn't live with him and, for the moment, he hasn't had difficulty working. 

He decided on a new loan to buy agricultural supplies and to plant basic grains in order to maintain the continuity of his business.

loans.use: to buy agricultural supplies and to plant basic grains in order to maintain the continuity of his business.

loans.name: Anjelina's Group

texts.en:
Anjelina is 56 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Anjelina has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to make more farmer friends in her community and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Anjelina also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to have an overall improved quality of life.

Obtaining this loan means that Anjelina's Group will be able to receive a total of 7 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Felisters's Group

texts.en:
Felisters is 42 years old and has six children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Felisters has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to earn enough to send her children to school and, although she described her last harvest as good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Felisters also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to have light during the night in order to feel safer.

Obtaining this loan means that Felisters's Group will be able to receive a total of 4 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 9.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Peter's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Peter, often described as an extremely reliable person. He is 29 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of six farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. He is married and has two children.

Peter is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to earn enough to send his children to school, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Peter says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has had more profits from each harvest, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. 

Peter will use the profits from this season to save more money for the future.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of six acres.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize

loans.name: Mohamed's Group

texts.en:
Mohamed is 50 years old and has five children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Mohamed has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and to acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as very good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Mohamed also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about as it will allow him to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Mohamed's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Carlos Alberto

texts.es:
Carlos, tiene 50 años, la esposa tiene 48 años , tiene 2 hijos que están dependiendo de ellos, viven en casa propia en el sector de Peguche que pertenece a la Ciudad de Otavalo el sector es de cultura Indígenas  las cuales se dedican a la elaboración de artesanías en lana y las ofrece en el mercado de Otavalo y también envían a diferentes países y son bien conocidos a nivel mundial por toda las artesanías que elaboran.
Carlos es una persona que desde años atrás ha venido elaborando artesanías en lana el elabora ponchos de lana y las ofrece en distintos mercado del país la actividad que realiza es su fuente de ingresos de allí utiliza para todo lo necesario que le llega en el mes les está dando educación a los hijos se preocupa para que no les falte nada, años atrás tuvo problemas familiares  hizo que  se descuidara del negocio pero aun así con la ayuda de la esposa pudieron seguir entre tantos problemas y hasta el día de hoy viene manejando muy bien el negocio, él tiene proyectado que van a incrementar el negocio para que sus hijos lo puedan administrar en los días venideros.
Con el crédito que solicito en Fundación Alternativa lo va invertir en la compra de materiales como lana, hilos para terminar unos ponchos que tiene de pedido.
texts.en:
Carlos is 50, his wife is 48, they have two children that are dependent on them. They live in their own house in the Peguche sector, which belongs to the city of Otavalo. The sector is of indigenous culture, who carry out their living making artisanal crafts in wool. They offer them in the Otavalo market and also send them to different countries; they're well known at the international level for all of the handicrafts that they make.

Carlos is a person who, many years ago, has come to make woolen artisanal crafts. He makes woolen ponchos and offers them in different markets of the country. The activity that he does is his source of income - from there, he utilizes it for everything necessary that arises in the month. They are giving education to the children; they see that they lack nothing. Years ago, they had family problems which caused them to neglect the business but even so, with the help of the wife, they were able to continue among so many problems and today they're managing the business very well. He has projected that they are going to increase the business so that their children can administer it in the coming days.

With the loan that he applied for from Fundación Alternativa, he's going to invest it in the purchase of materials like wool and thread to finish some ponchos that he has on order.

loans.use: to buy wool, threads and more materials for making ponchos.

loans.name: Kea's Group

texts.en:
A local resident living in Battambang province, Kea is 52 years old and a mother of six children. She earns income via rice cropping and working for others for a fee to supplement her income. 

This is her fifth cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. In the group, she is the group leader. 

She will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for the plowing fee. 

She hopes that she can get more income to improve her living condition better than before.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer, pesticide and pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Brigid's Group

texts.en:
Brigid is 63 years old and has 10 children. She has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Brigid is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 15 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Brigid started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2009, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. 

This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to be more active in her community.

Brigid’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9.25 acres of land.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Sut's Group

texts.en:
An old woman living in Battambang province, Sut is 59 years old and a mother of two children. She overcomes her family’s hardship via rice cropping and fishing. 

For Sut, this is her third cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has fully repaid back her past loans completely. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. 

As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee. 

She hopes that she can get more income to expand her farmland more than last year.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer and pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Darat

texts.en:
Darat is age 23; she is a married mother of one child who is too young to get into school. She is lives in a rural area located in the Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province. Growing rice and working for other farmers have been the sources of her family’s income for five years. She could earn around 58,000KHR each day. 

This is the first loan for Darat with VisionFund, Kiva’s partner. 

She decides to access this loan in order to buy farming supplies to support her current business. 

She hopes that she could earn more income and have the ability to send her child to school.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is a 56-year-old woman from Kampong Siem district of Kampong Cham province. For her living, she grows rice as her main source of income. She also works in a factory to supplement her income. 

This is her second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she fully repaid her past loan. She will spend her entire loan to buy a motorbike to transport fertilizer for her cash crops. She hopes that she can earn more income to improve her family’s living conditions.

loans.use: to buy a motorbike to transport fertilizer for her cash crops

location.town: Kampong Cham province, Kampong Siem district

loans.name: Unity Group

texts.en:
These members of Unity Group are beginning their sixth loan with ID Ghana, Kiva's partner. It is made up of four members who have businesses selling polythene bags, firewood, general goods and shoes. The loan that they are taking out will benefit each one of the small businesses of the group. 

Rita tells us that she joined ID Ghana barely five years ago. She currently has a business selling shoes. She started this business 12 years ago. After some time, she decided to open her business independently with a small amount of capital. The loan that she is taking out is to increase her working capital. She will purchase assorted shoes from the market to sell to customers. This type of work allows her to generate the resources that she needs to support her family. 

She is married and has three children, who are all of school age. When asked what she likes about ID Ghana, she responded that in addition to receiving the loan, she likes the health focus that the institution offers.

loans.use: To purchase assorted shoes from the market to sell to customers.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy sheets for the roof of her house

loans.name: Hasime

texts.en:
Hasime is a mother of two boys, living together with her husband and children in the southern part of Kosovo in a small village. Her husband earns a living by working as a forest guard, while she is involved in agriculture while staying home to care for their sons. 

At this time Hasime has one cow that produces milk and other dairy products for her family, and to sell. She has a lot of demands and lately has not been able to keep up with the needs of her clients, so she would like to request a loan to purchase another cow. 

This loan will help her to be able to meet her clients needs and demands, add additional income to her family, and help her to start to expand her farm.

She is very grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Shaip

texts.en:
Shaip is 46 years old, married, and a father of four children. He works hard in order to earn a living, works as a taxi driver in his area, and plants corn and wheat on his land. He is able to use the produce for his family and to sell for a profit locally. 

His wife stays home to care for their children and the home. They are a loving family and do their best to ensure that their children are given opportunities and have their needs taken care of. 

Shaip is requesting a loan in order to purchase a cow to start selling the milk and the dairy products. His wife will be able to care for the cow and tending to the milking while still being able to care for the children. 

In this way, they can increase their income even more and have additional savings on milk and dairy products of their own. He hopes he will have enough success from the cow that he will expand his farm even more. 

He is grateful for the opportunity and wants to thank all of the lenders.

loans.use: to purchase a cow to start selling the milk and the dairy products

loans.name: Bahari Group

texts.en:
Zainabu, who is in her late 50s, is married with five children; two are still in school and three are are grown-up. She has been selling fish for five years now.  She works from 08am to 9.30pm daily and is able to make a good monthly profit.  

This will be Zainabu's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania.  She used the previous loans to keep on increasing the fish stock, and has paid back all her loans successfully.  

She used the profit to pay school fees, loan repayment, and covered household expenses.  

She will use this loan to buy fish, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.  She dreams of increasing the stock of fish.

Zainabu will share this loan with her loan group, " Bahari", which has five members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to buy fish, cooking oil and charcoal for cooking.

loans.name: Beatrice's Group

texts.en:
Beatrice is 40 years old and has five children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Beatrice has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2010. This decision was largely a result of her desire to make more farmer friends in her community. Although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Beatrice also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Beatrice's Group will be able to receive a total of eight solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 6.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Ulises

texts.es: Ulises, tiene la edad  de  56 años, está casado,  vive con su esposa, cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra e frijol y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de frijol de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra principalmente en hacer curvas a nivel para evitar la erosión del suelo por la agua de lluvia y para la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la propiedad para el cultivo de granos básicos , y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los   mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha  que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja
texts.en: Ulises is 56 years old and married.  He lives with his wife, who is his greatest priority.  With his loan, he intends to purchase high quality bean seeds,  fertilizers and other products to apply to his bean plants in order to have good germination.  In addition, he will pay laborers to make terraces to avoid soil erosion due to rain water and for the application of products and assistance with the plantation once it has been developed, and in this way, ensure that the job is done well.  He plans to take advantage of the good weather and soil conditions of the property for cultivating staple foods, and also to put into practice the years of experience he has in growing staple foods.  Moreover, he wants to be able to buy better, higher quality products, so that his plantation will be well developed and healthy with an adequate harvest, and in the short term, will have an important production.  With the income from the harvest, he hopes to the wellbeing and education of his family and complete some family goals and continue investing more in his crops.  This is the first loan he has received from FUDECOSUR.  He hasn't had other loans from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has offered the loan with better facilities and a much lower interest rate.

loans.use: to plant beans.

loans.name: Chroeun

texts.en:
Chroeun lives in a rural area located in Prey Prorsorb district of Kratie province. She is 35 years old and a married mother of four children. Three of them are dependent children and two of them are in school. Growing rice, fishing and working for other farms are the sources of her family’s income. She earns around 99,000 KHR per day to support her family. 

Chroeun has borrowed loans from VisionFund for two cycles already and completely repaid the loans. The past loans have helped her to earn more income and have better living conditions. Now she wants to take this new loan in order to buy farming supplies to support her current business. She hopes that she could expand her current business to earn more income and keep sending her children to school until they get to university.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 51 years old and has seven children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very resourceful person. Even though Mary is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Mary started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because she wanted to make more farmer friends in her community. Since then, she has seen her life improve; especially in the sense that she has a larger farm support group than before. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills.

Mary’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres of land.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Jehovah Shamah Group

texts.en:
These members are part of the group called Jehovah Shamah and are into fresh and smoked fish. They live in traditional families in Chorko-Accra, Ghana. 

These members have joined the microfinance institution ID-Ghana in order to successfully carry out their trading activities. 

Mary N, a member of the group, sells smoked fish. In the photo, she is standing on the left. She plans to use her loan to buy more fish to smoke which she will then sell to customers. She is expecting to make a good profit. 

Thanks to this profit, she will be able to repay her loan and to contribute to her large family's daily expenses.

They will hold each other responsible for the repayment of this loan; they are in their fifth loan cycle.

loans.use: To buy more fish to smoke, which she will then sell to customers.

loans.name: Irene

texts.es:
La socia  Irene se sigue dedicando al negocio de tienda de abarrotes, la socia vende productos de primera necesidad como arroz, azucar, leche y galletas, la socia por medio de este pequeño negocio quiere salir adelante, la socia ya tiene varios años, el sueño de la socia es tener otra tienda de abarrotes. La socia solicita el crédito para comprar arroz, azucar,galletas, leche y galletas.

La socia está feliz por el préstamo y se compromete a cumplir con los pagos de su cuota.
texts.en:
Irene continues to manage a grocery store where she sells basic necessity products such as rice, sugar, milk, and cookies. Through this small business, she has been able to get ahead. Irene has been in business for several years. Her dream is to open another grocery store. She is requesting a loan in order to buy rice, sugar, cookies, and milk.

Irene is pleased with the loan and promises to complete her payments.

loans.use: to buy rice, sugar, cookies, and milk.

loans.name: Everlin's Group

texts.en:
Everlin's Group is formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by Everlin, who is the group leader pictured above. She is 31 years old and married with four children. Everlin has been a farmer for 15 years and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

Everlin isn’t new to One Acre Fund. She actually joined the program in 2013 and has since noticed that her life has changed, especially in the sense that she has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year, Everlin will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of her loan, but will also purchase a solar light. She is very excited about this addition since now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study.

Using this loan, Everlin's Group will purchase a total of four solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve their maize harvests.

loans.name: Justus's Group

texts.en:
Justus, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing his group, formed by six farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. He joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2009 and decided to represent his group because he wanted to gain respect from his community. He is married and has four children.

With a portion of this loan, Justus will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of his loan means that now he will be able to have light during the night in order to feel safer. Justus plans to use the profits he gains this year to save more money for the future.

In total Justus’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of three acres of land. They will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost-efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Hugo Armando

texts.es:
Hugo es agricultor desde que recuerda, casado con Bessy con quien ha procreado dos hermosos niños que aparecen en la foto junto a él. Hugo trabaja duro cada día para poder sacar adelante a estos pequeños se dedica a diferentes actividades de la agricultura como la producción de café y miel orgánicos y de comercio justo. Su mayor sueño es que sus hijos puedan tener una buena preparación académica. 
La producción de miel es una actividad novedosa en la región sin embargo Hugo tiene 9 años de experiencia en el área. Posee un apiario bastante amplio y está feliz por que ahora la comercialización es mucho más fácil gracias a COCAFCAL, cooperativa de la que es socio. Recibe de COCAFCAL asistencia técnica para su actividad de miel.
Hugo está solicitando un crédito para comprar 13 excluidores para sus colmenas, con el crédito Hugo espera poder aumentar la producción y agrandar su apiario con los enjambres de sus mismas colmenas.
texts.en:
Hugo has been a farmer for as long as he can remember. He is married to Bessy and they have two beautiful children who appear in the photo with him. Hugo works hard each day so that his children can get ahead. He works at various agricultural activities, such as producing organic coffee and honey and engaging in fair trade. His greatest wish is to see his children become well-prepared academically.

Honey production is a fairly recent industry in the region, but Hugo already has nine years of experience in this trade. He has a large apiary and is pleased that he is able to sell more easily thanks to COCAFCAL, a cooperative in which he is a member. Hugo receives technical assistance from COCAFCAL with his honey production.

He is requesting a loan in order to buy 13 excluders [barrier frames] for his beehives. With this loan, Hugo hopes to increase his production and expand his apiary with the existing swarms that inhabit his beehives.

loans.use: to buy 13 beehive excluders.

loans.name: Maria Regina

texts.es:
Maria es una mujer de 26 años, soltera, tiene un hijo varón de 4 años, y su negocio es la venta de pescado frito.
Ella es buen madre, sincera, comprensiva, constante, responsable y muy trabajadora. Su negocio lo realiza en la zona ‘Max Paredes’ un sitio popular, abarrotada de comercio; restaurantes, librerías, farmacias, tiendas de barrio y todo tipo de comercio se encuentran lado a lado, de clima frío y seco con una temperatura que varía durante el día entre 9-18 grados centígrados.
Maria es de tez morena, ojos pardos, cabello negro largo lo usa trenzado, baja estatura, su forma de vestir es tradicional (pollera, manta y sombrero), su lengua materna es el Aymará que habla en familia y habla español por cultura general y por el negocio que realiza. Su vida la comparte con su hijo que aún no se encuentra en edad escolar, viven en un cuarto propio construido de ladrillo y cemento con techo de calamina y que cuenta con energía eléctrica y agua potable y alcantarillado. Su negocio es la venta de pescado frito; en un puesto de venta fijo, actividad que realiza todos los días de la semana durante el día. El pescado frito que cocina son; ispi, trucha, pejerrey y otros de temporada; ella compra diariamente los pescados, los fríe y los vende por kilo para llevar o le aumenta arroz y lo sirve en un plato para comer en el mismo lugar. “mi mamá inicio este negocio, ella falleció y yo me quedé a cargo…” comenta. La ventaja de su negocio es que cuenta con una liste de clientes fijos y ventas diarias constantes, la desventaja es la competencia de la zona. Su sueño es abrir un restaurante de venta de pescado frito, ella desea ampliar su negocio mediante la compra de una congeladora para guardar pescado y este no se malogre. Esta es la 1 secuencia de préstamos con la institución en 2 años que se dedica a esta actividad independientemente.
Es por esos motivos que Maria solicita un préstamo para la compra de una congeladora para mantener el pescado fresco y abrir un restaurante.
texts.en:
Maria, 26, is single, has a male child of 4 years of age, and her business is the sale of fried fish.
 
She is a good mother, sincere, sympathetic, consistent, responsible, and hardworking. Her business is located in the 'Max Paredes', a popular site, crowded with trade; restaurants, bookstores, pharmacies, convenience stores, and all kinds of trade that are side by side. The climate is cold and dry, with a temperature that varies during the day between 9-18 degrees Celsius.

Maria has a dark complexion, brown eyes, long black braided hair, short stature, and traditional dress (skirt, blanket and hat).  Her mother tongue is Aymara. She speaks spanish with her family, in general, and for her business.

Her life is shared with her child, who is not yet of school age. They live in their own room built of brick and cement. It has a tin roof, electricity, water, and wastewater.

Her business is selling fried fish; in a fixed selling position, which she does every day of the week during the day. The fried fish that she cooks are; ispi, trout, mackerel, and other seasonal fish. She buys the fish daily. They are fried and sold by the kilo, or served with rice, on a plate for eating at the same place. 

"My mother started this business, she died and I was in charge..." she said. The advantage of her business is that it has a list of regular customers and constant daily sales. The disadvantage is the competition in the area. Her dream is to open a fried fish restaurant. She wants to expand her business by purchasing a freezer for storing fish so that it does not go bad.

This is her 1st loan sequence with the institution. For two years she has worked this business independently.
It is for these reasons that Maria is requesting a loan to buy a freezer to keep fish fresh and open a restaurant.

loans.use: for buying a freezer to keep fish fresh and open a restaurant.

loans.name: Maria Eduarda

texts.es:
María, está acompañada, vive con su pareja y sus tres hijos, los cuales son dependientes, como una forma de aportar en los gastos familiares se decidió por hacer la apertura de una venta de frutas y verduras en el mercado municipal de  su localidad, trabaja todos los días y no tiene un horario establecido.
Invertirá en tomates, chiles, cebollas, pipianes, plátanos, etc., surtirá su negocio con productos frescos y tendrá capital para abastecerlo cada vez que sea necesario, espera contar con la satisfacción de sus clientes y que las ventas aumenten.
Sus anhelos es cambiar el estilo de vida familiar y darle a sus hijos un mejor futuro.
texts.en:
María, lives with her partner and their three children, who are all minors. 

As a way to help with household costs she decided to open up a fruit and vegetable stand at the municipal market in her town. 

She works every day and does not have a regular schedule. 

She will invest in tomatoes, peppers, onions, squash, bananas etc. She will supply her business with fresh products and she will have capital to restock whenever necessary.
