She hopes her clients will be satisfied and that her sales increase. 

Her dreams are to improve her families lifestyle and give her children a better future.

loans.use: to invest in tomatoes, peppers, onions, squash, bananas etc. She will supply her business with fresh products and she will have capital to restock whenever necessary.

loans.name: Sorlimor Group

texts.en:
Harriet is a businesswoman who sells fresh fish. She has 28 years of experience with this business, which has allowed her to get ahead. The income she receives from her business contributes to her well-being. Her business is run through hawking and also at her home. Her main customers are people who live in her community.

She is asking for this loan in order to buy more fish to sell to her customers. She dreams of having more stock for her business, as well as having more customers. She is asking for the loan as a member of a group with Lucy and Dyllis, who sell grocery and rubber products. They need a total amount of 4,800 GHS to increase their businesses and they will hold each other responsible for repayment of the loan.

loans.use: To buy more fish to sell to customers.

loans.name: Fatima Guadalupe

texts.es:
Fátima, de 28 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltera y vive con sus abuelos, en este  momento nadie depende de ella económicamente.

Fátima, tiene un negocio de venta de hoja de guineo, desde hace 5 años trabaja en esta área, aprendió este trabajo con sus abuelos y ahora lo hace por sí sola; antes solo estudiaba y ayudaba en los oficios de su casa, su trabajo está a una cuadra de distancia.

El préstamo será invertido para comprar abono para las plantas de guineo, porque se acerca el tiempo de abonar y así mejorara su negocio.

Sus sueños son sembrar más guineo, para  sacar más hojas y venderlas, el préstamo le ayudara a mejorar la condición de las plantas y ampliar su negocio.
texts.en:
Fátima is 28 years old, studied through high school, is single, and lives with her grandparents. At this time, nobody depends on her financially.

Fátima has a business selling banana leaves. She has worked in this area for 5 years. She learned this work from her grandparents and now does it alone. Prior to that, she only studied and worked in the offices of her home. Her work is one block away from home.

This loan will be invested in the purchase of fertilizer for the banana plants, because soon it is time to fertilize and thus improve her business.

Her dreams are to plant more bananas in order to get more leaves and sell them. This loan will help improve the condition of her plants and expand her business.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer for banana plants.

loans.name: Israel

texts.es:
Israel, vive con su mamá y su esposa, ambas dependen económicamente de él, no cuenta con ayuda del extranjero, se dedica a la albañilería desde hace 3 años, trabaja todos los días y el oficio lo aprendió con la ayuda de un amigo.
Requiere de un crédito para comprar una pulidora, un taladro, cucharas, palas y otras herramientas que necesita para realizar sus actividades, espera contar con mejor equipo para brindar un servicio de calidad a sus clientes.
Israel sueña con cambiar el estilo de vida de su familia y cancelar sus deudas.
texts.en:
Israel lives with his mother and his wife.  They both depend on him economically.  He doesn't have any help from abroad.  He has been making a living in masonry for three years.  He works everyday and he learned the job with the help of a friend.
He requires a loan to buy a polisher, a drill, trowels, shovels. and other tools that he needs in order to carry our his work.  He hopes to count on better equipment in order to offer a quality service to his customers.
Israel dreams of changing the style of life of his family and canceling his debts.

loans.use: to buy a polisher, a drill, trowels, shovels, and other tools that he needs to carry on his work.

loans.name: Gulnaz

texts.ru: Гулназ 36 лет, замужем, имеет 2 детей. У Гулназ высшее образование, в качестве основного дохода для своей семьи занимается животноводством и полеводством, начав свой бизнес с 2002 года. Благодаря упорному труду Гулназ, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется 4 лошади. На 1,65 Га арендованной и 0,35 Га собственной земли она выращивает картофель и фасоль, также есть яблоневый сад. Бизнес Гулназ в месяц приносит около 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, она обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 125,000 сом (KGS) на увеличение поголовья скота за счет покупки овец. Доходы от кредита Гулназ планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины.
texts.en: Gulnaz is 36 years old, married, and she has two children.  She has a college degree and she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture since 2002.  These two activities constitute her family's main source of income.  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has four horses on her farm.  She also grows potatoes and beans on 1.65 hectares of leased land and 0.35 hectares of her own land.  In addition, she has an orchard with apple trees. Gulnaz makes about 8,000 som (KGS) from her business every month.  In order to further develop her business, she has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 125,000 som (KGS) to increase her livestock headcount through the purchase of sheep.  Gulnaz is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further increase her number of domestic animals.

loans.use: to purchase sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Maria De Los Angeles

texts.es:
María, cuenta con un negocio más fortalecido con la ayuda del préstamo anterior, pues tuvo los recursos económicos para aumentar los productos que ofrece en la tienda y además mejoro la ganadería, su familia tiene mejor alimentación y vestuario.
Necesita de un nuevo financiamiento para comprar bebidas, granos básicos, boquitas, dulces, etc., y concentrado para ganado, surtirá el inventario de la tienda y cuidara de sus animales, espera tener resultados positivos como en el crédito anterior.
texts.en:
Maria has a more fortified business with the help of the previous loan.  She had the economic resources to add to the products that she offers in the shop and in addition she improved the cattle raising.  Her family has better food and clothing.
She needs new financing to buy drinks, basic grains, snacks, candy, etc., and concentrated feed for the cattle.  She will stock her shop and care for her animals.  She hopes to have positive results as with the previous loan.

loans.use: to buy drinks, basic grains, snacks, candy, etc., and concentrated feed for cattle.  She will stock her shop and take care of her animals.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy new merchandise and have more sales to generate a better income.

loans.name: Mwanawani

texts.en:
Mwanawani is married and has one child who attends school. She owns a house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees.

For the past three years, she has owned a food stall business, where she sells to neighbours and town dwellers. She faces a major challenge of seasonality in her place of operation.

With the KES 50,000 she wants to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil. She dreams of expanding to a modern café in the business.

loans.use: to purchase a stock of goods like sugar, rice, maize and wheat flour, and cooking oil.

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna is 31 years old and she lives with her nice family (she has two minor boys) in the village Tsovagyugh of Gegharkunik. This woman is happy with her farming and agriculture in which she has been engaged since her very young age. 

With her husband, she established a cute and profitable farm which helps them to cover their everyday needs. On her farm she has cows, calves, sheep, and chickens. 

Some parts of her farm products, such as milk, cheese, butter, macun (national dairy-product), meat, and eggs, she sells right from her house. Some parts of their farm meat Anna’s husband takes to the city butchers who usually buy meat from their farm during the week. 

Her plot of land is rich with vegetables and fruits, but the main vegetable that she sells a lot is potatoes, which bring also not a small profit if it turns to be a good and healthy harvest. This loan Anna hopes to use for the purchase of potato seedlings, diesel fuel, and fodder for her farm cattle.

loans.use: to purchase potato seedlings, diesel fuel, and fodder for her farm cattle

loans.name: Kulsada

texts.ru: Кульсада, 48 лет, замужем, есть сын, ему 10 лет. У Кульсады высшее образование, работает швеей, также она с 2000 года в качестве дополнительного дохода для своей семьи, занимается животноводством и полеводством, стартовав с 5,000 сом (KGS). Благодаря упорному труду Кульсады, на данный момент в ее хозяйстве имеется 4 коровы, 15 овец. На участке мерою 1,80 ГА она выращивает картофель. Ежемесячный доход составляет примерно 8,000 сом (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего бизнеса, Кульсада обратилась в Банк «Бай –Тушум» за кредитом в сумме 70,000 сом (KGS) на покупку 2 телят и 20 овец. Доходы от кредита она планирует вложить в дальнейшее расширение бизнеса.
texts.en: Kulsada is 48 years old, married, and she has a 10-year-old son.  She has a college degree and works as a seamstress.  Additionally, since 2000, she has been involved in animal husbandry and agriculture, two activities which constitute an additional source of income for her family and which she started with an initial capital of 5,000 som (KGS).  Thanks to her very hard work, she currently has four cows and 15 sheep on her farm.  She also grows potatoes on 1.8 hectares of land.  She makes a monthly income of about 8,000 som (KGS).  In order to further grow her business, Kulsada has turned to Bai Tushum Bank CJSC and requested a loan of 70,000 som (KGS) to buy two calves and 20 sheep.  She is planning to use the earnings from her loan to further expand her business.

loans.use: to purchase 2 calves and 20 sheep for fattening and resale.

loans.name: Cristina Patricia

texts.es:
Cristina, de 20 años de edad, solo estudio hasta sexto grado, es madre soltera, tiene 2 hijos, vive con su mamá y el esposo de su madre.

Cristina, se dedica a la venta de semilla de marañón desde hace 3 años, también viaja a san salvador 2 veces por semana al mercado a comprar la semilla, en el negocio solo le ayuda su mamá, trabajan todos los días siempre y cuanto tengan producto.

Cristina, solicita el crédito para comprar semilla de marañón para procesarla y venderla.

El principal sueño de Cristina, es tener una casa de bloque, porque donde vive es de lámina.
texts.en:
Cristina, 20, only studied up to the sixth grade.  She is a single mother with two children.  She lives with her mother and her mother's husband.
Cristina has been making a living selling cashews for three years.  She also travels to San Salvador two times a week to the market to buy the nuts.  Only her mother helps her with her business.  They work every day when they have the product.
Cristina is requesting a loan to buy cashews to process and sell.
Cristina's principal dream is to have a cement block house because where she lives is made from corrugated tin.

loans.use: to buy cashews to process and sell.

loans.name: Maa Brahamanidei Shg-E Group

texts.en:
The responsible Maa Brahamanidei SHG-E is made up of two members. Both the members of Maa Brahamanidei SHG-E are women from the district of Koraput in Odisha, India. 

One of them is Damuni, who was selected as their featured borrower. Damuni is 43 years old and lives with her husband and children. She is engaged in the activity of selling goats and cow’s milk in her village and the nearby market. She purchases goat kids and rears them and when they grow up, she sells them to the butcher. 

She, along with Sebati, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR for purchasing more goat kids and a cow for getting a greater amount of milk to earn more profit. She has a very good relationship with her customers because she completes their orders on time. 

Damuni and Sebati want to give a better standard of life to their families and also want to save some money for their future. Damuni is grateful to Kiva for this help and support.

loans.use: To pay for purchasing goat kids and a cow.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase timber trees for saw milling

loans.name: Anna

texts.en:
Anna finds it very possible that her third deal with Kiva lenders will be again very profitable and useful. Anna, with her husband and two sons, lives in Ddmashen village of Gegharkunik region. 

Several cows, pigs and chickens are on her farm; they brings to her family very little income which hardly covers her family needs. Life improvement is just impossible in this case. As noted previously, she sells milk, cheese, meat and eggs from her farm. Her land’s harvest also is a great help for her family; she sells some, and some part of it also serves for her family's use. Anna greatly relies on the income of this season’s potato cultivation. 

So if she manages to receive this Kiva loan, this time she will use all of it on the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel.

loans.use: for the purchase of potato seedlings, fertilizer and diesel fuel

loans.name: Maa Brahamanidei Shg-A Group

texts.en:
Belama, the lady standing left in photo, is 35 years old and married. She has two children who are both in schooling. Her family lives in a village of the Koraput District in Odisha, India. She and her husband earn a living through working as farmers and cultivating rice and vegetables. 

Having been in this business for seven years, she is able to earn approximately 4,000 INR per month to meet her family’s needs. Belama is leading a group named Maa Brahamanidei SHG-A. Its two members are applying for the loan with Peoples' Forum. The members of Maa Brahamanidei SHG-A are engaged in different kinds of activities like agriculture, general store, dairy farm, wood business. 

Belama is going to use her portion to buy fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, and some irrigation tools for her farmland. With this loan, she hopes to raise more crops and sell them for a good price to make a better living to send her children to a good school.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers, seeds, pesticides, and some irrigation tools for her farmland.

loans.name: Omm Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Radha, standing left in the photo the featured borrower, hails from rural district Koraput, which is located in Odisha's southwest region. She runs a micro business of selling ready-made clothes through which she earns 7,000 INR a month but is able to save only 2,000 INR. 

In order to procure stock of clothes at reasonable rates, she travels to a lot of places to buy clothes. She lives with her husband and four children. She wants to add to her inventory and buy the latest stock of clothes that are in demand so that she can cater to the needs of her customers. This will increase her monthly income to a huge extent.

She has formed a group along with Rambha. Both of these women need capital to expand their business. Both of these women have already gone through a lot after the demise of their husbands. It's only through their business that they are able to sustain their families. 

These women are seeking a loan of 36,000 INR, which they will be repaying in a stipulated time frame of 24 months. Your loans will ensure a better standard of living for these women and will also help them in saving for emergencies.

loans.use: to add to her inventory and buy the latest stock of clothes

loans.name: Omm Shg-E Group

texts.en:
The group Omm SHG-E has two members who are from the same neighborhood. The lady standing left in the photo is Rukmini. She is the featured borrower of the group. 

Rukmini is a 55-year-old woman married to a farmer. The couple has two children who are in school. Rukmini lives with her children and, together with her husband, takes care of all the household expenses. In order to help with all the family expenses, 

Rukmini has been involved in doing paddy cultivation and selling it to distributors for the past 12 years. She supplies her rice to the rice dealers in the nearby market. 

In order to strengthen the business and respond to client demand, Rukmini, together with the group Omm Shg-E, is requesting a loan from Peoples Forum to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds and to cover operational costs. Their goal is to increase their business activity.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds

loans.name: Maa Brahamanidei Shg-B Group

texts.en:
Maa Brahamanidei SHG-B was formed with two members in 2014 in a small village in Odisha. They came together to help each other and solve the social issues among them, save money, and provide financial support to their families. They chose Dahana as the featurd borrower of their group. The lady standing left is Dahana. 

Dahana is a 35-year-old woman living with her husband and her three children. For seven years, Dahana's husband has been working as a farmer to support his small family. His income is not sufficient to support the family. So, Dahana is helping her husband by working with him and being involved in the mushroom cultivating business. She has four years of experience in this business. 

She has requested a loan to buy more mushroom seeds, straw and other raw materials, and to repair the space where her mushrooms are cultivated, so that she can add to her family’s income. Dahana says that by selling mushrooms, she can support her family, and she can send her children to a good school; through that, she can provide a better education to her children. The other member Tula is involved in fish selling.

loans.use: to purchase mushroom seeds, straw and other raw materials, and to repair the space where her mushrooms are cultivated.

loans.name: Kache

texts.en:
Kache is married with four school-going children. They live at their rental house that has electricity but no piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

She has operated a Khanga (women's wrap cloth) selling business, selling from home and door-to-door to her neighbours and passersby. She faces a major challenge of lack of capital to expand her business.

With the loan she is requesting, she wants to purchase bales of Khanga’s to sell. 

She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bales of Khanga’s to sell

loans.name: Maa Brahamanidei Shg-C Group

texts.en:
Maa Brahamanidei SHG-C consists of two women from a village in Odisha. They formed a group to help themselves to share their problems and to solve their problems among themselves. 

One of them is Ramail, who was selected as the featured borrower of the group. The lady standing right in the photo is Ramail. Ramail is 33 years old and is staying with her husband and her 5-year-old child. Her child is in school. She hopes to see her child as an officer in a company. 

She has three acres of land in her village and she is using her land to grow sugarcane. Her husband is supporting her in this activity. She has requested a loan of 36,000 INR, which will help her to purchase the required resources for sugarcane cultivation. 

She says a portion of the loan will help her to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.use: to purchase sugarcane plants, fertilizers, and insecticides, and to cover operational expenses like labor charges.

loans.name: Omm Shg-F Group

texts.en:
Susama is a 31-year-old lady living with her husband and three children. In the picture, the lady standing left is Susama. She owns and manages a dairy farm where she has a few cows and buffaloes. She sells ten liters of milk per day and earns 8,000 INR per month. Her monthly income is very small for a family of five persons as her children are in school. 

She wants to purchase two Jersey cows for her farm, as demand for cow's milk is high in her village. She also has a plan to repair the shed for her cattle and make it bigger. 

Susama, along with Rashmita, has requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion of the loan for purchasing two cows and renovating the shed. In the future, she wants to expand her farm and sell more milk products like yogurt, butter, etc. 

She has a dream to give a quality life to her family and save some money for her children's future. All the members of this group are engaged in the dairy business.

loans.use: to pay for purchasing two cows and renovating the cattle shed.

loans.name: Ruth Maria

texts.es:
Ruth es una mujer ecuatoriana de 73 años de edad, quien nación en la ciudad de Latacunga, perteneciente a la provincia de Cotopaxi,  una de las provincias mas reconocidas por su gente trabajadora del país Ecuador, ella actualmente es viuda,  su esposo  murió hace mas  de 29 años, sus hijos ya son todos profesionales y actualmente vive sola en su casa propia, la misma que esta ubicada en el centro de la ciudad, el obstáculo mas grande que ha tenido fue la trágica muerte de su esposo , ya que era él quien solventaba todos los gastos del hogar, y al morir Ruth  tuvo que salir adelante para sacar a sus hijos y darles una buena educación, pero al principio fue muy difícil ya que al ser sus hijos pequeños no le era fácil en tener que dejar encargados con algún familiar, 
Ruth  ha sido un apoyo incondicional para sus hijos y ha sido padre y madre para ellos, hoy en día Ruth  se dedica a la elaboración de pan y allullas, actividad que viene de generación en generación y además tiene su tienda , para los cual solicita un crédito el mismo que lo utilizara en el areglo del local y compra de harina y azúcar 
Ruth  y sus hijos quieren  extender un sincero agradecimiento y felicitación a Fundación Alternativa en Ecuador y a Kiva por hacer posible el crecimiento en su vida laboral y personal.
texts.en:
Ruth, 73, is an Ecuadorian woman who was born in the city of Latacunga which belongs to the province of Cotopaxi, one of the provinces most recognized in Ecuador for its hard-working people.  Nowadays she is a widow.  Her husband passed died more than 29 years ago.  Her children are already professionals and nowadays she lives alone in her own house which is located in the center of the city.  The greatest obstacle she has had was the tragic death of her husband since he was the one who covered all the household expenses and after his death Ruth had to forge ahead in order to bring up her children and give them a good education.  At first, it was very difficult since her children were young. It was not easy to leave them in the care of some family member.
Ruth has been an unconditional support to her children and has been mother and father to them.  Nowadays Ruth makes a living making bread and 
round loaves, work passed down from generation to generation, and in addition she has her shop.  For these, she is requesting a loan which she will use to fix the place up and buy flour and sugar.
Ruth and her children wish to extend their sincere gratitude and good wishes to the Fundacion Alternativa of Ecuador and Kiva for making the growth of their work and personal life possible.

loans.use: to fix the place up and buy flour and sugar.

loans.name: Maa Brahamanidei Shg-D Group

texts.en:
Nabina, a citizen from a rural village located in the Koraput district, is 31 years old and lives with her husband and her three children, all of whom are dependent on her. For the last four years, she has been engaged in the activity of farming a paddy and selling vegetables. 

Her husband supplements their income by working as a laborer. With the current business, she can earn about 5,000 INR per month, and that is very low for her monthly expenses. 

She, along with Jayanti from her village, formed a group, and she was selected as group's featured borrower. She and her group member have requested a loan of 36,000 INR. She will use her portion to purchase fertilizers, pesticides, seeds and to pay for a work force. 

She hopes to earn more income after getting the loan so she can improve her standard of living. She is thankful to Kiva and its lenders for this great support.

loans.use: To pay for fertilizers, pesticides, and seeds, and to pay work force fees.

loans.name: Maka

texts.en:
Maka is a 30-year-old woman from the village of Koki. She lives with her son, parents and brother. 

Maka requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for an agricultural business start-up, but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because of low income and the family’s poor living conditions. 

The only source of the income for the family is from private activity of her brother and father. They are hired workers in the village, and gets 300 Gel per month. According to Credo estimates, the family belongs to the vulnerable poor category. 

Maka has requested a Credo loan for the start-up of an agricultural business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start-up loan program envisages provision for business start-up and re-startup credits with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who do not have access to credit products, being regarded as “high risk borrowers” because of low income. 

Maka will place the purchased cow in an old cattle shed located in the family yard. She will start cheese production and she will sell it at the open market of the nearby town. 

As a result of the new business initiative, implemented with the assistance of Kiva, the income of the family will increase significantly. Maka will be able to create better living conditions for her son and family.

loans.use: To a purchase a milk cow to start an agribusiness

loans.name: Shareefan

texts.en:
Shareefan is 58 years old, a married woman who has been running a business of milk selling for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffaloes for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. 

She has two children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. 

She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR  to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales.  This will help her to earn a good amount of income, to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo to increase milk sales to earn good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions to her children.

loans.name: Kamo

texts.en:
Kamo has been a farmer for many years already in his native village of Lchashen, in Gegharkunik region. Now that his sons are already married and living abroad with their families, Kamo, along with his wife (who is unemployed), devotes all his days to farming and agriculture. His farm is rich, and here he has cows, calves, heifers, a lot of sheep and also a lot of chickens. He mentions that he takes care of his farm cattle very properly so that the whole village admires his farm’s cuteness and cleanness. He sells milk, meat (beef and mutton), cheese, poultry and eggs to his regular customers, right from his house. He enjoys every minute that he spends on his farm, always busy and always in a hurry in order to manage all the day's planned work.

Kamo decided to ask for this loan as he wants to buy one more cow and a lot of fodder for his farm cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more cow and a lot of fodder for his farm cattle

loans.name: Kousar

texts.en:
Kousar, age 42, is a married woman and a mother of five children. The income generated by her husband is insufficient to cover all household expenses, so she initiated her business of milk sales. She has been doing it for many years and has become famous for providing good quality milk in her locality.

With the support of Kashf Foundation, she has gradually improved her business; currently she has requested a loan of 55,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo, to increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo, so she can increase her sales and earn profits to provide her family with the basic necessities of life.

loans.name: Allam  Khatoon

texts.en: Allam Khatoon is a 50-year-old married woman and a mother of three children. In order to support her husband in taking care of the family she began the business of milk selling. She is known in her town for providing good quality milk. She owns buffaloes for milking. She is happily supporting her family with the income generated. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR to purchase another buffalo to inflate her sales, so she can generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.use: to purchase another buffalo to increase her sales, so she can generate more income to cover her daily expenses.

loans.name: Bridgid

texts.en:
Hello Kiva lenders, meet Bridgid. She sells crops from her small farm and also keeps dairy cows and chickens. From Kiva lenders, Bridgid is seeking a loan worth 20,000 KES to grow her horticulture business.

Horticultural produce and processed products from the developing world are becoming increasingly popular in international markets, evident by the steadily rising exports. While experience shows that horticulture offers good opportunities for poverty reduction, because it increases employment and generates income, the government takes little care to ensure that small and poor farmers are not excluded from the opportunities in this market sector.

It is against this backdrop that Juhudi has teamed up with Kiva to give Bridgid access to a loan that will aid her in growing her horticulture farm into a highly profitable business, increasing employment opportunities, and bringing about increasing commercialization of the rural sector. With your loan, Bridgid’s family will benefit from the growth and diversification of their family business. This will not only increase their income, but also reduce their income vulnerability.

loans.use: To grow her horticulture business

loans.name: Kalsoom

texts.en: Kalsoom is 45 years old, a widowed woman and a mother of two children. She has had a tailoring business for many years, to meet the expenses of her household and the educational needs of her children. She is a well-known tailor in her community. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her orders on time. Her regular customers are her neighbors and the local community. Kalsoom hopes to grow her business and dreams of providing a better standard of living to her family members.

loans.use: to purchase more reels of threads, packs of buttons, ribbons and laces for meeting her tailoring orders on time.

loans.name: Nunu

texts.en:
Nunu is a 52-year-old married woman, from the village of Chkhoria. She has seven family members and only one person has a stable job. They earn 300 GEL in monthly income. Other family members are involved in agribusiness. In particular Nunu is engaged in cattle and pig breeding, and in cultivating family-owned agricultural land, where she harvests nuts. She sells milk products and nuts locally, but the income is not enough to cover all family expenses and they live in poverty. 

Nunu requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for trading business start-up but without any success. Her loan request was rejected each time, because the creditors did not find the existing family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. Nunu requested a loan from Credo to start a trading business. Her loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative by Kiva and Credo. The start up loan program provides start up credit with soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who are regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income and do not have access to credit products. With the received credit, Nunu will purchase stock of honey temporarily and will sell it for increased prices.
 
The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: to start trading in honey at the local market.

loans.name: Sasun

texts.en:
This young man is 22 years old. He lives in his native village of Ddmashen in Gegharkunik region. Sasun has a vocational education. Now he works at a car-repair center and also finds time to take care of his farm, which is not a small one. Here he has cows, calves, heifers, sheep and chickens.

Sasun now lives with his father and school-aged brother. His mother is temporally abroad. So, with his brother, Sasun perfectly organizes the sale of farm products; from their farm they sell milk, meat (beef, pork, mutton and poultry), and eggs. Sasun’s father seasonally goes to the Russian Federation to work abroad, and while he is at home he is busy, along with his son, with land cultivation. Their land gives harvests of potatoes and fruits, such as apples, persimmons, nuts and figs. The main part of the harvest Sasun takes to sell at the city's wholesale market.

As he describes, there can be months during the year when he and his brother are left alone at home, and he perfectly manages to take care of his brother, their house, their farm and their land, doing everything properly and cutely.

Sasun asks for this loan of 250,000 Armenian drams as he wants to buy one more calf and also a lot of animal fodder for his farm's cattle.

loans.use: to buy one more calf and also a lot of animal fodder for his farm's cattle.

loans.name: Nasreen

texts.en: Nasreen is 39 years old and a married woman. She runs a business of milk selling with her husband. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Nasreen’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Nasreen has requested 50,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, so she can provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers, so she can provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy good second hand clothing to meet  customer demand.

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.es: Gerardo, tiene la edad  de 57  años, está casado,  vive con su esposa, cual es su mayor prioridad. Con su crédito pretende hacer la compra de fertilizantes y otros productos para aplicarle a la siembra e frijol y así que tenga una buena geminación, y semilla de frijol de buena calidad, además pagar mano de obra en la aplicación de los productos y asistencia de la plantación una vez que tenga desarrollo, y de esta manera asegurarse de realizar un buen trabajo. Lo que pretende es aprovechar las buenas condiciones de clima y suelo que cuenta la propiedad para el cultivo de granos básicos , y también poner en práctica la experiencia de varios años en el manejo de granos básicos. Además de poder comprar los   mejores productos y de mejor calidad para que su plantación tenga un buen desarrollo y sanidad al igual que una cosecha adecuada, y tener a corto plazo una producción importante. Con el ingreso de la cosecha  que espera obtener quiere utilizarla en el bienestar y estudio de su familia y cumplir con algunas metas familiares y seguir invirtiendo más en los cultivos. Es el primer  préstamo que  recibido de FUDECOSUR. Él no había tenido antes otros préstamos en bancos estatales, pero FUDECOSUR le ha brindado el préstamo con mayores facilidades y la tasa de intereses mucho más baja.
texts.en:
Gerardo, 57, is married, and lives with his wife, who is his highest priority. 

With his loan, he intends to purchase fertilizers, and other products for bean application. This is so that he will have a good germination, and good quality bean seeds. He will also pay for labor for product application, and planting assistance, once he has growth, and thus ensure that he does a good job. 

He aims to take advantage of good climate and soil conditions, the properties of the cultivation of basic grains. He also aims to put into practice the experience of several years in basic grain handling. Besides being able to buy the best products, and best quality for planting, he can have a good health and development, as well as an adequate harvest, to have a significant short-term production. 

He wants to use the arrival of the expected harvest for the welfare and education of his family, as well as to meet some family goals, and to continue to invest more in crops. It is the first loan that he has received from FUDECOSUR. He has not had any loans before from state banks, but FUDECOSUR has provided the loan with greater ease and much a lower rate of interest.

loans.use: to buy bean seedlings.

loans.name: Sadaf

texts.en:
Sadaf, 33, has been running a school for 2 years. She completed her own education in the first few years of running the school. Today, with her experience and education degree, Sadaf considers herself an expert. 

Sadaf's motivation has always been to provide quality education to the children in her community, so that they are equipped for success. Today, there are 90 students in her school, almost half of whom are girls. 

Sadaf wants to be able to expand her school to enroll more children, and requires a loan of PKR 75,000 to buy more chairs and desks for students.

loans.use: to buy more chairs and desks for students.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is a 47-year-old married woman who has been doing a business of animal purchase and sales with the help of her husband for many years. Her business has provided her family with a decent life. She is the mother of four children. She is very motivated to provide them a beautiful life with good education, food and clothing. She has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR. She intends to utilize this loan amount to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers. She is hopeful that her business will generate greater revenue in the future.

loans.use: to purchase more baby goats and calves to cater to more customers.

loans.name: Zubaida

texts.en: Zubaida is a 42-year-old married woman and has been running a school for 10 years. She started the school because she wanted to provide the children in her community with a sound education base so that they can have a chance at success in their futures. After years of struggle and hard work, she is proud to have over 150 students in her school. She wants to build her capacity both to expand her school and to improve the school environment. She requires a loan of PKR 110,000 to buy chairs and desks for students and to construct more rooms.

loans.use: to buy chairs and desks for students and to construct more rooms.

loans.name: Sahib

texts.en: Sahib is a 44-year-old married woman. She is running a business with her husband selling milk. She has buffaloes and cows for milk production. Her husband sells the milk in nearby areas. Sahib’s job is to look after the buffaloes and collect the milk from them. Together, both husband and wife are supporting their family. However they need to earn more income for their everyday expenditures. Therefore, Sahib has requested 40,000 PKR to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.use: to buy one more buffalo to cater to more customers to provide a better standard of living for her family members.

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 49 years old, married and has been running a business selling milk for many years with the help of her husband. She has buffalos for milking purposes. She sells the milk in her area. Her business is doing well enough to pay for her family’s expenses. She has three children. She is a dedicated mother and wants the best for her children. She has taken many loans from Kashf Foundation. Now she has requested a loan of 45,000 PKR to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.use: to purchase one more buffalo for increasing milk sales to earn a good amount of income to fulfill her dream of providing better living conditions for her children.

loans.name: Shahida

texts.en: Shahida is a happily married woman. Some years ago, she decided to support her family by starting a tailoring business at her home as her husband's income was barely enough to meet their day-to-day expenses. Shahida is popularly known in her area for her skill in stitching. However, due to a shortage of raw materials, she is facing difficulty in meeting daily expenses related to her business. Therefore, she has requested a loan of PKR 40,000. With the requested loan, she wants to purchase stitching material such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.use: to purchase stitching material, such as threads of different colors, laces, zippers, and cloth to stitch more dresses on time to generate a healthy income for her family.

loans.name: Catherine

texts.en:
Hello! Meet Catherine, 39 years of age, and a very hardworking, honest and dedicated farmer who lives in Chwele, a remote village in Bungoma. She is happily married and is blessed with seven adorable children. She has been practicing mixed farming for the last 20 years and has gained a great deal of experience. To afford a decent and comfortable life for her children, she has been selling milk, eggs, and a variety of food crops from her farmland. To make ends meet and make extra cash, she has been engaged in pig farming. The Bungoma area is very populated, and the demand for pork meat is very high. Like many farmers from her region, she finds pig farming very enjoyable. Her biggest challenge, however, is meeting the demand for pork meat, which is really high. 

She lacks funds to increase her pig farming, and she is seeking a loan of 20,000 KES (Kenyan shillings) to buy pigs. Being a woman seeking to access funds is very challenging, but through institutions such as Juhudi Kilimo via Kiva, she feels relieved knowing that her dream will be achieved and that she will be able to buy more pigs. As a result of the loan, she will sell more pork and pork products to her neighbors and to the local market, and this will translate to an increased profit margin and an improved income level. Being a visionary woman, she intends to accumulate more profits and expand her pig farming business to other markets; this will increase her income and improve her living conditions. The extra income she will get will be used to fully repay the loan, permanently change her living conditions, and secure the future of her school-going children.

loans.use: To buy more pigs

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase more spools of threads, ribbons, cloth, needles and scissors for stitching more dresses on time

loans.name: Margarit

texts.en:
Margarit and her beloved husband live in the village of Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region. She has been a farmer since her young age despite having a specialty of a pedagogue. She never worked in that field as she always helped her husband on their farm and today she is already engaged in the business rather seriously and skillfully. On her farm, Margarit has cows, calves, heifers, pigs and chickens. As she mentions, to each animal that she has on the farm she gives proper and good care so that her farm cattle are always clean and the products from them are also of high quality and very tasty. She sells milk, macun (a national dairy product), meat and eggs. She is also good at land cultivation with which her husband also helps her. Margarit sells potatoes to re-sellers from her house.

She hopes to receive this loan, as she wants to buy animal fodder for her farm cattle and she also must buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for her land cultivation activities.

loans.use: to buy animal fodder for her farm cattle and to buy potato seedlings and fertilizer for her land cultivation activities

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy various items

loans.name: Naseem

texts.en: Naseem is 46 years old, married and a mother of three children. She is working hard to fulfil their demands, including food, health, clothing, and education. She, along with her husband, has been doing agriculture for some years. They raise different vegetables and fruits and sell them in the local market. She has gradually improved her business with the support of Kashf Foundation. In order to purchase different types of seeds along with packs of insecticides and pesticides, Naseem has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR. This would help her to grow more crops, which ultimately help in generating more cash.

loans.use: to purchase different types of seeds plus packs of insecticides and pesticides

loans.name: Rashida

texts.en: Rashida is a 25-year-old lady.  She is very skilled in the art of hand embroidery and has been using this skill for many years to earn a living. She can make beautiful designs and patterns with her hands. Her skill is known throughout the town. She has requested a loan of 40,000 PKR. This loan will enable her to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet the orders of her customers on time to earn a good amount of profit.

loans.use: to purchase more beads, threads, and frames to meet her customers' orders on time to earn a good amount of profit.

loans.name: Samina

texts.en: Samina is 31 years old and married. The man shown in the photo is Samina’s husband who is a driver by profession and provides transportation services using his three-wheeled rickshaw. He has been driving a rickshaw for many years to meet the family's expenses, but now it requires proper maintenance to keep it in its functional routine. For this reason, Samina has applied for a loan of 40,000 PKR for her husband. He wants to buy new tires and some auto spare parts for his vehicle. This will help him drive more smoothly and provide better transport service to his passengers. Samina is hopeful that this loan will be a productive one for her husband and will bring positive changes to his business.

loans.use: to buy new tires and some auto spare parts.

loans.name: Kosimhon

texts.ru:
Косимхон мужчина 40 лет, женат, отец троих детей. После окончания девяти классов  Косимхон пошел работать на стройку, чтобы помогать своей семье. В возрасте 20 лет он женился и в то же время начал заниматься животноводством. Сейчас в его стаде 3 коровы и 5 баранов. Жена Косимхона доет коров и относит на рынок для продажи. Так же она приготавливает из молока курт и продает на базаре. Кроме всего этого Косимхон занимается земледелием. На своем участке земли он выращивает овощи и фрукты.
Сейчас Косимхон хочет расширить свой бизнес, он планирует оплодотворить землю и также купить двух молодых барашков. Но в данное время у него нет полной суммы денег. Поэтому он обратился в МДО Арванд за финансовой поддержкой. Косимхон надеется, что МДО Арванд откликнется на его просьбу о помощи и выделит нужную сумму. Благодарит за поддержку и доверие.
texts.en:
Kosimhon is a 40-year-old man, married, and the father of three children. After finishing the 10th grade, Kosimhon began working in construction to help his family. At the age of 20, he got married, and he also began to raise animals. He now has 3 cows and 5 sheep in his herd. Kosimhon's wife milks the cows and takes the milk to the market to sell. She also prepares dried, curdled milk and sells it at the bazaar. In addition to all this, Kosimhon also grows crops. On his plot of land he grows vegetables and fruit.

Now Kosimhon wants to grow his business, so he plans to fertilize his soil and buy two young lambs. However, he does not currently have enough money. Therefore, he has approached MDO Arvand for financial support. Kosimhon hopes that MDO Arvand will respond to his request for help and give him the necessary sum of money. He is thankful for the support and trust.

loans.use: to improve his soil and buy two lambs.

loans.name: Anzhela

texts.en:
Anzhela is 42 years old and she lives with her husband and two children in Kapan city in the Syunik region. Anzhela has a vocational education and she graduated from musical college. For several years, she worked at the library, but last year she finally started working in her specialty at the musical college. Anzhela’s husband is a taxi driver. They have a school-aged son and a daughter who works at the pharmacy now. Anzhela’s pretty daughter has a fiancé and they are going to be married.

Anzhela asks for this loan of 700.000 Armenian drams because she wants to organize her daughter’s wedding party nicely. She also wants to buy presents both for her beautiful daughter and her handsome fiancé.

loans.use: to organize her daughter’s wedding party nicely

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy ingredients for food preparations

loans.name: Lilit

texts.en:
Lilit from Vanadzor is happy to have one more chance to cooperate with Kiva lenders and Nor Horizon. She is a pedagogue with a higher education and she has many years of work experience in this sphere. Lilit still works at the school as a deputy director and she is also a schoolmaster for geography. She says that with the passing of years, she becomes more and more in love with her profession of pedagogy and her daily work with children. Lilit has two children and her husband works as a police officer.

This time, Lilit is asking for this loan in order to take part in training courses connected with the teaching methodology and buy a printer and some professional literature.  She hopes that her second loan with Kiva will be as profitable and pleasant as the first one.

loans.use: to buy a printer and some professional literature and pay for training courses connected with the teaching methodology

loans.name: Benard's Group

texts.en:
Benard is 64 years old and has five children. He has been a farmer for more than 30 years and is always said to be a very experienced farmer. Even though Benard is the only one featured in the above picture, he is actually representing his group of 16 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Benard started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2010, and decided to do so because he wanted to earn enough to feed his family. Since then, he has seen his life improve; especially in the sense that he has had more profits from each harvest ever since. This year he decided to represent his group because he wanted to help more farmers.

Benard’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of 9.75 acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of three solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Jolly School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Sulait. He is the Head Teacher of Jolly Primary School, a mixed school in the urban area of Kawempe in Kampala with 540 students. Jolly Primary School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining a UV water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with a 450 litre tank, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Jolly Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Sulait ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his student’s concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

loans.name: Amazing Grace Group

texts.en: These women are part of the Amazing Grace Group, which consists of two women who both live in the same neighborhood and perform different activities selling tea, bread and lining. The group meets once a week. Agartha is the featured borrower for the group, and she is in her fourth loan cycle. She is active in trading tea and bread and is requesting the loan to buy more Milo, milk, sugar and bread and prepare tea for her customers. She has over 12 years of experience, and with her income from this business, she will take care of her children. She wants to increase her stock in order to sell more in the neighborhood and to make more profit so she can put some money into savings. The group will need a total amount of GHS 3,300 to be able to serve the customers better.

loans.use: To buy more Milo, milk, sugar and bread and prepare tea for customers.

loans.name: Robert

texts.en:
Robert is 53 years old and he lives in Lchashen village in the Gegharkunik region. Here Robert lives with his wife who is unemployed. Robert has no higher education but once he learned the craft of turner, for many years he worked at different workshops as a turner. Now he works as a driver-distributor. Robert greatly needs this loan as he has very serious health problems and he hopes that Kiva lenders will be so kind as to help him somehow to lighten his health condition.

This loan Robert needs more than anybody else, since with it, he will be able to improve his health condition a little bit.

loans.use: to be able to improve his health condition a little bit

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students

loans.name: Gayane

texts.en: This woman is 55 years old and she lives with her husband and daughter in the village of Lchashen in the Gegharkunik region. Gayane has a higher education and she has a specialty as an engineer. For several years, she managed to work in her specialty, but now she works as a cleaner at a private company. She is also busy with farming and agriculture. Her husband helps her to take care of their farm cattle (cows, bulls and chickens). Land cultivation is also a source of income for this family. So from the farm, Gayane sells milk, meat, eggs, potatoes, beans and carrots. Gayane’s daughter is a student at the Yerevan State Pedagogical Institute and, in the future, she will become a journalist. She studies in the paid division. For their family who lives on the small salary of Gayane and on their cute farm income, to pay the tuition fee is a rather great and very important problem. This loan Gayane asks for, as she must pay her daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester.

loans.use: to pay her daughter’s tuition fee for the second semester

loans.name: Mary's Group

texts.en:
Mary is 50 years old and has seven children. She has been a farmer for 20 years and is always said to be a very hardworking individual. Even though Mary is the only one featured in the above picture, she is actually representing her group of 10 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.

Mary started working alongside One Acre Fund a few years ago, in 2008, and decided to do so because she wanted to earn enough to feed her family. Since then, she has seen her life improve, especially in the sense that she has been able to consistently feed her family ever since. This year she decided to represent her group because she wanted to help more farmers.

Mary’s Group will receive farming inputs to plant a total of six acres of land. Additionally, some of the farmers in the group will be purchasing a solar light so, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy condiments

loans.name: Uganda Martyr's School

texts.en:
Greetings from Uganda! This is Mathew. He is an administrator of Uganda Martyr's Junior School, a boys school in the Peri-Urban area of Namilyango in Mukono with 1,117 students. 
Uganda Martyr's Junior School has requested a loan to cover the cost of installing and maintaining 2 UV water filtration systems to provide clean drinking water for its students. The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long-term as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a UV water treatment system with two 750 litre tanks, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Uganda Martyr's Junior School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Mathew ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve his students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

St. Agnes Centre for Education will repay its loan from school fees, which it collects each term. Imelda ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases, as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for its students.

The school does not currently have access to consistent clean drinking water and therefore has to spend a considerable portion of its budget on firewood, which is used to boil water for the children. Installing a water filtration system will therefore save the school money in the long term, as the cost of firewood will be reduced. The loan will enable the school to purchase a Tulip Filtration water treatment system with five sets of 20-litre buckets, which will be big enough to store clean drinking water for the students every day. 

Jolly and Lowly Primary School will repay their loan from their school fees, which they collect each term. Jane ultimately hopes that having access to safe drinking water will improve her students' concentration and attendance by reducing the number of children that fall sick from water-borne diseases as well as increase the number of students coming to the school.

loans.use: To purchase a water filtration system to provide clean drinking water for the students.

texts.en:
