loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy smoked fish

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: buy smoked fish

loans.name: Ana

texts.pt:
Sra. Ana é mãe solteira de três filhos com idades compreendidas entre 9 a 21 anos de idade vivendo estes com seus pais, encontram se todos na escola. Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema a partir de conversa com amigos e colega de trabalho que é cliente. Este é o primeiro financiamento com a Hluvuku , o qual será usado na compra de uma geleira para uso doméstico. 
Sonha ter um pequeno negócio para que este possa ajuda lá a melhorar o seu rendimento financeiro e tem como maior desafio construir sua própria casa
texts.en:
Ana is a single mother with three children between the ages of 9 and 21. They live with their fathers and are all in school. She learned about Hluvuku-Adsema through a conversation with friends and a coworker who is a client. This is her first loan with Hluvuku, and she will use it to buy a refrigerator for her home.
She dreams of running a little business that will help her increase her income. Her biggest challenge is to build her own home.

loans.use: to buy a refrigerator for her home.

loans.name: Anabela

texts.pt:
A senhora Anabela é mae solteira, tem de 2 filhas do sexo feminino com idades de 1 a 14 anos e pra além das filhas tem na sua responsabilidade uma sobrinha que é orfa. A cliente trabalha num parque como cozinheira, é cliente da instituição a 4 anos. Com o crédito financiado a cliente pretende comprar material de construção nomeadamente: 20 ferros, 16 sacos de cimento e pagamento da mao de obra pra dar continuidade da sua obra. A nível profiossinal  sonha em mudar de profissão de cozinheira para Barlady porque gosta de ter contacto directo com as pessoas e seu salário também ira subir. 
O seu maior desafio é terminar sua obra, do momento vive na casa da empresa onde trabalha.
texts.en:
Anabela is a single mother with two daughters aged 1 and 14. In addition, she is a responsible for an orphaned niece. She works as a cook and has been with Hluvuku for four years. She will use this loan to buy construction materials—20 iron rods and 16 bags of cement—as well as pay for workers to continue the construction. Her professional dream is to change from cooking to bartending because she likes interacting with people and she would earn more money.
Her biggest challenge is to finish the construction project. She currently lives in a house owned by the company she works for.

loans.use: to buy construction materials—20 iron rods and 16 bags of cement—as well as pay for workers to continue the construction.

loans.name: Admiro

texts.pt: Sr. Admiro David é separado e pai de um filho ainda menor estando este a viver com sua es esposa na cidade de Maputo, encontra se na ponta de ouro a trabalhar e a viver com sua tia. Este e seu primeiro empréstimo na Hluvuku-Adsema. Conheceu a Hluvuku-Adsema a partir da sua tia que é cliente. Com o valor financiado pretende comprar  15 sacos de cimento, 7 chapas de zinco, 6 barrotes, 5 carinhas de pedra e outra parte do valor para pagar ao pedreiro. Tem como seus maiores sonhos trabalhar na empresa onde seu pai trabalha como motorista logístico e casar, e o seu maior desafio é construir sua casa.
texts.en: Admiro David is separated from his partner. They have one young son who lives with his mother in the city of Maputo. Admiro David lives in Ponta D'Ouro with his aunt and works there. This is his first loan from Hluvuku. He learned about Hluvuku-Adsema from his aunt, who is a client. He will use the loan to buy fifteen bags of cement, seven sheets of metal, six beams, and five loads of stone as well as use part of the loan to pay a bricklayer. His biggest dreams are to work at the company where his father works as a driver and to get married. His biggest challenge is to build his home.

loans.use: to buy fifteen bags of cement, seven sheets of metal, six beams, and five loads of stone as well as use part of the loan to pay a bricklayer.

loans.name: Hilcías Abdí

texts.es:
Hilcías es un muchacho de apenas 23 años de edad, está unido con su esposa con la que tiene un hijo de un año que se encuentra bajo el cuidado de la madre, esta linda familia vive en una comunidad de San Andrés Semetabaj.
Hilcías para obtener sus ingresos y mantener a su familia trabaja como músico en distintos lugares de su comunidad él tiene cuatro años de ejercer esta profesión, pero para poder mejorar sus ingresos trabaja también  como agricultor.
Hilcias  a pesar de todos sus esfuerzos por terminar la construcción de su casa no ha logrado terminar,  pero él es un hombre muy optimista que considera que un prestamo es la mejor solución, por tal motivo solicita ahora un préstamo que lo utilizara para comprar cemento, cal, arena y piedrín.
El gran anhelo de Hilcías es poder terminar la construcción de su casa este año y seguir prosperando con su familia.
texts.en:
Hilcías, a lad of just 23, is married to his wife and has a boy who is 1 year old (in his mother's care). This lovely family lives in a community in San Andrés Semetabaj. In order to earn an income and support his family, Hilcías works as a musician in different places in his community. He has 4 years experience of this profession, but to be able to increase his income he also works as a farmer.

In spite of all his efforts to complete the building on his house, he has not managed to finish it yet, but he is an optimistic man who believes that a loan is the best solution, which is why he is now asking for a loan which he will use to buy cement, lime, sand and gravel.

Hilcías' biggest wish is to finish building his house this year and to continue to prosper with his family.

loans.use: to buy construction materials such as cement, lime, sand and gravel.

loans.name: Esteban

texts.es:
Esteban, se dedica a la crianza de ganado y cerdos, es un oficio que ha desarrollado toda su vida y lo hace a tiempo completo con ayuda de su familia, vive con su esposa y ambos luchan para poder tener un estilo de vida más digno.
Está planeando sus actividades agrícolas por lo que necesita de un financiamiento para comprar insumos agrícolas con los que podrá cultivar maíz y tener una cosecha abundante, el resto lo utilizara para comprar concentrado para alimentar el ganado.
Tiene como objetivo comprar nuevas propiedades para ampliar sus cultivos y tener un mejor patrimonio.
texts.en:
Esteban raises cattle and pigs. It is a trade he has done his whole life and does it full time with his family's help. He lives with his wife and they both fight to have a better standard of living.   

He is planning his agricultural activities and he needs a loan to buy agricultural materials in order to grow corn and have an abundant harvest. He will use the rest to buy feed for the cattle. 

His goal is to buy new property to expand his crops and have better assets.

loans.use: to buy agricultural materials to grow corn and have an abundant harvest.

loans.name: Blanca Edith

texts.es:
Blanca, de 38 años de edad, estudio hasta sexto grado, está acompañada y su pareja trabaja de albañil y en estructuras metálicas, tienen tres hijos, 2 de ellos están en la escuela.

Blanca, se ha dedicado a los negocios desde pequeña, su madre la mandaba a vender tamales, pan y atol, también trabajó como empleada doméstica en un comedor hacia pupusas; pero desde hace un año tiene su propia pupusería, se dedico a este oficio, para ayudar a su pareja en los gastos del hogar, su negocio lo tiene en la casa de su mamá, a dos cuadras desde su casa y su horario es desde las 10:00 a.m. hasta las 6:00 p.m. sus dos hijas mayores le ayudan en la pupuseria.

El crédito será invertido para construir un cuarto en su casa, pues la familia creció y no caben, comprará ladrillos, cemento, arena, piedra, grava, polines y láminas.

Sus sueños son, llegar a tener una pupuseria grande y emplear más personas, además desea que sus hijas se preparen academicamente.
texts.en:
Blanca is 38 years old. She went to school up to the sixth grade. She is married and her spouse works as a bricklayer and in metallic structures. They have three children. Two of them are in school. 

Blanca has worked in businesses since she was little. Her mother would send her out to sell tamales, bread and atol (a corn beverage). She also worked as an employee in a restaurant making pupusas. For a year, she has had her own pupusa business. She started this work to help her spouse with the household expenses. She has her business in her mother's house, two blocks from her own house. Her schedule is from 10:00 a.m. till 6:00 p.m. Her two older daughters help her with the pupusa business.

The loan will be invested in building a room for her house. Her family has grown and they don't fit there anymore. She will buy bricks, cement, sand, stone, gravel, rods and sheeting. 

Her dream is to have a bigger pupusa business and employ more people. She also wants her daughters to have an education.

loans.use: to build a room in her house.

loans.name: Falta Tabla En Oc Cebada Y Trigo Group

texts.es:
El grupo Cebada y Trigo se conformó en una comunidad con raíces mazahuas, los habitantes se caracterizan por su amabilidad y las actividades principales son el lugar son el cultivo de maíz y la cría de animales. 

Roxana es una joven de 21 años que pertenece a este grupo y se dedica a criar borregos. El primer préstamo de VisionFund lo invirtió en algunos corderos. Ella está muy agradecida porque las ganancias de la actividad le ayudaron a pagar los gastos de su parto. "Realmente fueron de gran ayuda porque me atendí en una clínica mejor”.  

Ahora, Roxana ha detectado que no hay ninguna tienda de abarrotes cerca de su casa y quiere invertir su segundo préstamo en pan, huevo, leche, refrescos y jugos para iniciar un nuevo negocio que estará instalado en la casa de su mamá que es donde vive actualmente. El sueño de Roxana es tener su propia casa que tenga también un local para su tienda. 

Los demás integrantes del grupo son Regina, quien invertirá en becerros; Cristina, en pavos y Ma Rutilia, en borregos y abarrotes.

*La fotografía fue capturada debajo de las escaleras del quiosco en el centro del municipio donde vivien los integrantes. Roxana viste un chaleco color naranja*
texts.en:
The Cebada y Trigo group was formed in a community with Mazahua roots. The inhabitants are characterized by their friendliness and the primary work in the area isgrowing corn and raising animals.

Roxana is a 21-year-old young woman who belongs to this group and works raising sheep. She invested the first loan from VisionFund in some lambs. She is very grateful because the earnings from the work helped her to pay the expenses of giving birth. "They were really a great help because I went to a better clinic."

Now, Roxana has noticed that there is no grocery store near her house and she wants to invest the second loan in bread, eggs, milk, soft drinks and juice to start a new business which would be located in her mother's house which is where she currently lives. Roxana's dream is to have her own house that also has a space for her store. 

The other members of the group are Regina, who will invest in male calves, Christina in turkeys and Ma Rutilia in sheep and groceries.

*The photo was taken on the stairs of the kiosk in the center of the municipality where the members live. Roxana is wearing an orange vest.*

loans.use: to purchase bread, eggs, milk, soft drinks, juices, etc.

location.town: Purisima Concepcion Mayorazgo, San Felipe del Prog

loans.name: David

texts.en:
David is 52 years old and is supporting five members of his family. His wife is called Emily, she does horticultural farming. David has children and they are aged 26, 24, 22, 20 and 5 years.

He has been rearing dairy cows for thirty years and he gets a monthly income of thirty thousand shillings. This being his first loan with VFK, he intends to purchase dairy feeds to improve milk production in order to satisfy his customers.

From his profits he intends to pay school fees for his children and in future he dreams of diversifying his business and being able to support his family.

loans.use: to purchase animal feeds

loans.name: Shahen

texts.en:
Shahen is 34 years old and he lives alone in the village Geghamavan of Gegharkunik region. Shahen now is unemployed and he decided to develop his farm and hopes for more income from it. 

Now Shahen in his farm has cows, calves, a bull, a heifer, sheep, a piglet and a lot of chickens. His plot of land is not a very large one but on it he cultivates potatoes and cabbage and earns good profit from their sale, especially from potatoes which are greatly demanded among the re-sellers. Shahen also sells milk, meat and eggs. 

Shahen greatly hopes that in near future he will manage to meet a nice and clever girl who he will love and with whom he will establish lovely family with a lot of children. He hopes that with his wife he will develop his farm and make more profit of it. 

Still being alone now his main duty is properly to take care of his farm cattle. Now he needs this loan since his farm cattle lack of fodder and this loan will help him to buy a lot animal fodder for his cattle.

loans.use: to buy a lot of animal fodder.

loans.name: Avetik

texts.en:
In the village of Tsovazard in Gegharkunik region lives Avetik. He is married and he lives here with his wife and retired mother. Having no other occupation Avetik is always busy with his farming and over the years he has become a master in every work connected with it. 

Now with his lovely wife Avetik takes care of his farm cattle (cows, calves, sheep and a horse). Since he has no other work Avetik has enough time to organize his work about the farm and also to overcome each hardship in it skillfully and nearly without losses and waste. Avetik’s mother and wife make very tasty cheese and butter and he sells it with his farm’s milk and meat. 

Avetik greatly wants to make his farm richer with cattle, but still his farm cattle has a lack of fodder and with this loan amount he wants to buy fodder for them.

loans.use: to buy fodder for his cattle .

loans.name: Marine

texts.en:
Marine is 52 years old and she lives with her son and daughter in Vanadzor city of Lori region. Marine graduated from Vanadzor State Pedagogical Institute the faculty of Mathematics. Having a very high IQ allowed Marine to work in her profession from a young age and till today. 

Now she works at a school specialized in mathematics. Here she is a teacher of mathematics; she has 25 years of work and pedagogical experience.  In her flat, Marine also gives paid private mathematics courses to pupils who are going to sit entrance exams for higher educational institutions. 

Marine is asking for a loan of 600,000 Armenian drams as she wants to buy a computer and professional literature in order to be aware of all the innovations in the sphere of pedagogy and in teaching methodology as well.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature.

loans.name: Elsa María

texts.es:
Elsa tiene 37 años de edad, de estado civil casada, tiene 3 hijos de 14,12 y 8 años, vive con su esposo y sus hijos en la comunidad de Mantilla perteneciente al Cantón Guaranda, Provincia de Bolívar.
Se dedica al comercio de ganado. Solicita el crédito para comprar más ganado. La compra la realiza cada 8 días en Guaranda y la venta la realiza en Guanujo en la plaza cada semana. Sus metas son: salir adelante con su familia, e incrementar su negocio. Su desafío son las enfermedades de los animales. En su tiempo libre le gusta arreglar la casa y bailar.
texts.en:
Elsa is 37 years old, is married, and has three children, ages 14, 12, and 8. She lives with her husband and children in the community of Mantilla, which is part of Guaranda canton, in Bolívar province.

She works selling cattle. She asks for the loan to purchase more cattle. She makes her purchases every week in Guaranda and sells them in Guanujo in the plaza each week. Her goals are: to get ahead with her family and to grow her business. Her challenges are the animals' sicknesses. In her free time she likes to fix up the house and dance.

loans.use: to purchase cattle.

loans.name: Aram

texts.en:
Aram from Vanadzor city of Lori region, is 30 years old and he already has a lot of success and respect being quite intelligent and open-minded. He has higher pedagogical education and a specialty as a teacher of Armenian History. 

Aram works at a school as a deputy director. He gives private courses of Armenian History to the pupils, who are going to sit entrance examinations in the summer period. Aram is a very patient and clever person who manages his work both at the school and in his private course perfectly and with good results. He is married and he lives with his wife (she is also a pedagogue). 

He has asked for this loan of 500.000 Armenian drams as he wants to buy a computer and professional literature which he needs for his pedagogical activities.

loans.use: to buy a computer and professional literature for his pedagogical activities.

loans.name: Olga

texts.en:
Olga, who is a 30-year-old young woman, lives in Khoni district with her husband and little daughter. The only breadwinner in the family is her husband, who works as a baker and gets an insignificant income. Olga wants to do her bit for the family's welfare and to be involved in her own business. 

For this purpose, she requested a loan to local financial institutions several times but the creditors didn't find the family income to be sufficient to approve the loan. The start-up program, that is a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo, enabled her to get a loan of 350 USD to start a trading business. Olga plans to purchase clothing and home products at wholesale prices on the worldwide market and sell in her area at increased prices. 

The loan will greatly assist Olga, as she will be able to generate her own income, become financially independent and take care of her daughter. Olga and her family members rely on a good will of Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To start a business trading clothing.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 36 years old and has 5 children. She is a group leader and is representing her group formed by 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Jane has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of her desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds and, although she described her last harvest as very good, she believes she could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. Jane also decided to purchase a solar light as part of her loan, which she is very excited about, as it will allow her to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money.

Obtaining this loan means that Jane's Group will be able to receive a total of 9 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 7 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Betty's Group

texts.en:
Betty, pictured above, is a group leader and is representing her group, formed by 5 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. She joined One Acre Fund for the first time in 2011 and decided to represent her group because she wanted to gain leadership skills. She is married and has 3 children.

With a portion of this loan, Betty will not only purchase maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, but also a solar light. Receiving a solar light as part of her loan means that now she will be able to have light during dark hours for her children to be able to study. Betty plans to use the profits she gains this year to invest in a business.

In total Betty’s Group will use the inputs received from this loan to plant a total of 3 acres of land. They will also receive a total of 2 solar lights.

loans.use: to buy cost efficient maize seeds and fertilizer for the coming harvesting season, as well as a solar light.

loans.name: Armen

texts.en:
In 2011, Armen asked Kiva loan for his manufacturing business. At that time, he was greatly supported, for which he is thankful. Now he hopes that he can have one more deal with Kiva and Nor Horizon. 

Armen is still in his business of producing work-wear, shoes and work gloves. He has worked in his profession for many years and in many different places. He graduated from Erevan Polytechnic Institute as an engineer-mechanic, but since 1998 and till today he manages his business in his own space. 

As previously Armen delivers his goods to enterprises in Kapan and Kadjaran cities. Armen is married and he has a son and a daughter. His wife is unemployed. 

Armen is asking for this loan as again he needs to buy a lot of raw material (fabric, thread and buttons) in order to fulfill his orders which are rather big and for which he has a deadline.

loans.use: to buy a lot of raw material including fabric, thread and buttons.

loans.name: Jane's Group

texts.en:
Jane is 35 years old and is often described as a very hardworking individual. She has 4 children and is married. As a group leader, Jane is representing her group of 6 farmers in Kakamega South District in Kenya, and is very excited to be working with One Acre Fund for the first time this year.

The decision to join One Acre Fund was largely a result of Jane's desire to get the best quality fertilizer and hybrid seeds. Apart from receiving farming inputs, she is also purchasing a solar light as part of her loan, which is very exciting for her as she will now be able to have light during the night and have somewhere to charge her phone. With the profits that she gains from this year’s harvest, she plans to save more money for the future.

Jane and her group will receive a total of 3 solar lights as well as input loans of maize and fertilizer to plant a total of 2.25 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John's Group is formed by 10 farmers in Kakamega South District and is being represented by John, who is the group leader pictured above. He is 62 years old, is married and has four children. John has been a farmer for more than 20 years, and is often referred to as a very hardworking individual.

John isn’t new to One Acre Fund; he actually joined the program in 2012 and has since noticed his life has changed, especially in the sense that he has been able to consistently feed his family ever since. 

This year, John will not only get fertilizer and maize seeds as part of his loan, but will also purchase a solar light. He is very excited about this addition since now he will be able to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Using this loan, John's Group will purchase a total of 4 solar lights and use the farming inputs received to plant a total of 5.5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light, as well as hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Genadi

texts.en:
Genadi is a 68-year-old man from the village of Mukhuri, Chkhorotsku district. He has seven family members and they earn a living with the help  agricultural activities. Specifically, Genadi engages in cattle and pig breeding, in beekeeping, and in cultivating a family-owned yard, where nuts are grown. He sells milk products, nuts and honey locally. However, the income isn't enough for this large family to meet all daily costs. 

Genadi requested a loan from local financial institutions several times for starting an additional business startup, but without any success. 

His loan request was approved in the framework of a joint initiative between Kiva and Credo. The start up loan program provides start up credit soft conditions for the country's rural poor, who regarded as "high risk borrowers" because of their low income, do not have access to credit products. 

With the received credit, Genadi will purchase a tractor and start cultivation. He will get private orders and generate additional income for his family's welfare. 

The new business initiative, financed with the Kiva startup loan, will significantly increase the family's income and the family members will be able to improve their living conditions.

loans.use: To buy a tractor and start cultivation

loans.name: Mtaji Wa Masikini Group

texts.en:
Victor, who is in his late 20s, is married and has two children; one is at school and the other one is still small.  

He has been buying meat from the slaughtering place and distributing it to butcher shops. He has been in this business for five years now.  He works from midnight to 5 a.m. daily and is able to make a  a good monthly profit.

This will be Victor's eighth loan from Tujijenge Tanzania. He used the previous loans to increase the meat stock and has paid back all his loans successfully. He used the profit to pay school fees, repay loans, buy a shamba and cover household expenses. 

He is happy with the loan and appreciates Kiva for its support. He will use this loan to distribute meat to more butcher shops and meet his customers' demands. He dreams of owning a big business.

Victor will share this loan with his loan group " Mtaji wa Masikini" which has two members who will hold each other accountable for paying back the loan.

loans.use: to distribute meat to more butcher shops and meet his customers' demands.

loans.name: Benson's Group

texts.en:
Benson is 53 years old and has six children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 13 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

Benson has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2011. This decision was largely a result of his desire to earn enough to feed his family. Though he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. 

Benson also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that Benson's Group will be able to receive a total of 12 solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Jackton's Group

texts.en:
Jackton is a 55-year-old proud father of nine children. He is a group leader, often described as a very hardworking individual, and is representing his group of six farmers in Kakamega South District. Since joining One Acre Fund in 2012, Jackton has noticed that he has been able to consistently feed his family.

Jackton described his harvest as good last year, but believes he can have a better one this year by continuing to work with One Acre Fund. He is very excited to also be purchasing a solar light, apart from fertilizer and maize, because he will now be able to reduce the consumption of paraffin fuel and therefore save more money. With the profits from this season’s harvest, he plans to send his children to school.

With this loan, Jackton’s Group will be able to plant a total of 2.5 acres of land and purchase a total of 5 solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Christopher's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Christopher, often described as an extremely hardworking individual. He is 35 years old and, as a group leader, he is representing his group of 12 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya.  He is married and has four children.

Christopher is returning this season to work with One Acre Fund again as this means that he is able to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods, which is why he decided to join in the first place. Christopher says that he is happy to have made that decision because, since he first joined in 2013, he has a larger farm group support, which has improved his day-to-day life significantly. Christopher will use the profits from this season to repair his home.

The group will use this loan to purchase seeds and fertilizer to plant a total of 6.5 acres. Given that some members of the group will also be purchasing a solar light, with this loan, the group will also receive a total of two solar lights.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer for the cultivation of maize.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase ingredients for food production

loans.name: Dato

texts.en:
Dato is a 22-year-old man from Kobuleti district. He lives with his parents and his father is the only employed person in the family. He works as a private artisan and gets 300 GEL approximately. The income is really hardly enough to meet even the basic needs of the family. Because of his secondary education and the high unemployment rate in the region, Dato was unable to start any stable job. 

He has a great desire to be involved in his own business and do his bit to help with the family's welfare, but all the financial institutions rejected his loan requests because of his unstable financial condition and lack of experience.  

After several unsuccessful attempts, Dato applied for the credit to MFO Credo. His request was approved in the framework of the Start Up program, which is joint initiative with Kiva, permitting the rural poor to start or re-start businesses. Dato plans to use the requested amount for purchasing all the needed equipment and opening a car-wash service.
 
He will serve the clients himself and achieve financial stability. The Start Up credit will be a great support for the family, as their income will be significantly increased thanks to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To buy equipment and open a car-wash service.

loans.name: Patrick's Group

texts.en:
Pictured above is Patrick, who, as a group leader, is representing his group formed by seven farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. He is married and is a father to four children. He is known by his community as a very reliable person.

Initially, Patrick joined One Acre Fund in 2011 because he wanted to earn enough to send his children to school. Since he joined the program he says that his life has improved, especially because he has been able to consistently feed his family. With the profits from the coming harvesting season, Patrick plans to rent more land to cultivate in.

Among the seven farmers in Patrick's Group, a total of four acres of land will be planted using the maize seeds and fertilizer received with the loan.

loans.use: to purchase hybrid seeds and fertilizer to improve harvests of maize.

loans.name: Perfect Divine Love Group

texts.en:
Deborah, 45, hails from Twifo Lower Denkyira in the Central Region of Ghana. She is the group representative of the Perfect Divine Love group. She is married with six children and all of them are in school. The eldest child is 22 years of age and the youngest child is 4 years.  Deborah operates a licensed chemical store. She has been in business for the past 25 years. She sells both local and foreign medicines for the treatment of different kinds of illness. Her medicines are largely patronized by people within her community and its surrounding villages. Deborah takes utmost pride in her family, who mean everything to her. She is a visionary and practical business woman, and plans to be a major distributor of both local and foreign medicines in the next 5 years. Deborah is very optimistic about the future prospects of her business by meeting the health needs of her people in her region and beyond.

Deborah is hopeful that the income she will earn in future from her chemical store investment will enable her to uplift the living standards of her family by supporting her husband to take their children to schools with better learning facilities. Deborah needs additional working capital to add to her existing capital to enable her buy varieties of medicines to resell to her customers so as to meet her business aspirations. Deborah is most grateful to all her micro-lenders for their generous support.

loans.use: to buy varieties of medicine to resell.

loans.name: Arise For God Group

texts.en:
Darbah, 46, comes from Twifo Praso in the Central Region of Ghana. Darbah is the leader and group representative of Arise for God group. She is married with 4 children. The ages of the children are 24, 22, 20 and 12. All the children are in school. Darbah has been a petty trader for about 18 years now. She has 1 employee she works with. The major products which she sells are rubber and plastic products. She also  gives out plastic chairs on a rental basis as another source of income. Darbah has plans to expand and have a grown business in the next 5 years by buying on wholesale and retailing to other traders.

Darbah's main challenge now is how to maximize profit by buying in bulk to reduce her selling price to increase sales and profit. She needs additional working capital to take advantage of the lower prices available by buying in bulk. Darbah needs microloan support to buy her goods in bulk to lower her cost and increase her income. She plans to build up her capital from the income from her business for future expansion and support her husband to take care of their children in school. Darbah thanks her Kiva lenders for their kind support in building up her business.

loans.use: to buy rubber and plastic products to resell to individuals

loans.name: Elena

texts.en:
Elena, who is a 32-year-old single woman, lives in the capital of Georgia, in Tbilisi. To make a source of income for existence, Elene started work as a cleaner at the public service, where she gets 400 GEL monthly. The job is very hard for Elena and also the income isn't enough to meet all daily costs. So she started to make other sourced of income and seek credit from local financial institutions. However, she lacks the access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting business, as they require business experience and enough family income. 

The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled Elena to get a loan of 1,000 USD and start a trading business. She will purchase special equipment for soft drinks on tap and will sell these drinks from a local market. She thinks that the business will be profitable, as it is in a great location and the only business of this kind in the area. 

With support of the Start Up program, Elena will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: To start selling special soft drinks from the counter.

loans.name: George

texts.en:
George is 62 years old. He comes from Cape Coast in Cape Coast Metropolitan Assembly in the Central Region of Ghana. George is a married man with two children. The ages of the children are 25 and 30 years. His children are living on their own. 

George is a photographer and has been in the business for the past eight years. According to George, photography has been a side job he used to support his two children along the years through their university educations and has become his full self-employed job after his retirement from civil service.  

Despite the slight fall in general demand for photographic work due to technological changes, George has been very successful because of his  innovations. George has added printing of funeral posters, advertising posters and sale of photography and phone accessories, which are in high demand within his business community. 

George reinvested the profit from his business to build a small apartment for rent as another source of income. According to George, the business has improved very well and he is wishing that it will be much better in the years ahead with the innovative ideas he is bringing on board. 

George's major challenge now is persistent and frequent power cuts, which are affecting production and his ability to serve his customers on time. George is seeking financial support to buy a back-up power supply for his digital photo and image printing machines to be able to meet job schedules of his customers. George thanks all his micro lenders for their generosity.

loans.use: To buy a back-up power supply for his digital photo and image printing machines.

loans.name: John's Group

texts.en:
John is 54 years old and has seven children. He is a group leader and is representing his group formed by 11 farmers in Kakamega South District, Kenya. 

John has been farming with One Acre Fund for years now, having joined the program for the first time in 2009. This decision was largely a result of his desire to have access to quality training and acquire new farming methods. Although he described his last harvest as good, he believes he could have a better one this year by continuing to work alongside One Acre Fund. John also decided to purchase a solar light as part of his loan, which he is very excited about, as it will allow him to have light during dark hours for his children to be able to study.

Obtaining this loan means that John's Group will be able to receive a total of six solar lights, as well as farming inputs to plant a total of 5.75 acres.

loans.use: to purchase a solar light and gain access to cost-efficient hybrid seeds and fertilizer for maize cultivation.

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is 64 years old. She is a widow with two children. The ages of her children are 35 and 40 years and they are independent of Margaret. She comes from Cape Coast in the Cape Coast Metropolitan Assembly of the Central Region of Ghana. 

She sells dressmaking accessories to dressmakers to support herself. Margaret has been in this kind of business for over eight years. She is well known for her low-price strategy to make more sales and profit, hence her shop is highly patronised by her customers. She hopes to open another store in the next five years to add up to her current store. Margaret plans to reinvest the profit from her trade gradually for the future expansion of her business since the children are of age.

Margaret needs financial assistance to be able to buy enough dressmaking accessories on a large scale to take advantage of the discount that will enable her to serve her customers better and make the level of income that will help her meet her future business expansion objectives. Margaret thanks all her micro lenders for their kindness.

loans.use: To buy dressmaking accessories and sell them at retail to dressmakers.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: purchase rice

loans.name: Zalina

texts.en:
Zalina is a 29-year-old hardworking woman who lives in the small village of Saruso. She has a daughter and a son and takes care with them on her own. 

Zalina works as a private hired worker and generates 250 GEL monthly. The family lives in poverty as it has no source of significant income to cover even basic needs. 

Zalina lacks access to capital markets and financial institutions to obtain credit for starting a business, as they require stable income and business experience. The Start Up program created by Kiva and Credo enabled her to get a loan of 2,000 GEL and start a trading business. She will purchase a stock of clothing at wholesale prices and will resell it in her community at increased prices. 

After the business is started, the family will have a stable income that will enable them to cover everyday costs as well as expand the business in future.  With support of the Start Up program, Zalina will get an opportunity to be involved in her own business and tackle her financial difficulties.

loans.use: To start a trading business with clothing and make her own business.

loans.name: Sary's Group

texts.en:
Sary is 40 years old, married, and has three children, two of whom attend school. She is from a rural area of Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. The main source of her family’s income is from feeding pigs to sell, which she has been doing for 20 years. She also works for other farms to earn additional income. Sary earns around 31,800 KHR per day and saves around 10,000 KHR daily for her needs.
 
Sary's group, which consists of two members, requested their fourth loan from VisionFund. The previous loan helped Sary's family to have a better standard of living and pay school fees for her children to school. She will use her portion of the loan to buy more pigs and food for the pigs. She hopes that she can earn enough money to create a new business.

loans.use: to purchase more pigs and food for the pigs

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Sona

texts.en:
Sona is a 22-year-old single student who is from the Prey Veng province in Cambodia. He is pursuing a bachelor’s degree, majoring in finance and banking in the second year at university in the city. His parents are rice farmers and practice animal husbandry. 

Due to a shortages of finances to pay his tuition fees from the second to fourth year, Sona has decided to secure a loan. With the loan, he will graduate successfully with skills for his future job. After graduation, he wants to have a good job with a reasonable salary, therefore he will be able to build a proper house.

loans.use: to pay his tuition fees from the second to fourth year

loans.name: San Antonio De La Cienega Group

texts.es:
En una comunidad mazahua del Estado de México los habitantes se encuentran preparando la tierra para iniciar a sembrar maíz en el mes de abril, aunque últimamente no ha dejado de llover y los campesinos esperan que el clima mejore para que las semillas puedan germinar sin complicaciones debido la humedad. En este lugar se unieron cuatro personas de campo para solicitar un préstamo y se identifican con el nombre de “San Antonio de la Ciénaga”. 
Fernando es uno de los integrantes, es un joven soltero que se dedica a la cría y venta de bueyes. Inició la actividad por sugerencia de uno de sus vecinos quien se dedicaba a cuidar el mismo tipo de animales. Así, Fernando decidió darle una oportunidad a la actividad y afortunadamente sus ganancias fueron mejor de lo que esperaba. Ahora, Fernando no sólo se dedica a trabajar el campo como la mayoría de los habitantes sino que también puede tener un poco de dinero extra para sus papás. 
Fernando está muy agradecido con Kiva y VisionFund pues al iniciar su actividad, sólo podía comprar 2 bueyes  y un poco de alimento. Con la ayuda de los préstamos puede tener hasta cinco animales que puede comprar con mayor facilidad. Su préstamo lo invertirá precisamente en la compra de más bueyes. 
El mayor sueño de Fernando es ahorrar una buena cantidad de dinero para poder construir su propia casa para el momento en que tenga su propia familia. 
Los demás integrantes del grupo son María Isabel, María Lorena y Soledad quienes también invertirán en bueyes y vacas.
*La fotografía fue tomada en el jardín del municipio donde viven los integrantes.
texts.en:
In a Mazahua community in Mexico, the residents are preparing the land to begin planting corn in April, although lately it hasn't stopped raining and the farmers hope that the weather improves so that the seeds can germinate without complications from humidity.  In this area, four people came together to request a loan and they are known by the name "San Antonio de la Ciénaga."

Fernando is one of the members.  He is a young single man who makes a living by raising and selling oxen.  He began in the business at the urging of one of his neighbors who was involved i raising the same animal.  In this way, Fernando decided to give it a chance, and fortunately his earnings were better thane expected.  Now he isn't only dedicated to working the fields like the majority of the inhabitants, but he can also give a little extra money to his parents.  

Fernando is very grateful to Kiva an VisionFund, as when he began his business he could only buy 2 oxen and a little bit of feed.  With the help of the loans
he can have up to five animals and can buy them with greater ease.  He will invest his loan in buying more oxen.  
 
Fernando's dream is to save a great amount of money to be able to build his own house for the moment when he has his own family.   The other members of the group are María Isabel, María Lorena and Soledad who are also investing in oxen and cattle.  

*The photograph was taken in the garden of the municipality where the members live.

loans.use: to buy pigs to fatten.

location.town: San Antonio La Cienega, San Felipe del Progreso

loans.name: Svetlana

texts.ru: Светлана, 49 лет, замужем, 4 детей. Она ведет свой бизнес, стартовав в 2011 году с суммы в 30,000 сомов (KGS), благодаря упорному труду Светланы, в ее хозяйстве на сегодняшний день имеется: 4 коровы, 5 овец. Ежемесячный доход составляет 25,000 сомов (KGS). В целях дальнейшего развития своего хозяйства, Светлана обратилась в Банк "Бай-Тушум" за кредитом в сумме 50,000 сом (KGS) на использование кредита на покупку коровы и постройку сарая для скота. Доходы от кредита Светлана планирует вложить в дальнейшее приумножение количества домашней скотины, и покупку автомобиля для ее семьи.
texts.en:
Svetlana is 49 and married with four children. She runs her own business, which she started in 2011 with 30,000 KGS. Thanks to her hard work, she now has four cows and five sheep on her farm, with a monthly income of 25,000 KGS.

With the goal of further developing her business, Svetlana has approached Bai Tushum Bank for a loan of 50,000 KGS. She intends to use the loan amount to purchase a cow and to build a barn for her livestock, and plans to put profits from the loan into further expanding her quantity of livestock and toward buying a family car.

loans.use: to buy a cow and construction materials to build a barn for her livestock

loans.name: Phin's Group

texts.en:
Phin, 58 years old, is a married mother of twelve children; four among them are dependent children that she needs to look after. Phin lives in a rural area located in Mongkul Borey district of Banteay Meanchey province. For 35 years, the main source of her family income is from feeding chickens. To earn more income, Phin also works for other farms. She can earn around 96,000 KHR per day to pay for her family’s needs. 

This is the eighth loan for her group, which consists of two members, with Kiva’s partner VisionFund. The previous loans helped her to have enough money to support her family’s daily needs. She is now leading this group to apply for a loan with a portion to buy food for feeding chickens. She hopes that she could earn more money and expand her current business in the future.

loans.use: to buy food for feeding chickens

location.town: Banteay Meanchey Province, Mongkul Borey District

loans.name: Las Chicualenses Group

texts.en:
Guatemala has many picturesque tourist attractions that draw travelers from all around the world. According to the Community Tourism Alliance in Guatemala, "Nearly 15% of the eligible workforce is engaged in the tourism industry — an industry that comprises nearly one quarter of the national GDP." Many Guatemalans work in this industry because of the popularity of colorful traditional textiles and handicrafts. The large and colorful market in Chichicastenango has drawn tourists for decades. One can find beautiful traditional or modern indigenous clothing in striking colors. 

The Friendship Bridge Trust Bank “Las Chicualenses” is located here, and the women are happy to report that they have received two loans from Kiva lenders that have served them very well. The ladies were able to expand their small businesses, increase inventory and successfully pay back their loans. 

Sebastiana is a 37-year-old member of the Trust Bank who makes and sells backpacks and hats. She is determined to offer more inventory and increase sales and earnings. Sebastiana is requesting a new loan to purchase a large quantity of wool in a variety of colors so that she can create new designs.

Gratitude goes to Kiva lenders for believing in Sebastiana and her friends in the “Chicualenses” Trust Bank. They are poised to step into a brighter future benefiting themselves, their families and their community.

loans.use: to purchase a large quantity of wool in a variety of colors so that she can create new designs.

loans.name: Sen

texts.en: Sen, 29, lives in Kampong Thom Province of Cambodia. She has two children who are currently in school. She is a grocery seller and earns, on average, 3 USD a day. So far, she has been in this type of business for five years. Currently, she wants to extend her business by having a cart for traveling sales. Due to a shortage of money, Sen is applying for a Kiva loan to afford the cart. She is thankful to all lenders for their financial support. She awaits your kindness.

loans.use: to buy a cart

loans.name: Twifo Christians Group

texts.en:
Florence is a 32-year-old woman and is a leader of the Twifo Christians Group. She comes from Twifo Praso in the Central Region of Ghana.  

Florence is married with one child. Her child is currently in school. She is a cosmetics seller and has been in this business for over 13 years. Florence has two employees who assist in the distribution of the goods to customers in the nearby villages. Aside from her cosmetics business, she also owns a rubber store, which provides her with some financial assistance. She is aiming to develop into wholesaling cosmetics in the five years ahead. 

Florence has been a very good client of the field partner since 2007 and to date has a good credit history. Her husband is also a businessman who assists her in the upkeep of the family. 

Florence needs microloan support as additional working capital to buy cosmetics at a wholesale price to meet her customers' demand. Florence thanks all her microlenders for their kind support.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase a wider range of stock in wholesale quantities

loans.name: Kunthea

texts.en:
Kunthea, 31, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a construction worker and earns, on average, 5 USD a day. So far, she has been in this career for five years. 

Kunthea wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. Kunthea is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Isai

texts.es:
Isaí, de 33 años de edad, estudio hasta bachillerato, está soltero, no tiene hijos y vive cerca de sus padres.

Isaí, trabaja como promotor de salud desde hace dos años, estudio bachillerato en salud; su lugar de trabajo está a 10 minutos desde su casa, su horario es de 7:00 a.m. hasta las 4:00 p.m.

Está solicitando un crédito para comprar  48 metros de cerámica para terminar de construir su casa, el préstamo mejorara su condición de vida, ya que acaba de construir y  solo le hacía falta esta parte.

Sus sueños son, terminar de construir su casa, para luego poder casarse y tener un hogar donde poder vivir bien.
texts.en: Isaí is 33 years old and finished secondary school. He is single, has no children and lives near his parents. Isaí has worked as a health promoter for the past two years. His secondary studies were in health. His place of work is 10 minutes from his home.His timetable is from 7 am until 4 pm. He is requesting a loan to buy 48 meters of ceramic tile to finish the construction of his house. The loan will improve his living conditions as he has finished building and only this part is not done. His dreams are, once he finishes his house, to be able to get married and have a place to live well.

loans.use: to buy 48 meters of ceramic tile to complete the construction of his house.

loans.name: Nguon

texts.en:
Nguon, 53, lives in a small community Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother of six children. To make a living and support her family, she manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farm which is located near her house. So far, she has been in this type of business for around ten years. On average, she is able to make an income of 5 USD a day.

Nguon wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use because there is no latrine in her house now. Therefore, she is borrowing a loan from Kiva to build a latrine. By doing this, she can help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and help to lessen environmental deterioration. She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine

loans.name: Loeup

texts.en:
Loeup, 43, lives in a small community of Banteay Meanchey Province, Cambodia. He is a construction worker for 2 years and earns, on average, an earning $ 5.00 UDS a day.
 
He wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in his house. He requests a loan from KIVA to build a latrine to help his family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and lessen environmental deterioration. 

He is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Saran

texts.en:
Saran, 58, lives in a community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother with two children. She manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. On average, she is able to make an income of 2.00 USD a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house. She is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine to help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and  lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Lai

texts.en:
Lai is a 39-year-old widowed rice farmer with three children. She has been cultivating rice for over 16 years. Her children are factory workers. All of them live in the Kampong Speu province in Cambodia. Lai and her children can earn around $16 per day. 

She lacks the finances to buy a motorcycle for her children for commuting to work and family use; therefore, she would like to request a loan. With the motorcycle from the loan, her family will be able to have better traveling conditions and reduce traveling expanses. In the future, she is going to save money to build a fence around her house.

loans.use: to buy a motorcycle for her children for commuting to work and family use

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy root vegetables (potatoes)

loans.name: Mazahua Group

texts.es:
Los integrantes del grupo son dos personas muy trabajadoras, siempre en busca de mejores oportunidades. La comunidad donde viven es de origen mazahua, motivo por el cual eligieron el nombre. Ellos aún conservan su lengua materna y algunas tradiciones. 
Don Fortino es un campesino muy alegre, tiene 52 años de edad y está casada con la señora Catalina. Ellos formaron una familia con siete hijos, hoy en día todos son independientes. 
Con cierta melancolía Don Fortino cuenta como inició su negocio: cuando sus niños eran pequeños él trabaja como albañil en la capital del país, sin embargo no le agradaba mucho estar lejos de su familia ni los gastos que implicaba viajar desde la comunidad hasta la Ciudad de México.  
“Mi esposa comenzó a vender verduras, frutas y abarrotes en un burro. Recorría las calles y ofrecía los productos de casa en casa”. Entonces, don Fortino se unió a la actividad aunque él vendía principalmente chicharrones, dulces y refrescos. Se apoyaba con un diablito que ataba a dos burros para transportar la mercancía. Con el paso del tiempo, las ganancias eran suficientes para cubrir todas las necesidades de la familia. “Con un pequeño ahorro pude comprar una camioneta vieja porque realmente nos hacía falta para trasladar la mercancía” comentó Fortino. Hace 15 años, la pareja abrió una pequeña tienda de abarrotes donde también venden frutas, verduras y chicharrones. 
Fortino se muestra muy agradecido con Kiva y VisionFund porque durante tres años le han otorgado préstamos para invertir en su negocio como ahora que tendrá la oportunidad de comprar más productos de abarrotes como pan, huevo, leche, aceite, productos enlatados, etc.
La nueva meta de Don Fortino, es ahorrar parte de sus ganancias para comprar una nueva camioneta para su familia. 
María de los Ángeles, la otra integrante del grupo está solicitando un préstamo para poder invertir en su propia tienda de abarrotes.
*La fotografía fue tomada en la tienda de abarrotes de Don Fortino*
texts.en:
The members of this group are two very hardworking people, always looking for better opportunities.  The community where they live is of Mazahua origin, which is how they chose their name.  They still conserve their native language and some traditions.

Don Fortino is a very happy country man.  He is 52 years old and married to Catalina.  They formed a family of seven children, who are now all independent.  With a certain sadness, he recounts how he began his business: When his children were young, he worked as a mason in the country's capital; however, he didn't like being so far from his family or the expenses incurred from traveling from his community to Mexico City.  "My wife began selling vegetables, fruits, and other groceries on a donkey.  She traveled through the streets and offered her products from house to house."  So, Don Fortino joined in this work, although he sold mainly pork rinds, sweets, and beverages.  He was helped by a small cart that he tied to two donkeys to transport the merchandise. With the passage of time, the income was sufficient to cover the family's necessities. "With a little savings we could purchase an old van because we needed it to transport the merchandise," commented Fortino.  Fifteen years ago, the couple opened a small grocery store where they also sold fruits, vegetables, and pork rinds.  Fortino has shown a lot of gratitude to Kiva and VisionFund because during these three years, they have offered him loans to invest in his business and now he will have the opportunity to purchase more grocery products like bread, eggs, milk, oil, canned goods, etc.  Don Fortino's new goal is to save part of his earnings to purchase a new van for his family. María de los Ángeles, the other group member, is requesting a loan to invest in her own grocery store.

*The photograph was taken in Don Fortino's grocery store.*

loans.use: to purchase groceries such as bread, eggs, milk, fruit, and vegetables, etc.

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
Maria tiene 51 años de edad, es madre soltera, tiene 1 hijo, vive con su familia en el distrito de La Florida en la provincia de San Miguel, región Cajamarca, en la sierra norte de Perú. Esta es una comunidad donde la vida es tranquila y los pobladores se dedican a la agricultura, comercio y crianza de animales.

Ella se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de animales como patos, pollos, gallos, gallinas, cerdos, etc; cuenta con más de 10 años de experiencia en el negocio, su negocio está ubicado en su mismo domicilio. Solicita préstamo para la compra de más animales para incrementar el stock de su negocio, dicha inversión le servirá para tener mayor diversidad y variedad de animales, con gran influencia en el negocio, con esto Maria espera mejorar la productividad de los animales para poder atender las diversas necesidades y gustos de los clientes de la zona lo que incrementará su nivel de ventas y por ende le va a permitir mejorar su calidad de vida.
texts.en:
Maria is 51 years old and is the single mother of one child. She lives with her family in the district of La Florida in the province of San Miguel, Cajamarca region in the North Andes of Peru. It is a community where life is quiet and it's inhabitants work in agriculture, commerce and raising animals.

Maria works raising and selling animals like ducks, chickens, roosters, chicks, pigs, etc. and she has more than 10 years experience in this field. Her business is located at her house. She is requesting a loan to buy more animals to increase the stock of her business.

This investment will help her to have greater diversity and variety in her animals which will have great influence on her business. Doing this Maria hopes to improve the productivity of her animals to be able to attend to the different needs and tastes of her clients in the area. This will increase her level of sales and in the end allow her to improve her quality of living.

loans.use: to buy more animals to increase the stock of her business.

loans.name: Nun

texts.en:
Nun, 25, lives in a small community of Pursat Province, Cambodia. She is a lovely mother with two children. She manages and operates a farming business on a small rice farmland which is located near her house. On average, she is able to make an income of 5.00 USD a day.

She wants to improve the general living conditions of the entire family by having a latrine to use, because there is no latrine in her house. She is borrowing a loan from KIVA to build a latrine to help her family members gain access to sanitation, promote their health, and  lessen environmental deterioration. 

She is thankful for the loan granted through HKL with a much lower interest rate than other general loan products.

loans.use: to build a latrine.

loans.name: Abraham

texts.en:
Abraham is grateful that he was granted a 25,000 PHP loan which he used to buy merchandise items for his direct selling business and materials for his rag-making business. He is able to support his family and meet his family's daily basic needs.

He would like to apply for 25,000 PHP  to buy more fabric, scrap cloth, thread, and other materials needed to sew  rags. He also will pay for personal products to meet customer orders. His round, palm sized rags are useful in cleaning cabinets and kitchen counters. They are useful for housekeeping and cleaning and are changed constantly to ensure a bacteria free rag. 

He is thanks God and you in advance for the financial help that will be given to him. His earnings will cover his daily needs and fund his children's schooling.

Abraham aims to expand his business and wants to be a channel of blessing to those who are in need. He wants his children to get a college education and become professionals. He  meets weekly with his co-fellowship* members to share stories of his work  and draw strength and inspiration from the Word of God he studies.

 *All CCT community partners / clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital and repay Micro Finance loans.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics, thread, and supplies.

loans.name: Segundo Lorenzo

texts.es:
Segundo tiene 54 años de edad es casado tiene 3 hijos vive en Echeandia Provincia de Bolivar, pertenece a la ventanilla rural Virgen de Guadalupe. 
Segundo se dedica a la Cerrajería. Solicita el crédito para la compra de materia prima madera, la misma que va a invertir en su negocio. La compra lo realiza en Ventanas. Su meta es mas ingresos para el bienestar de la familia. Su desafío es prosperar en la vida para el futuro. En su tiempo libre le gusta estar con su familia y hacer deporte.
texts.en:
Segundo is 54 years old, married, and has three children. They live in the Echeandia Provincia de Bolivar, which belongs to rural district of the Virgin of Guadalupe.

Segundo makes a living as a locksmith. He is asking for a loan in order to purchase materials, such as wood, so he can invest in his business. He will purchase his materials in Ventanas.

His goal is to increase his earnings for the well-being of his family. His challenge in life is to have a prosperous future.

In his free time, he likes to be with his family and practice sports.

loans.use: to buy basic materials (wood).

loans.name: Walter Danilo Miguel

texts.es:
Walter, ha mejorado su negocio de venta de CDS y DVDS en las ferias con la buena administración de los créditos, ofrece nuevos productos a sus clientes y tiene mejores utilidades.
Solicita un nuevo crédito para comprar aceite, papas, queso, aderezos, artesanías, juguetes, DVS y CDS, elaborara la venta de papas fritas y tendrá mercadería suficiente para vender en las ferias.
texts.en: Walter has improved his sales of CD's and DVDs at markets with the good administration of his loans. He can offer new products to his clients and he has higher profits. He is requesting a new loan to buy oil, potatoes, cheese, dressing, handicrafts, toys, CD's and DVDs to make his french fries sales and have enough merchandise for the markets.

loans.use: to buy oil, potatoes, cheese, dressings, handicrafts, toys, DVDs and CD's to make his french fries sales and have enough merchandise to sell at markets.

loans.name: Sokchan's Group

texts.en:
Sokchan has two school-aged children and lives in Kratie province, Sokchan is 29 years old and grows rice and sews clothes to earn more income. 

This is her second cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid back her previous loan. She leads a group of two to receive a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her entire loan portion to buy seed to support her farmland. She hopes that she can a better yield than last year.

loans.use: to buy seed.

loans.name: Kyar Kone Village

texts.en:
Pictured above are the CBO members from Kyar Kone group, named (from left to right) Tin, Chit, Neing, San and Sandar.  The Featured Borrower, Tin, has a 10 acre farm in the Delta region of Myanmar, and like many farmers in this area, savings are low before the harvest season.  

The loan will help him purchase the necessary farming resources he needs before harvest.  Tin is 62 years old, married, and supports a family of ten (eight children), the youngest of whom is in 9th grade. Part of the family’s income goes towards funding the childrens’ education.  

Tin and his family hope to eventually be able to save enough money to rebuild their home for future generations.

The CBO leaders oversee a group of 34 borrower in their village.  The fund will help the group purchase farming essentials before harvest time.  Kyar Kone Village’s main focus is crop farming, as well as other  seasonal foods. They also raise livestock such as ducks and pigs for additional income.

loans.use: to rent farm equipment, purchase petrol for farm equipment, and hire farm staff.

loans.name: Pok's Group

texts.en:
Pok is a 31-year-old  local farmer living in Siem Reap province.  She has four children and grows rice and cassava. She has farmed for ages and earns about 20,000 KHR per day. This is her third loan cycle with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner) and she has successfully repaid her previous  loan. 

She leads a two-member group and will spend her loan portion to buy rice seed and pay for plowing. She hopes that she can earn more income and improve her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy rice seed and pay for plowing.

location.town: Siem Reap Province, Srey Snom district

loans.name: Sophy

texts.en:
Sophy is a 39-year-old woman  living in Battambang province.  She has five children and supports three children, one attends school and other two are too young. 

She grows rice on three hectares area and works for others for a fee to earn extra income. She has involved this business for ages and earns about 41,700 KHR per day. This is first time for Sophy with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). She will use the loan to buy fertilizer, seed, and pay for plowing. 

She hopes that she can earn more income and improve her family's living conditions.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer, seed, and pay for plowing.

loans.name: Ret's Group

texts.en:
A resident living in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Ret is 38 years old and a married mother of six children, three of whom are dependent on her. For a living, she grows cassava as the main source of income. She also works as a paid worker to supplement her family’s income. 

For Ret, this is her eighth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loans. She leads a group of two to get a new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to pay for fertilizers and rent and plow the farmland to grow cassava. She hopes that she can earn more income to renovate her house.

loans.use: to pay for fertilizers and rent and plow the farmland to grow cassava

loans.name: Seang's Group

texts.en:
Seang, 42, is a farmer living in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. She is a married mother with two children, one of whom is dependent on her. She struggles for a living via raising four pigs as the main source of income. To supplement her income, she also sells discarded materials. 

This is her eighth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loans. In a group of four, she is a group leader. She will spend her loan portion to buy piglets to bring up and food for the pigs. She hopes that she can earn more income and have enough ability to buy a new motorbike to support her business.

loans.use: to buy piglets to bring up and food for the pigs

loans.name: Norn's Group

texts.en:
Norn, 43, lives with family members in a rural village of the Battambang province. She is a mother of three children. She grows rice and cassava as the main source of income. Moreover, she can earn more income via working for others for a fee. 

This is her first time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner). In a group of two, she is the group leader. She will spend her entire loan portion to buy seeds and pay for the plowing fee. She hopes that she can get more income to update her lifestyle.

loans.use: to buy seeds and pay for the plowing fee.

loans.name: Nhat's Group

texts.en:
A local farmer from Thmor Koul district of Battambang province, Nhat is 47 years old and a mother of four children, two of whom are dependent on her. To support her family conditions, she raises pigs as the main source of income. Sometimes, she works as a paid worker to supplement her income. 

For Nhat, this is her twelfth time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she fully repaid her past loans. As the group leader of two members, she will spend her loan portion to buy food for the pigs and to buy more piglets bring up. She hopes that she can get more income and have enough ability to afford a new motorbike to support her business.

loans.use: to buy food for the pigs and to buy more piglets bring up

loans.name: Saroeurb's Group

texts.en:
Living with family members in a rural area of the Battambang province, Saroeurb is 39 years old. She is a mother of three children, one of whom is in school, and the other two are too young. For her living, she grows rice and works for others for a fee to earn more income. She has been involved in this business for ages, and it earns her about 30,600 KHR per day. 

This is the fifth loan cycle for Saroeurb with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and she has fully repaid her past loans completely. She leads a group of two to get new loan. As the group leader, she will spend her loan portion to buy fertilizer to support her farm. She hopes that she can get more income to improve her living, better than before.

loans.use: to buy fertilizer to support her farm.

loans.name: Jose Manuel

texts.es:
José, está acompañado, vive con su pareja, por el momento no tienen hijos, práctica las actividades de elaboración de estructuras metálicas y prendas de vestir, su fuerte es trabajar en el taller de metales, el negocio lo tiene formalizado desde hace ocho años, es así como ha disminuido las necesidades de su familia y ha mejorado su equipo.
Comprará láminas, hierro, tubos, pintura y electrodos, tendrá material para elaborar puertas y ventanas que sus clientes le han encargado, espera realizar su trabajo en el tiempo justo y con mayor calidad.
Sus sueños son tener nuevos clientes, adquirir experiencia en el uso de créditos y tener un estilo de vida mucho más digno junto a su compañera de vida.
texts.en:
José is in a relationship and he lives with his girlfriend. They currently do not have any children. He makes a living by making metal structures and clothing accessories. He formalized his metallurgy business 8 years ago, and he has been able to provide for his family and to improve his equipment in that time.

With the loan today, he will purchase laminates, iron, tubes, paint, electrodes and more material that he will use to fabricate doors and windows for his clients. He goals are to provide quality work in a reasonable amount of time.

His dreams are to attract more customers, get experience in using loans and to improve the quality of life for himself and his partner.

loans.use: purchase laminates, iron, paint, electrodes and prime materials to manufacture doors and windows.

loans.name: Channa's Group

texts.en:
Channa is a 24-year-old married man living in Thmor Koul district of Battambang province. He and his wife struggle to earn a living by growing rice. He also works as a policeman to supplement income.

This is Channa's second time with VisionFund (Kiva’s partner), and he fully repaid his past loan. In a group of two, he is the group leader. He will spend his loan portion to buy rice seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers and to plow the rice farm. He hopes that he can earn more income to renovate a house to be as good as others.

loans.use: to buy rice seeds, pesticides, and fertilizers and to plow the rice farm.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to buy more sugarcane to support her juice-selling business.
